The CGI is unpolished and poorly executed.Personal Entertainment Rating(IMDb): 2/10
Movie Rating(LetterBoxd): 4/10

I don't really know a lot about this movie because I turned the TV off 15 minutes into the movie. However, I can tell you that this movie is absolute garbage.
I would rather drink bleach than watch movie.

reviews.review_title: No nearly as bad as I had heard
reviews.content: I don't know if it was low expectations or what but this movie is not nearly as bad as I had heard. The child actress was the best part of the show. I guess they could have had some more spectacular effects but they were okay.

reviews.review_title: A Wonder-Filled,Gloriously Shot,Beautifully Acted,Thoughtfully Updated Adaptation
reviews.content: I suppose if there's one thing this review page for A Wrinkle in Time proves, it is that the IT is alive and well and trolling on IMDB. A Wrinkle in Time has been one of my favorite books since the day that I read it more than thirty years ago, and now this adaptations is one of my favorite movies. The film is visually stunning to look at, but it is no air-headed beauty -- it is full of substance and grace and grounded deeply in the authentic emotions the actors bring so beautifully to their performances. Some people seem to be unreasonably upset that the movie is different than the book in some ways -- but the point of an adaptation is to translate the spirit of the source material, not dictate every moment word for word. It is impossile for an adaptation to be the exact same experience as reading a book -- they are not meant to be. The mediums are meant to be enjoyed for their own distinct merits, and I for one love this film for the way it honors the book while bringing fresh insight and understanding to the story in a visually stunning and emotinally satisfying way. Moreover, I appreciate all of the filmmakers for how their obvious care and attention and love for the source material infuses every scene.I encourage anyone considering watching this movie to do so with an open heart and mind, unburdened by the fear of change and the weight of unrealistic expectations. Allow yourself to be surprised by the journey, and embrace the movie for what it is: a freaking cool adventure flick that just also happens to be a call to be a light in this world by seeing the good in ourselves and others, and to fight the darkeness of negativity, hate, and fear by refusing to give in to them.

reviews.review_title: If I was Satan watching this movie for eternity would be my punishment for everyone who comes to Hell.
reviews.content: Don't waste your time or money. The acting was horrendous. The plot made no sense. This movie was soulless and whoever took part in making this hot piece of garbage should feel bad.
This movie was great. It was very heartwarming to me, I thought the acting was good, it was funny, it was interesting, I really reocomend

reviews.review_title: Oprah shoving new age ideology down our throats
reviews.content: That should probably be the official movie description, as that about sums it up

reviews.review_title: Looks Great But A Little Confusing
reviews.content:
I saw "A Wrinkle in Time", starring Storm Reid-Sleight, 12 Years a Slave; Oprah Winfrey-Selma, The Color Purple; Reese Witherspoon-Hot Pursuit, This Means War; Mindy Kaling-The Mindy Project_tv, No Strings Attached and Chris Pine-Wonder Woman, This Means War.
This is a Disney movie that is based on a 2003 book, written by Madeleine L'Engle. I have not read the book-and am probably not the target audience-but I thought the movie looked great and had a good story about bullying and having family to depend on, although it was a little confusing at times. Storm plays the daughter of Chris, a brilliant man that is working on a new form of space travel. It uses what they call tesseracts, sort of like teleporting from one place to another. One day, Chris disappears and no one has a clue-I guess they weren't paying attention to what he was studying. About 4 years later, Storm gets a visit from Reese, who tells her that she knows how to find Storm's father. Reese is one of a trio, including Mindy and Oprah, and they all have weird names, like Mrs Whatsit, Mrs Who and Mrs Which. The effects are great but sometimes, it gets a little confusing as to what is going on.
It's rated "PG" for thematic elements and some peril and has a running time of 1 hour & 49 minutes.
It's not one that I would buy on DVD but I guess if you are a fan of the book, you might enjoy it more than I did. It would be a good rental, just for the scenery.

reviews.review_title: Why did this masterpiece get bad reviews?!?
reviews.content: I really like A Wrinkle in Time. It is a charming and creative adaption of Madame L'Engle's lovely and imaginative novel. The great themes are shown well, the characters are interesting, the storytelling is very good, and the dialogue is decent. This movie is very entertaining and amusing. To me, this movie is an recent underrated classic.

You could put all the stars in the universe into this movie and it'll still be a complete waste of time. Whether you read the book or not, a movie script that is well written should easily draw the viewer in to the story. This movie does the complete opposite! Very poor screenplay adaptation and whoever directed this needs to direct laxative commercials since that's what you'll be needing after watching this. The visual effects were good and costumes were good but everything else is awful! My only positive is that I watched this on Netflix and didn't waste too much money watching it in the theater. Make sure your calculations are correct and you may be lucky enough to tesser yourself out of watching this horrible movie!

When it comes sci-fi films Disney has a poor recent track record. Tron: Legacy, John Carter, and Tomorrowland were all flops that were met with a mix reaction. A Wrinkle in Time follows that trajectory and is particularly hated by fans of the novel. It was a such a flop that it didn't get a Blu-ray release in the UK and in some countries not even a theatrical release.I have not read the novel so I can only the film on its own merits. It is not deserving of a weak 4.2 on IMDB and it should be somewhere in the 6 range. The film was a visual spectacle with strong CGI and bright colours. It film itself was basically a Doctor Who style fantasy and is it possibly why I'm not that hostile to the film.However, the film shouldn't have centred itself around a child actor who well, couldn't act and Mindy Kaling was irritating speaking in quotes.

I'm sooooo freaking disappointed with this movie. It's a DISNEY movie but it seemed like it was low budget, sooo poorly done, especially the dialog... Kinda visually pleasing in VERY FEW ways but other than that. Boring.

reviews.review_title: Hope you see it with an open mind
reviews.content: What a great film and very enjoyable for my 2 kids and myself. I expected the hatred towards the film and you can see that in the reviews, mainly the first and earlier reviews of people waiting to review a film they never actually saw. The movie indeed starts slowly as it develops its characters and then gets going after that. I have not read the book and I could care less about the race of any of the actors. The storyline is exactly what we all need and I hope to play this movie every year for my kids so we can discuss it. Here is a positive movie about light triumphing over dark, plain and simple, and its done in a fun way.

reviews.review_title: Better than most live action Disney
reviews.content: A Wrinkle in Time is surprisingly better than most live action Disney movies. Storm Reid and Chris Pine give great performances and have effectively emotional scenes. The CG is great and Ava DuVernay's direction is really good. However, it's brought down by bad supporting performances from Reese Witherspoon and Mindy Kaling.

Don't wast your time on this movie please.
There is nothing in this movie to watch.Just a wast of time.

The movie was visually spectacular. Many characters, including all three of the "Mrs." were visually different than the original book. But it worked. They were wild, weird and wonderful.Until we get to Camazotz. In the original book, Camazotz was, in gamer terms, lawful evil. Perfectly controlled, with all individuality wiped out. These were regular people, like us, except that a child who drops a ball is an "Aberration" and must be "Reprocessed" so that he will never again desire to "deviate". IT claimed that it had achieved peace by eliminating all differences.In the movie, Camazotz was chaotic evil. Deserts randomly turned into tornadoes randomly turned into housing developments randomly turned into crowded beaches. It wasn't clear that any of the people were anything but an illusion. The only bit that was done right was the perfect neighborhood with the bouncing balls. Actors were of different skin tones, but were otherwise identical in facial expression, dress, etc. Creepy and very much true to the source material. But then it just folded away like it was all an illusion. Which completely undid the point.In the book, IT forced mindless compliance and called it peace. Meg saved her little brother through the one thing IT couldn't understand (or control): love. 
Given the number of people (across the political spectrum) who are trying to force orderly compliance, I was really hoping that the movie would do justice to these themes. Instead, it ran more with a trite "love yourself, love conquers all" kind of message. Trite and nearly meaningless.The screenwriters evidently missed the point of the book. Too bad. It is an excellent book.
Beautiful, and touching. Don't listen to hateful trolls.

reviews.review_title: So much potential lost in CGI and mangled details
reviews.content: Problems: 1) the Aunt Beast episode was missing, 2) the list of Earth's warriors against the darkness was given by the Ms's, not by the children (encouraged by the Ms's), 3) the list omitted any spiritual warriors, which in L'Engle's book begins with Jesus, 4) IT as a giant brain is missing, but instead is simply referred to as a kind of off-scene mind-controlling entity, 5) all we see of Camazotz is the ball-bouncing scene.(1) is important in teaching the viewers, and Meg, that not all good things, and our allies against evil, are externally beautiful on first sight. Also, from there Meg travels by herself back to Camazotz to rescue Charles Wallace, but in the film she is left there by mistake. This fact, along with (2), is important because it's part of her maturation, her learning that the truth, and the ability to fight darkness, is already inside her, inside all of us; but in the film the list of warriors is just part of a lesson from the Ms's. In the book, the Ms's are more Socratic, maieutic, guiding us to recognize truths we already know in another form. This is briefly referenced in the film in a kind of flashback Meg or the children together have when being told about the darkness, and they recognize it in many little petty events in their lives (bullies, adults with conflicts), so the film doesn't get this completely wrong, but is not consistent about the point. (3) is important to the author's vision. I very much sympathize with the intention to make the story more ecumenical, and indeed if I were writing the list it might not include Jesus, or not put him first. But it's not my list, it's L'Engle's, and we should respect that. (4) makes IT too abstract, when the power of the book is to make evil, the darkness, the thing, visible in a variety of weird yet concrete forms, while always reminding us that it, and the fight against it, takes many other concrete forms which we must learn to recognize. (5) similarly makes Camazotz too abstract, and less of a real planet. The ball-bouncing is preceded in the film by a ridiculous scene of tornadoes threatening the children (in the book the danger is not physical but mental/spiritual); and it is followed by an (illusory/dreamlike?) scene on a beach which doesn't capture Camazotz's austerity at all.IMO, the 2003 TV-film version was thematically better; it added a longish illusion/dream sequence at the end which was not in the book, but which stayed closer to the book's messages/themes than the changes in the new one.

There are too many movies that stick in a couple of "stars" and think that will make the movie successful. Oprah and Reese added little to nothing to this movie. Disney would have been better off using some talented younger actors. Go to a good dollar movie or rent a good one to watch at home and save the $50.00.

reviews.review_title: Wrinkle in time I'm never getting back!
reviews.content: So much focus on being woke there isn't actually a story to follow. I can only assume the Director was working on this whilst also holding down a job at Burger King. Its just beyond hopeless.

reviews.review_title: Disney's A Wrinkle In Time Aims High, But Falls Short
reviews.content: A Wrinkle In Time is a children's book by Madeleine L'Engle that blends science-fiction and fantasy. It's also remarkable for featuring a female protagonist with a majority-female supporting cast all the way back in 1962. It follows Meg Murry on a journey across the cosmos to rescue her father. The book's gentle thrills and spiritual themes have made it loved by many, including by myself. It's also quite surreal, dealing in abstracts and ambiguous descriptions. As a result it has long been considered "unfilmable." That word has never stopped filmmakers before though! So, now we get a crack at it directed by Ava DuVernay, with screenplay by Jennifer Lee and Jeff Stockwell. How did they do? Let's take a look and see...A Wrinkle In Time opens with Meg, played by Storm Reid, remembering her father (Chris Pine). He disappeared four years ago, leaving no trace. She's ended up troubled at school, but while people around her have accepted that he's gone, Meg refuses to give up her hope. Her hope is rewarded when her younger brother Charles Wallace (Deric McCabe) brings home a friend. This friend is a woman who calls herself Mrs. Whatsit (Reese Witherspoon). She's joined by Mrs. Who (Mindy Kaling) and Mrs. Which (Oprah Winfrey). She informs the kids that their father is, in fact, alive. But, he will need their help to escape the clutches of a cruel force known as the Darkness. Meg and Charles Wallace thus have to venture out, joined by Meg's friend Calvin (Levi Miller), to save him.So first I want to praise the movie's strengths. Nowhere is it stronger than in the visuals. A Wrinkle in Time boasts delightful scenery, and looks wonderful at every angle. The effects used for the tesseracts - pathways that allow instant travel around the cosmos - look fun and surreal. I found myself especially impressed by the planet Uriel, a utopian garden world with soaring mountains and lush plant life. Between the visual artists, costuming, and make-up, a lot of people deserve to feel proud of their work here...Read the rest at https://www.gouldenbean.com/wrinkle-in-time-review

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: This movie is truly terrible. A waste of time. The young actors have no talent and the dialogue is laughable. Why Oprah got involved in this disaster is beyond me. Even the special effects seemed cheesy. Don't waste two hours of your life on this movie.

reviews.review_title: Far too much left out of the book
reviews.content: The book dragged a bit due to a lot of detail but was a good read. The movie was way too short, missing some critical components from the book, which made it a completely different story.Spoiler alert... An example is the scene of the children playing outside their houses. This relevance goes completely unexplained as the next part of the book - the man in the 'Central Central Intelligence' - is a critical part of the explanation.Another part that was an issue for me, was the lead up to the final hero-winning-the-day bit. The book takes a few chapters to build up to this, which makes the final bit work well, the movies - straight to it with little to no build up.On a positive note, it was well filmed, great costumes and brilliant CGI. Acting was passable. If you have not read the book, it may be vaguely entertaining, but if you have read it... expect to be very disappointed.

reviews.review_title: This Is not a True Disney movie, I'ts an endless Black pit
reviews.content: I have 2 Phd's and this movie made no sense at all. The Science is wrong, the idea is wrong, the leading actress has no charisma, the script makes no sense, the director got Lost in translation. Everything about this movie is wrong. I have no idea how this turd made it past preproduction. Sad to see a movie that uses the word love so many times, can be so lifeless and without passion. Please dont waste even a moment of your time with this garbage. Life is indeed to short and beautiful to do so.

I enjoyed this beautiful movie! Why all this hate for this movie? It seems this movie in under attack for reasons that have nothing to do with Art. And where are all the Bruhs that showed up for Black Panther with their kids but are absent for a movie that shows a girl excelling in Math and Science?

I really don't understand what everyone's talking about, this movie was really good. Sure it didn't stick perfectly to the book but what book adaptation does? I read everyone's complaints about Oprah, but she really doesn't ruin the movie or anything. At most she's obnoxious. The script was well written and the acting was believable, to the point where the entire class was convinced that two of the characters would be perfect for each other and others were just waiting for Meg to see her father again so the family would be back together. Conclusively this movie was great and besides here I've never heard a bad review.

I don't know the book at all, but even given that, I can't imagine this wooden, soulless mishmash of nothing does it any service. Two writers are credited on this - what did they do, spend all their time challenging each other on Candy Crush? And the acting... I don't know the lead actress playing the heroine, but she spends the whole movie with one expression - blank staring. The older actresses are all chronically overacting, probably in some attempt to give it life. Even when there is a group of them together it's as if they are delivering lines in an an animation voice studio and they are not actually present or relating to each other. At one point the young brother reappears after being separated and there is zero reaction. The whole film is like that. There are one or two good visual moments, like the sinister children bouncing balls and their Stepford mothers, but otherwise no. It doesn't even have any scientific element to give it some credence. A deeply dull, badly acted, dreadfully scripted big pretty bauble of nothing. What a waste of money.

So to caveat this I hated the book too but wow the movie was awful.
Beautiful special effects - but terrible dialogue - terrible edits to the original book - and another "love is the answer to everything" story. Don't waste your time or money.

It was weird, it was a little boring, & it really didn't make a lot of sense in some parts. Acting wasn't all that great from majority of the characters. I have seen the original movie, but it has been a long time. I wasn't a big fan of Charles Wallace or Meg. I love Reese Witherspoon, but I didn't like her in this movie. Kind of bummed, because I was excited to see this movie. So glad I didn't go see it in theaters or buy it. Thank you Netflix you saved me some money, but unfortunately not my time.

In order to find their father as he was laughed at over in his plans, all three must go to another dimension.In order to find their father. They must confront over on the good and evil. And one of the kids gets changed over on it. As the other two kids must stop the other from getting sucked up into that dimension. They are taking for a ride. But it is the main part finding their father.The kid actors saved an otherwise OK movie. But other than that, wait for it on Netflix or the movie channels.

reviews.review_title: Why does this have 1 star reviews, it's so good!
reviews.content: This movie was amazing, one of the best Disney films, amazing acting, great cinematography, so good!

Just like Hunger Games, it didn't take the necessary risks to make it great. I've given it eight stars because the characters and story were well done. The pace was too slow, relied heavily on special affects, and the music was too cerebral. I did miss things that were in the book but not in film, but I've learned to forgive other films for that. I hope they make a sequel and fix things like they did in Hunger Games. I think, possibly someone thought they were making a "girls" movie. It is science fiction adventure movie starring a female and should have been done with the respect they gave a film like Harry Potter.
Special effects are great. The script, storyline, actors are all so terrible.

reviews.review_title: I don't think the director read the book
reviews.content: I'm still confused on how this movie received any awards. From it's scattered excuse for a plot, to it's elementary school acting, it's guarenteed parents will sleep through it, along with their children.

Is it possible to spend a pile of money to shoot a movie and have only an empty shell of an idea to show for it? To direct tired, spent actors as if they're playing parts in an 18th century 2-bit vaudeville act? To pace the story as if it was a rusted old church tower clock ticking over rust and missing teeth? To make a movie that would make the devil sell his soul just so he doesn't have to finish watching it? Sadly, now I know, it is possible.

reviews.review_title: Finally a movie I enjoy with my children.
reviews.content: This movie is extremely family friendly without loads of creepy adult jokes that the children who watch it now won't get until they are older. I enjoyed the fact that they had an interracial couple, along with a diverse cast, something that hopefully can become the norm one day. I never read the book so I cannot compare to how well they stuck to the storyline or not. It encourages kids to believe in themselves even with their faults.

reviews.review_title: Big movie stars do not a movie make

The acting is bad, the plot is all over and even the famous actors were bad, probably in part due to the absolute terrible script. Even some of the weaker Disney films usually have some redeeming qualities, though somehow they manage to make this whole movie feel unbearable and unbelievable. From the way characters interact, the lack of any plot or character build up and the complete waste of time on special effects, it seems clear they spent more time on the effects then actually making the script any good. I wouldn't waste my time on this.

The movie is mostly about "Disguise as You Like" The mistresses are gone when they are mostly needed and they give their command as gift!!!!!!!!!!!! What an awesome way of helping!!!!!!!!!!!!! The Shot where Charles Wallace touches the face of Large Ms Which, it was really awful to watch.... And the direction is so poor and the script was so ridiculous that they had to write same dialogue like "Run Faster" again and again at a sequence.... I wish I could unseen it..... Fully disappointing.....

Disney's latest live-action outing is a dimension-traversing trip that centres on troubled 13-year-old Meg (Storm Reid), as she journeys into the unknown to find her scientist father (Chris Pine) who disappeared four years earlier. Joined by her precocious whizz-kid brother Charles Wallace (Deric McCabe) and cute-guy-next-door Calvin (Levi Miller), our headstrong but vulnerable protagonist must confront both evil otherworldly forces and her own life-blocking emotions. Aiming to be accessible for younger audiences, the core message - internal growth is impossible without self-belief - is hardly new, but, despite a completely on-the-nose delivery, it's also effective. The connective tissue isn't always the best (the less time spent thinking about plot machinations the better), though there's no shortage of thrills and wonder, or heart wrenching payoffs, in the numerous high-concept set pieces. There are parts of this movie that are unintentionally silly and a few of director Ava DuVerney's stylistic choices are dubious (over-sized Oprah Winfrey? standard black-tentacle incarnation of 'evil'?), yet enough goodwill is generated elsewhere to forgive these missteps. DuVerney doesn't hide her influences either, family classics such as Avatar and Wizard of Oz are obvious touchstones whilst more adult-leaning masterpieces like 2001: A Space Odyssey and even The Exorcist ("Charles Wallace is not at home right now") provide inspiration. Reid is an absolute gem in the lead role too, equally convincing in her self-destructive stubbornness to detach from the world as she is in the gradual shift to valuing her strengths, weaknesses and everything in between. She feels right at home sharing the big screen with Hollywood veterans such as Reese Witherspoon and Oprah Winfrey, who, along with comedian Mindy Kaling, play an amusing trio of peculiar beings that guide our heroes on their trek. Ambitious to a fault, A Wrinkle in Time is a family-friendly fantasy saga that wears its heart on its sleeve whilst delivering a visually wondrous, if occasionally scatty, rollercoaster ride.

I grew up loving the book. I saw Disney's previous attempt at adapting this book long ago and detested it, but I was open to giving it a new shot (even if I should have been worried that all the promotion of the movie seemed to ignore L'Engle and the story in favor of celebrating DuVernay and Oprah, in hindsight). I knew audiences weren't loving this movie, and it was already disappearing from theaters, but... oof. Some of the most memorable and meaningful bits of the book were chopped. Mrs Who was cheapened with the updated and uninspired quotes she says. And the themes of the book were dramatically cheapened by focusing on the "believe in urself gurl!!!" theme so obnoxiously. (Did hear the song for the end credits?) There was a selfless love that was a theme of the book that here is largely replaced with prideful self-love. I was also sad to see Mr Murray didn't get to work with and encourage his daughter on Camazotz in this adaptation. That's so key. It's a strong indication DuVernay was exploiting the source to make the cheap points she wanted to make instead of really understanding and honoring the source. Same for dropping the blind & kind creatures that the book had us meet so memorably. Calvin... ugh. Why did they make him so creepy in the movie?Casting major celebs as the Mrss was a dumb move. Their essential quality was a strangeness. By making them the most familiar faces on screen, that dynamic was inverted. So dumb! And their acting was not so hot. I mean, Oprah did okay. Not Reese or Mindy. The 3D was very unenjoyable. Duh. I only saw it in 3D because that showing fit my schedule. There were a few good moments but overall I am very disappointed indeed.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyed the ride it took me on, very interesting blend
reviews.content:
I don't write movie reviews very often at all, but based on the very high number of reviews with a low score, thought this one might be worth the effort.I'm stating the obvious here, but at the end of the day, whether you enjoy a movie or not is a very personal thing and entirely up to yourself.The way I watch a movie is opening myself up to what it is, see where it takes me, and when it's over I assess my appreciation of it. I am also not sold to the idea that movies should be rated from 1 to 10, I much prefer the Google way of saying did you like it, yes or no. With that being said, yes, 8 is my honest score for this movie.Now about the actual movie, it is the type of movie where first you are shown the main characters in the real world, some back story, current situation not so great, then something happens that takes them on a journey in a world that obeys to no defined rules and from there just about anything can happen. Movies that are a blend of fantasy, metaphors on good vs evil, a kind of dream-like feel to them , this is one such movie.I'll name a few movies I believe have a similar style/feel than A Wrinkle of Time:
Neverending Story,
What dream may come,
Warriors of virtue,
Forbidden Kingdom,
Stardust,
(Many more I can't think of right now)This movie presents a different view on the universe, it could very well act as the first in a series of many (very unlikely now with the kind of reviews it is getting).It also delivers some powerful messages and metaphors. For example "nothing travels faster than light except darkness" is used to show how some people let the bad affect them far more than the good.I also don't believe this is a kid movie at all, despite the visuals. I would not recommend this movie for anyone under 15 years old, and they have to be into that type of movies that take you on ride to show things that might seem overly obvious to some. If you hate at least one of the movies I listed above, this might not be for you.I'll end this here, hoping this kind of review will be useful to at least 1 person.

One of the worst movies of all time!
Boring,fake...oprah is a joke

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: After so many years Disney has made a meaningful comeback!
reviews.content: Disney is known for their inspiring movies. They uplift you & make you see in a different light. Their movies are suppose to teach you something new. They are supppse to show you how a perfect world could be. This movie is no exception. I thought Disney forgot how to make a movie or tell a meaningful story but I guess I was wrong. We all missed when they would take us to other worlds and beyond to show us how humanity could believe. I don't understand all the hate. I don't understand the low ratings. This movie has it all. It is inspiring, intellectual it blends science and magic together. Showing us love is a frequency a light that can overcome the darkness which we all yearn to do. Through this movie I felt emotional and at other times I was terrified. The colors are vivid. The story is amazing. After watching this movie I thought to myself maybe Disney isnt done just yet.

Go see for yourself :-)

reviews.review_title: Flat, frustrating, formulaic, and utterly forgettable!

The only person who seemed to be having any fun with her character was Reese Witherspoon. The editing is shoddy, writing and character development formulaic as hell. There's no chemistry between the cast. The acting is wooden. It's just frustrating overall. There's no flow in the story, absolutely no build up to the climax. The vivid colour palette and costumes of the 3 missus are the only memorable things about this otherwise forgettable endeavour. It's all so flat! Such a missed opportunity

I thought that this might actually be good. The Last Jedi was great, and was loathed by full time Star Wars stiffs who spend way too much time earnestly debating the economic trade policies from The Phantom Menace. People who actually just love Star Wars love The Last Jedi. Maybe the latest Disney sci fi outing to get trashed by the anti woke parade could still have some juice. I have no relationship to the novel, and I'm also not a racist. I honestly thought I'd have a lot of fun. Let's take a snapshot 40 minutes in to see exactly how insane the start of the story is: three witches unwittingly led by a five year old trick a depressed preteen and her dim witted sidekick into going on an intergalactic rescue mission to save the preteen's dad, Captain Kirk, who got lost in space years earlier (it's the five year old's dad too, but that kid is doing just fine, because he's a genius astronaut and friend to the local homeless community). The kids get transported from their palatial urban backyard to the grassy knoll from the Windows xp desktop. Once there, we ask some floating flowers where dad's gone, once the flowers gesture towards a lake, one of the witches turns into a flying lettuce and the team jump on her back. Let me pause to say, the shapeshifting transition from Mrs Whatsit, queen of drapes to Mrs Whatsit, flying cabbage monster involves flashing three minors, without their consent and over the protest of the confused sidekick (I'm with this guy, Reese Witherspoon is very beautiful but I do not want to see her naked body transform into literally a giant lettuce). This whole thing should have been great, it doesn't get much nuttier than this. But it wasn't good. It was awful. This is humourless, risk-free, cloying awful nonsense. It just accidentally sounds hilarious in summary. How about on mute, does it look cool? No. Remember Avatar, that movie from about 10 years ago? Yeah, if you're going to make a $100 million CGI spectacle maybe spend the money on the nerds on the computers instead of on Oprah. The first 40 minutes of this movie involves schoolyard bullying and assault with a basketball, emotional manipulation of the mentally ill, sexual harassment and digital environments that look like they're covered in thick plastic. It's not a strong opening lineup. If you think that more believing in yourself is what preteens of today need, you are very welcome to continue on this journey to discover exactly that. I'm afraid to say, while my eyes made it to the end, my heart didn't.The moment that I swerved off and rolled into a deep ravine was when I caught myself thinking about one of these witches, Mrs Who. Mrs Who only speaks in quoted aphorisms and monologues from famous writers, quotes she discovered by reading books after she "evolved past language". Oh, ok, cool. ALL SPEECH IS QUOTATION. You've evolved past language but didn't do first year literary theory? It's an insult! I'm happy for you to appropriate the bajeezus out of this 50-year-old book to put a couple of black characters in it. But how dare you disrespect those of us with literature or creative writing degrees! You might be mistaken early on for thinking that the last witch, Mrs Which, has the unique superpower to shrink and grow really big. In fact, her remarkable ability is to give emotional speeches that are, 100% substance-free. Once she stops speaking, you realise, hey, what did she just say? It's like someone erased a few seconds from my memory. I remember that speech, starting, but where are we now? And it happens again. You open your eyes and suddenly, you're on the floor, and your kids are rushing over to see why you blacked out. What's happening to me? Mrs Which is so emotionally inert, yet still so covered in sparkles, it's the reason this movie gets two stars instead of one. In an ambitious sci fi fantasy spectacle, I was underprepared for just how glossy, incoherent and so aggressively offenseless A Wrinkle in Time would be.

reviews.review_title: The First Time I wanted to walk out of the theater
reviews.content: I did not have faith in this film but I wanted to give it a chance and I regret it because I gave them money when they don't deserve it. The only thing I enjoyed was laughing at how bad it was but I would NEVER watch it again. I was at least hoping for a pretty looking film but they could not even do that right because a lot of the film was fake and cg. So just to recap DONT SEE THIS FILM it will fry your brain and waste your time.

This is a great movie. Thank you so much for bringing one of my favorite books to the screen in such a professional and fun way. A Wrinkle in Time presents enlightening concepts and engages with hope, dreams, challenges and courage. This is the type of movie that you can be proud to take your children too and also it is entertaining and fun for adults. I highly recommend it.

This movie deserves a much higher rating than the one it has. It's well-directed, all the actors does a great performance, especially the kid playing Charles Wallace. The soundtrack is great and the story is gripping. The worlds were really interesting, especially the dark world. There was something so unsettling about the apparent normalcy. The pacing was good and the message was clear and conveyed beautifully. There was stunning scenery and great CGI.So I honestly don't understand what makes people give it a one star rating. It's not a movie that challenges the viewer or brings anything new to the table, and it's very straightforward and simple, but that doesn't mean it deserves only one star. I've seen boring, nonsensical movies get better ratings than this. I haven't read the books so I can't compare this movie to the books, but honestly I think that's a good thing. Because what makes a good book and what makes a good movie are two very different things. The movie made the story work in it's format and it did it really well. And that's all that matters.Overall a really enjoyable and visually stunning movie that I warmly recommend.Lastly, I just loved the crazy costumes and hairstyles of the three ladies. I'm not sure I've ever seen this many female characters with speaking roles who are interesting and important to the plot in one movie before. Not to mention so many black women. It was really nice to see.
I highly recommend people to see the movie's trailer, it's better than the film and only takes you 2:30 minutes, rather than almost 100 minutes feeling confused and embarrassing.

I haven't read the original books, but they're certainly not bad like this movie .
Don't waste your time on this, you guys.

reviews.review_title: Not Even Lady O Can't Save This Bomb
reviews.content: It looks as though Disney is kinda giving up on wasted ideas for a solid kid-friendly movie filled with magic and adventure. However, I wasn't very happy when this adaptation of "A Wrinkle In Time" came out. I saw the movie and just a few short minutes, I walked out of the theater. I'm not saying the movie is bad, but it's just so awfully boring as hell. Every time I heard the name "Christopher Wallace" so many times, it makes the film very cringe. I knew that somethings wrong with this bland adaptation of an iconic children's classic. This is like a Disney Channel daytime talk show more like a Hallmark Sing-Along birthday card.This was supposed to be my biggest anticipated movie of 2018, but according to me and myself only, I chose to re-watch Black Panther again and again. Awesome time to be a badass Marvel fan. A wrinkle In Time is just not worth my time. Despite the acting good but sometimes cheesey, stunning visual effects, great soundtrack, an undermined forgettable script, and a promising great director (Ava DuVernay) who produced 12 Years A Slave and directed Selma (another Oprah-produced movie), I'm afraid Disney just botched the movie so bad because of all the hype surrounding the film's release. I don't know if this is gonna be a sci-fi adventure fantasy film for kids, another Disney fairytale adaptation, a steampunk sci-fi thriller, maybe it just doesn't know when you're marketing the film correctly and timed it the way every Disney movie should offer.FYI, Oprah Winfrey, Storm Reid, Chris Pine, and Reese Witherspoon are the only good saving grace that I loved and their performances wasn't nearly that bad. Conclusion: Probably I should avoid buying it on Blu-Ray, but my mom still loves Oprah very much. So I'd prefer a rental. Still, A Wrinkle In Time is a total box office bust. It could barely break even, but after I read about the domestic box office here in the States, this is a massive disappointment for the undisputed House That Mickey Built probably write-down on half of it's receipts. Better safe than sorry, Disney.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your time even watching at home!
reviews.content: Story goes from point a to z to total F...and viewers have no clue of what happening and why! I never read the book, but I bet, had they instead just shown someone reading the book whole time, it would have been more entertaining than movie. Disney has to understand, just adding fancy and cool visual effects does not mean a great movie experience!!!! People are walking out no matter how good visuals are, because story and acting is so fake and robotic...no one is able to get involved in the story...!

I suppose this is a Disney movie and it should be great. But it turns out this is a boring movie. Poor acting by Meg and Charles Wallace. Yes it does have some well known stars like Chris Pine, Oprah, and Reese. But their actings ruined by poor special fx, storyline, and shots.3 out of 10 stars it is.

reviews.review_title: very good movie i love it
reviews.content: Everything about this movie is moving and inspiring from a girl having trouble in school to magical women helping in her journey. a lot of people say this movie is bad but i think its pretty good. i would highly recommend seeing this film. 10/10 for overall picture and motion quality.

When the movie finished, I was stunned, by how plain the movie was. Knowing the resources behind the making, made it even more dissapointed.
... and at the end, love is the answer, not that I didn't agree with, but it was like a shortcut without good story plot, character development and emotional building.
This movie wanted to centralize its main theme to love, but no feeling whatsoever, Major Dissapointment!

Did ANYONE, ANYONE involved with this movie even read the book? I grew up with this trilogy, using much loved stories to force racial acceptance/integration only backfires. Shame on you Oprah, and the director is so devoid of talent, she probably has a long career ahead of her in Hollywood.

reviews.review_title: May It Fall Into Oblivion Quickly
reviews.content: The novel is no bad deal, combining elements of fantasy and sci-fi, and well, the first movie adaption aired 2003 was not too bad either, but fifteen years later we get this boring, mind-numbing piece, that makes the novel Nobel prize material and the movie from 2003 ready for the Oscar. Yes, there is here and there some production value, but everything else: gone is the wonder, gone are the charismatic heroes, gone is the suspense, but left is, well, not too much to care about. Disney, like those other big players of the movie business, does not care about the company's products anymore but about gains and profits. Shows and movies are not run by the creative department but by the business department and some financial alchemists who try to figure out the recipe for the philosopher's stone of making money. And it shows hard. Just bad.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful and Insightful adaptation...Our family LOVED it!
reviews.content: In my opinion, you either get it or you don't. There are so many powerful and enlightening messages in this movie, but you have to be able to understand them. Not only in your mind, but also in your soul. For those who rate the movie so negatively, I understand. Please don't be offended, but perhaps the messages weren't for you to comprehend at this time. My husband and I took our kids to see this on our last Disney cruise, and we all felt completely different when we walked out of that theater. We purchased the DVD when it was released, and talk about this story often in our house. I feel this movie touched our family in a way that was life changing, and I am extremely grateful for it. :)

reviews.review_title: I want to go back in time and slap myself for thinking this would be good.
reviews.content: This film looked promising so begin with, I had read the book and was pleasantly surprised to find out Disney were to create it.Over time I lost more and more faith as each trailer began to look more an more like an incoherent mess and I found myself saying "That wasn't in the book..."Then I watched it.I found the acting to be mediocre at best and terrible at worst, the plot is barely that and is full of cliches, plot holes and a general "meh we'll figure it out later" attitude. The villain is barely captivating and basically feels like a piece of thin paper. The hero has at least 2 dimensions to her but not enough to flesh her out.This movie is extremely bad, and you should not watch it. EVER.

reviews.review_title: I had to turn it off 10 minutes in.
reviews.content: I turned it off 10 minutes in, it's that bad. It's one of my favorite books so I gave it a second chance which ended in the same result. Shame on Disney for letting us all down again.

Very sad to say that this film was a massive let down. It was visually stunning however the plot started off very confusing and boring and I only enjoyed the film in the last half an hour.
I would happily say I would never watch again and this is the only Disney film I could say this to.

After the disappearance of her scientist father, three peculiar beings send Meg, her brother, and her friend to space in order to find him. A Wrinkle in Time is a bonkers film full a of surreal moments throughout. It is actually quite dark at times with some weird imaginations but we've seen this so many times before with films like Alice in Wonderland and the Wizard of Oz. Unfortunately it never lives up to those films. The characters are dull, the direction is often sloppy, the pace is sometimes slow and the whole structure just feels muddled. It touches on topics like embracing your faults but it mostly fails in its execution. With dated special effects, some lousy makeup and wooden acting it just doesn't do enough to class as a good movie. It's a missed opportunity for Disney.
Dont listen to the critics ! This is a Fantasy Movie and its suppose to drag us inside a mystical world . Stop complaining .

This whole movie only left me puzzled and with a headache. The actors are high quality but perform like they don't understand the concept of acting. The script is chceesy and has no depth. The only thing that was worth the budget for this movie was the costumes. The effects were 1990's quality and that's a compliment. Started four times never finished it #wrinkleintimeillnevergetback
Cool concept, ok child acting can be fun for family, but I didn't like it. visual effects seemed unrealistic and the budget appeared wasted something I wouldn't pay 10 dollars for.

Dear readers, I use my CGV ticket bonus for some movie that is great, I thought before "A Wrinkle in Time" is 9 or 10 stars, but I value this movie just for 6. Sorry. First is because the plot is not so special, as the cinematography and its main story idea. The cinematography is fantastic, thanks to the cinematographer, Tobias A.Schliessler, who was well-known for his work in Beauty and the Beast and Lone Survivor. In this sci-fi movie, the cinematographer is so great, especially when each time the actors are doing tesser thing, that kind of teleportation, to enter the unknown world. I appreciate also for the acting of Reese Whiterspoon, that is always professional and memorable. She is the one!! In this movie, we can see also the newcomers Storm Reid and Deric McCabe, who are funny, energetic, and show their talent on maximum. They are going to be the next superstars!! But this movie still can not reach 7 stars, because the plot is so predictable, not so strong, and gives us the audience wondering, what is the essential of being disappeared and gives risk to his life and family? Well, this movie is about the 4 years disappearance of a father, notable scientist, to the unknown world, but he is trapped there. His children, with the help of magic universe figured by Oprah Winfrey and team, helped them to across the bridge and found him. Because of the lack of the plots, I think this movie can be watched by DVD or just wait in HBO. If the process of this movie had asked JJ Abrams to join to create the plot, maybe this movie would be the greatest movie this year. I hope I can see Reid and McCabe again in SciFi movies, but with more strong plot and more unpredictable ending, because we need more adventure. This world is so stressed, so we need adventure by watching movie.

reviews.review_title: Each to the own, but I genuinely enjoyed it I can't lie
reviews.content: Sweet enough. Just a shame it doesn't finish as great it starts.'A Wrinkle in Time', I think, starts off very nicely. It gives a satisfactory background to the main character, while it builds the intrigue well. Unfortunately, it does drop off as it goes on - but not to the point that it hindered my enjoyment, it is a noticeable step down though. I really like the special effects, I think they look terrific throughout.Onto the cast. Storm Reid does a respectable job as Meg, her performance arguably gets better as things progress - which is the opposite to the film overall. Chris Pine is underused in his role, but the casting of Oprah Winfrey, Reese Witherspoon and Mindy Kaling is good - Zach Galifianakis too. I didn't actually find Deric McCabe's character, Charles Wallace, annoying like most seemingly did.Surprised to see that this has a low rating across the board. I've never read the Madeleine L'Engle novel so perhaps that has something to do with it? I do agree the writing isn't necessarily great either. Each to the own, but I genuinely enjoyed it I can't lie.

reviews.review_title: It is so bad, because it is close to the book and poorly executed
reviews.content:
I have to say I don't really like writing the bad reviews, but with this film I just couldn't keep myself from not saying how I feel about this.
The point is, the book is decades old, and the movie is adapted to current time, taken from there. Yes, many things have changed for the script, but reading the book prior to the movie so I could make an honest judgement made one thing clear.
The book is very weak. it doesn't grab me like other books did. nowhere did I feel any depth in it, or any touching feeling. I did have the same with Narnia, don't get me wrong, but there the story for some reason is less depending on coincidental facts to have things happen. It just wishes to be too much and too special.
The movie gave me the same feeling and I understood why they made some choices for this adaptation. But seriously, were those the only choices you made? well bad choices were made. It all looks so cheap, so fake, so over the top. The costumes are just really badly made, the visuals look unfinished, the script is just proof of bad writing and even the actors don't seem to enjoy making the film. Reese just comes off as she always does, knowing it all better. Mindy struggles to keep her part up and Oprah, well, she's just Oprah with a wig on. You do want to hug her. she's the only one that you feel love from. But then you just expect her to hand out cars to everyone and she also just doesn't hold up the part well.
All in all, this seems to be a bunch of stars having a costumeparty and one of their friends just happens to record it. 
I sat it out, I really did, The book already was a struggle to get through because of the poor writing, but man, how can 1 hour and 40 minutes feel like it cost you your entire weekend and leaves you exhausted.
I was excited for my 9yo to see the movie because I loved the book. Well she will still get to be surprised by the book because the movie was nothing like it. Not good.

Honestly, give me a movie whose graphics and stellar costumes/makeup stimulate my mind any day of the week and I am happy. I loved the cinematic portrayal of the wrinkle, the Misses unique outfits and the chatty flowers were beautiful. 
 Was the acting great? No. Were there giant holes in the plot? Yes. Did they do the book justice? Hell no. 
 Was it pretty and shiny and caught my eye? YES. Do yourself a favour and only watch it for that reason if you go to watch it.
6/10 - great visuals and powerful message, but something just didn't click (along with an overpowering soundtrack)

I've never written a review before, but I felt compelled to do so for this "film." I think the 4.whatever average it has is WAY too high. It was boring, messy, and lacked any of the power and wonder of the book. Even having read the book multiple times, I was uninterested and unable to engage with the characters or the storyline of this "adaptation." Terrible, just terrible. Do not waste your money renting/buying this. In fact, don't even waste your time if you get the opportunity to see it or stream it for free.

reviews.review_title: So disturbingly bad, my lower jaw fell off
reviews.content: One of the WORST movies I have ever seen. As a matter of fact, I have never seen one more horrible. I was left with absolutely NO understanding about how or why the "plot" moved from one random thing to the other. Not one friggin question was answered, not one concept or character developed, that little boy got on my ever-lovin nerves (not his fault -- I blame casting and direction), the adults we're too stereotypically adulty, including those petty teachers who, by the way, are still chattering about in the most obviously falsely put-on and superficially gossipy way about a four year old issue?? There is so much more to be said I'm so perturbed by this horrendous experience that I cannot bear to vent past just the BEGINNING of this, uhh, movie??My teenage daughter STRONGLY warned me about and against seeing this movie; I should have listened but you know what happened to that hard-headed cat. Welp, out of the months of babes...now excuse my while I go bleach my brain. And throw a little peroxide in there for good measure.

reviews.review_title: It's Disney, It Has to Be DECENT...Right?
reviews.content:
That's what I was hoping when I picked this up. I was so very mistaken. I was also thinking "So many female actors? YAS! A message about self-confidence? YAS! An outcast, teen girl with glasses as a main character? HOW RELATABLE!" Oh dear, no.
First off, I'm a huge fan of time/space travel and other sci-fi themes. I, also, have never read the original series, so my expectations were set at "This will probably be a fun kid's movie." Oh God if I had only known the cringe to come.
Everything seemed off. The acting: *main characters waiting for lost little brother after a HUGE FREAKING TORNADO STORM THING* *lost little brother finally arrives safe and sound* *reaction: oh, hey, there he is*.....WHAT? The "romance" (if you can call it that): *teen girl downplays her intelligence* *teen boy:"you have no idea how amazing you are, do you?"* *camera zooms in on teen boy trying REALLY hard to make a sexy, seductive face*......is he constipated?
I saw other reviewers saying "It's a kid's movie, you have to see it as that." I wouldn't let my kid watch this if I had one. Yeah, honey, just go with the first guy that's relatively nice to you. Your disinterest in him doesn't matter so long as he compliments your hair.
I agree with other reviewers in that this movie felt rushed. The pros were that it was pretty and the general message was decent. The cons were everything else.

reviews.review_title: Too simple concept of Sci Fi
reviews.content: Dear readers, I use my movie ticket bonus to watch A Wrinke In Time, as the expectation that this movie will be like JJ Abrams's or Alex Garland's, but I feel I watch just dramatic movie, not a Sci Fi movie. So in this movie, the main story is to find a scientist father who were trapped in dark energy and could not come back. The daughter, son, and daughter's friend, together with the magical aid of Oprah Winfrey, as manifested of light energy and other companions, are successful to find the father, but the journey continues, as the dark energy is coming too faster and faster to influence the little son, to contradict of himself and attack his family. The main story is great with great cinematographer, the former cinematographer for Beauty and the Beast, but the plots are quite boring and lack of effects for Sci Fi standard. I can understand maybe the Director would like to deliver a Sci Fi movie with the normal touch, not too much, but this way is failed to impress the audience. For me, this is not a Sci Fi movie, but just a drama movie, with the touch of Sci Fi. Those two genres are really different. I hope Ava Duvernay would never stop to create other real Sci Fi movies and the newcomers can be superstar in this millennial time. We appreciate all the crew in this movie, but I can objectively said that this movie has too simple concept of Sci Fi.

I don't understand what the all bad reviews were about. This movie was cute yet inspiring, with a good message . I remember reading some of the book as a child. I'm an 18 year old who enjoyed the movie on Netflix lol. The character are a bit weird/odd and ur thrusted full force into everything it that's what makes it great. The visuals are also very amazing. I say give this movie a chance if ur interested and see for yourself. Let me bevthe one good review ig.

One more to the list of worst movies ever..
All wrong..

That was pretty much the emotion it evokes the most. Everyone is a Mary Sue character you can't form emotional connections with. They basically only have two emotions displayed through the entire movie: "self-satisfied beatific smile" and "open-mouthed awe".Such a waste with the actors and special effects. This could have been excellent, if only the movie didn't have a target audience of a 4-year old child.

reviews.review_title: Disney's Horribly Sanitized Interpretation Missed the Mark
reviews.content: As a fan of L'Engle's novels growing up, I had such high hopes going into the movie; however, I should have heeded the warnings I had heard prior to purchasing my ticket. The film was choppy, leaving out many of the important plots and aspects of the novel, including the character development and spirituality. In fact, the movie did a complete 180 with the spirituality that completely left those who are most deeply aware of L'Engle's work completely lost. While I applaud some of the tweaks the director made, such as making the family dynamic more applicable to today's society (interracial, adopted child in family), changing things like Mrs. Whatsit from a Centaurian type of creature into a flying lettuce made no sense. I still don't understand what happened with the character of Mrs. Which, other than to over-emphasize the over-inflated ego of Oprah, the changes just fell flat and made the movie insufferable. The sanitization of the movie by Disney to leave out the importance of the book's meaning spiritually goes to show how it has lost it's touch with reality and deeper meaning behind the works it is trying to recreate for the big screen. Just because it wants to make it seem that there is no such thing as a higher power, doesn't mean that the spiritualness of anything has to be dumped at the door.

reviews.review_title: this proves disney can't do anything original
reviews.content: This film is awful the wort film so far this year awful acting random things happen unfunny with whatever humor it did stupid boring the film looks pretty bad i am amazed at how badly the director handled this film.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful story about a young teen woman coming of age!
reviews.content: Wonderful movie. Heroine is a young teen woman who makes a physical journey through space and time with her younger brother and a friend to save her dad, and makes a journey within, discovering her own beauty, strength and power. I'm a fan of the book, and like all movies from books, it is different from the book. The movie captures the spirit and heart of the book. This is a children's movie. There are some scary Stepford wives type scenes and a creepy beach scene - and the It is a scary brain that influences thoughts and emotions. There are no intergalactic spaceship fights, no sword battles, very little physical fighting, the fight is for hearts and minds. I would compare it favorably to the Wizard of Oz, and both versions of the Wiz - even though it is not a musical. Has something in common with the first Spy Kids movie that really had the children as the heroes - that one featured a Latino family. Enjoyed seeing it in a theater filled with children and their parents - the children loved it! At the end, everyone clapped! Do something good for your spirit and go see this film!

This is about what I expect from a Disney's kids movie. The previews made it look a lot better than what it really was. It kind of dragged on.
That being said, I think it's an outrage this movie is getting a worse review than Red Sparrow. 
I mean, of course this movie wasn't going to be super great. It's for children.

Took my little 10 year old nephew and his friends to see this, and they all loved it.
It is filled with wonderful visuals, interesting new characters and scientific ideas that they were able to understand and enjoy. Take note: this movie is intended for kids and tweens, not adults, so if you are expecting to laugh and be entertained as an adult, you probably won't be.

It's been about four years since Meg's father has disappeared and the wounds he left behind to his loved ones are still pretty much unhealed. Having almost given up hope in life, Meg is visited by three peculiar characters which show her how to travel into space, hoping to find her father and end a powerful force which threatens the universe.It's a movie which at first seems very interesting. It has an interesting premise and brings along a couple of fantastic elements which can make almost everyone shiver in excitement. Unfortunately, the implementation is where almost everything goes wrong with this film. The plot is predictable from the start and does little to change even when close to the end. It's very linear and has, at least as far as I'm concerned, a couple of plot-holes which ruin the little logic that his story has. The characters are pretty underdeveloped and even not very likeable, fact which alienates most empathy. The dialog is so simplistic that it left me feeling on many occasions that it was a movie aimed mostly at primary school audience. To make matters worse, every problem the characters face seems to have a tendency of getting solved/forgotten/forgiven way too slowly. Thus, it doesn't bring any sense of satisfaction as something gets solved.To mention some good aspects about it, I have to tell that the visuals are quite amazing. Every world and place that the characters visit is so impressive, filled with vivid colors and great detail, you cannot help but gaze at it. Also on the plus side, it has some good actors which tend to stand out from time to time but the basics of the movie are too weak for them to help its cause. Oh, and it also has a couple of great songs to back it up from time to time.Overall, I have to say that it was a disappointment. A boring set of events without complexity, a couple of simple characters which don't manage to attract feelings from the viewer and a bad way of solving problems in terms of storytelling, leave an interesting set of fantastic worlds a bit shallow. It's no point in having great visuals if you're not going to tell ca compelling and also interesting story along the way. Too bad...
Seriously, don't waste your time, even my kids thought it was boring. There is nothing good I can say about this film. AVOID!

reviews.review_title: Great young actors nand live action film reboot; twins are missing!!!!
reviews.content: The movie has great live action film but viewers are disappointment how film is low because film skipping many characters: Murray twins (not mentioned). The film does have good writing and creative background. The characters show great embodied form novel. The problem is wide lens angle is which the camera screen on one character's face too close. The film remind of Good Place tv show and Angel spin off and Joss Whedon and Miyazaki film.

When this movie first came out, I was noting some pretty negative reviews/ratings for this sadly executed production. I was thinking "haters ..."Well, Storm Reid is excellent in the child lead. Everything else about this movie seems forced and/or stilted and/or fluffy shock. This is a film I wanted to defend and wanted to like. My "5" rating is a little on the generous side. 
Folks, you can "iron out" a lot of wrinkles. Not in this case. This wrinkle is a rather permanent waste of time; hence, my word "Wraste."
I had watched the trailer and I was eager to watch the whole movie. But what disappointment! Even though the performances are not bad, the plot is inconsistent and makes no sense.

Why not?A Wrinkle in Time was quite the mess of a movie. It started out looking somewhat promising, but turned into a jumbled storyline that didn't work. Let's start with the positives. Oprah, for what she was in during the movie, she did a good job. Same goes with Chris Pine. The movie was mostly visually stunning and had great costumes and hairstyling. Now let's go into the negatives. The movie was so jumbled around that it couldn't keep a steady plot. Things would just happen out of nowhere and what bugged me was that characters were just fine with it. None of the characters were too surprised with what happened in the movie. The acting wasn't that good either. It's hard with kids so you most of the time shouldn't have the highest expectations. There was this one kid. He played the character Charles Wallace. My god was he horrible. He was by far the worst part of the film. They really needed to work with his character. There were also some stuff in the trailer that weren't in the movie which isn't a good thing in my opinion. There were random pop songs that were placed at totally random parts and weren't needed. The first half of the first act was good, then it started to get worse and worse. The third act of the movie to me wasn't good. It was nothing exciting and didn't catch my attention. I got bored during some parts of the movie. I can't say the movie was absolutely terrible, but I can't say I liked it. It was mainly a Disney cash grab that failed at the box office. If you want to see it, go ahead, but don't expect too much.
My Grade: C-
How can a movie have such slow pacing, but yet still be so horribly confusing! It's just a self help book. We didn't ask for this, we didn't need this, don't watch it!
I liked this movie, this was incredible! Storm Reid did so beautifully. I don't get why this has a bad rating, like seriously, would you rather watch Shrek 3?

This film belongs to the visual effects guys as it looks good with some tricky shots. The problem comes in with the conflict of camera work, atmosphere and concept design, meaning it has no clear distinction as to what it wants to be. It's filmed like a scientific drama, but tries to have a sort of magic and cosmos feel and it doesn't work because the visual lacks atmosphere and has a lot of handheld operation. To me, it feels like the director couldn't handle the weight of the project and simply tried to get the shots done in time. The hinting at technical scientific theories is weak and brushed under the carpet, even though it's for kids it still felt weak. Disney has seemed to lost their master filmmakers who were disciplined in all aspects of filmmaking. And if I have to hear the double name "Charles-Wallace" one more time I'll go crazy.

reviews.review_title: The audience cried and applauded - a film for anyone ready to open their heart
reviews.content:
The man to the left of me cried, the woman to the right of me cried. We applauded when the film ended, our hearts feeling moved and lifted. This movie does not deserve the 1/10 scores that it is receiving. Do not be fooled by these reviews. Weeks before the film came out, people vented their anger about it in the comments section of a NY Times article on it. They were afraid of a darker skinned female lead - not staying true to its source material, they claim. It is this kind of fear that the film challenges us to see and understand before it consumes us.
This story is not about skin color, nor sexual anatomy. It is about the power of love and the destruction of fear. The director does an excellent job creating this moral lesson with cinematic vision that both children and adults can appreciate. It will move you if you have a willingness to be moved. There are some very significant lines spoken in this film, that if truly taken to heart, could change lives.

Wonderful scenery and graphics but the plot line was a bit all over the place. The beginning felt rushed and the acting was a bit unbelievable and almost annoying at some points. The director definitely messed up here However I did like the message the film brought and this really got down to the Disney basics. Overall I would give this movie a 5/10

reviews.review_title: Sort of exactly what you'd expect.
reviews.content:
Sloppy, slow, muddy, lowest common denominator children's film with bad dialogue, no sense of scale and no cohesive design. I applaud the abundance of female characters in strong roles and the superb, gentle damaged soul of the beta-female Lead Character. But Duverny has no understanding of how to shoot fantasy, at first coming across awkwardly against the urban backdrop and then later in a soulless void of green screen with flat plates of actors and vistas with no grounding or relevance. Wrinkle has a stodgy story with no relatable sense of logic; typically, although cliche, these kinds of fantasy kids films end up portraying the fantasy elements as connected to the grief or fear of the child as they grow up. This film just throws colourful nonsense at us willy billy with no explanation of the logic and no way of connecting to any of it. One imagines that if this were a 2D animated Ghibli film it would be spectacular and appropriate, but like this it ironically seems lifeless and disconnected and pointless.
It's twists and turns are predictable and the action is turgid. The way characters meet and the plot moves on are utterly contrived, it's disappointing really.
It's not a terrible film, and sometimes with the dramatic elements it can actually be quite stirring and emotional, it's just mostly a film that misses the mark in every department.

reviews.review_title: It's ridiculous that a revolutionary piece of cinema is being tanked...
reviews.content: This movie was so fast-forward for Disney. None of their past live-action movies hold such emotion and virtue as their movie. It truly is an inclusive movie, the future of what works of art should look like. The acting was phenomenal, the soundtrack was done perfectly so, and the visual effects were stunning! Ava DuVernay took this script and transformed it into so much more than anyone could have guessed. I read the book, which is completely different from its adaptation, and I did not even care about the vast contrasts because the points depicted and values exercised were so brilliantly made. This movie does not deserves these ratings at all. It's not opinion, it's fact.
Such a waste of time and money. My 10 & 11 year old feel asleep and I don't remember most of it because I was bored.

First and foremost, the theme is too difficult for a children's movie, the plot takes place too fast and it is incomplete. This movie has beautiful graphics and could potentially be at the very top, but the story is simply not well expressed and full of holes, it's a shame, it's a shame realy ...

I really can't understand why there are so many bad reviews for this movie. It's been a while since I read the books, so I remember almost none of the plot, but this film captured what I loved about A Wrinkle in Time: the wonder, the mystery, the power of family. Amid the glittery makeup and gorgeous special effects, the message about family and love really anchored the film, and the emotional realism of the script and actors spoke to me in a way that other reboots of children's stories haven't. It's hard to adapt a book into a film, and avid fans will inevitably find fault. But this film reminds me of Hayao Miyazaki's masterful interpretation of Howl's Moving Castle, another instance in which a film riffs off a more convoluted plot to give it new life.

reviews.review_title: Disney ruined a PRECIOUS childhood treasure
reviews.content:
I had to sit a few hours thinking on this, I wanted to be sure I was giving a fair review, and not one based on just an adult heart. My childhood growing up wasn't that great, so I treasured books that could really transport me on adventures to far away lands, and leave me feeling a sense of magic in this world. This series of books was in my top 2. So you can see how magical and PRECIOUS it is. Madeline L'Engle was a true genius, and I'm not sure that she never actually tessered in her life... but on to the review...
With great sadness I have to wonder why Disney felt the need to turn this into a white girls hate the black girl racial thing. With all the hatred in the world right now, we CERTAINLY don't need "The happiest place on earth" to be pushing such hurtful issues in HAPPY FAMILY MOVIES! And quite honestly, the choice to change the home from a rural area where they have their wishing rock by a pond - which any of us knows is SO important - to a low rent area where people are getting beaten up and groceries scattered... they ARE scientists right??? And to turn main characters black is not only BEYOND me, it ANGERS me, even after I've had time to think about it. The term cultural appropriation is thrown around all the time when it's against white people, but NEVER when it's against any other race. Why is that? Do you think the African American community would be happy if Soul Food was remade with white folk? Meg, Charles Wallace, the Twins- who were completely forgotten, and their mom were WHITE, and Meg faced white girl problems, and it's WRONG to re - write that, it was important to who she was and thus how she handled the issues! For the record, I am NOT white, I am of the Cree Nation, and you want to talk bad feelings? just saying... There were entire areas of the story that were COMPLETELY left out, entire PLANETS! And those were important in developing the characters! Also, what is up with the UGLY LETTUCE MONSTER, when for DECADES, the symbol on the COVER OF THE BOOK has been the kids on the back of a CENTAUR?!?! Talk about screwing up the story!!!
The bright light is all the beautiful use of color, they did SO GOOD! Mandy from the office was AMAZING, I just wanted to hug her! Charles Wallace was darling, and a great little actor! The blond actress was AWFUL on top of the fact her character was written all wrong! Oprah - long live the Diva!!!! The ONLY thing I will say, and this is as a model and one who does makeup tutorials, SEVERAL times they had her eyebrows crooked, and her lipstick was AWFUL! Use Lime Crime or Jeffree Starr to get that sparkle that stays thick!
All in all, if it's free, and you've read the book, watch it. Otherwise, AVOID!
I suggest you watch this movie without preconceptions ok its a fine Disney movie

I was SO looking forward to this movie. I had such high hopes. I'd told all my friends to go see it, many of whom had never even heard of the book. I went to see it with a friend who'd never read the book and had no idea what it was supposed to be about, so I thought it would be interested to compare our perspectives. Sadly, we both thought it was awful. I can't fault the actors, this falls entirely on the director. Why on earth do these directors think the stories need to be altered so much? The story was beautiful the way it was written, maybe it should've been updated to make it work with modern times, but not by much. But this monstrosity was a mess, was entirely too rushed, did not explain anything that was needed to understand the plot, skipped MAJOR parts of the story altogether, and honestly left me just feeling like I couldn't wait for it to be over. The visuals were beautiful, but some of the costumes and makeup just left me shaking my head. Seriously, Oprah's eyebrows were nothing more than stick-on fake rhinestones like you'd find at the Halloween shops, and they weren't even straight! So much money spent on this, so much hype and wasted talent, for THIS?

reviews.review_title: Severely under the usual Disney standards
reviews.content: I was excited by the trailer but ready to leave and ask for my money back after the first 30-40 minutes.

reviews.review_title: great camera work doesn't save the movie
reviews.content: Review: I found this to be a rather hard to follow movie because it can't really seem to decide what direction it wants to go in. The direction is really good and so is the cinematography but the screenplay is a mess because it goes all over the place. The casting is really intriguing and the acting isn't bad. All in all I would give this two and a half stars out of a possible five stars.

After having watched over 2,000 movies there have actually only been a few that I've been confused by. Since the start of this movie I was confused. The movie moved way to fast and did not do a good job building the story. The movie was overly rushed and just flat out confusing!

reviews.review_title: A-list cast overshadowed by the child actors
reviews.content: An average blockbuster Disney children's movie about the triumph of good over evil in an interplanetary search for a missing astrophysicist father (Chris Pine). This movie offered a further string of A list superstars like Oprah Winfrey and Reece Weatherspoon who acted as magical beings who guided the search.However, the show is stolen by the 3 brilliant child actors who are the center of the story whose performances rank in this order: 1st, 9 year old relative newcomer Deric McCabe as adopted son Charles-Wallace. His role required acting a period of the movie under the evil influence of an intergalactic dark force and he was just superb. 2nd, the lead actor was 14 year old accomplished child actor Storm Reid who played Meg, a new middle schooler who drives the search for her father, a very demanding role that was extremely well acquitted. 3rd, 14 year old Levi Miller playing a neighborhood friend of Meg's called Calvin. Miller is no stranger to stand out performances in leading roles (Pan, Red Dog:True Blue, Better Watch Out, American Exit and Jasper Jones) and he was equally strong in this, cementing his place as one of Hollywood's top teen actors.

reviews.review_title: May Be The Worst Movie Ever Made!
reviews.content: From acting, to story telling, to the atrocious Directing, movie making doesn't get much worse than this! No exaggeration, there is nothing redeeming or good about this entire movie. Hard to believe that the Director used a $100+ million budget to create this utter tripe, garbage! How in the world did Oprah Winfrey get this so wrong and how in the world did she let this disaster see the light of day?! Hands down, the worst movie I've ever seen!
If you've read the book ... this movie makes no sense.
This movie did not follow the book at all. Disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Say what? They charged money for this?
reviews.content: Pitiful. I don't normally write reviews but had to throw in with the haters of this atrocity. I found it funny reading the folks that gave this a 10/10 trying to defend this absurdity. Glitter and stick on eyebrows and giant ugly Oprah made this an eye sore for anyone that tried to sit through this. I didn't just feel cheated of my hard earned money, I was pissed off that I sat through it all. It felt like a slap in the face of all common decency. That 4.2 should be reversed to a 2.4. Awful awful film. My daughter was so excited to have family night and we saw this cliched piece of crap.
