Wow, should have read the reviews before hand but even then I might not have believed it could be that bad. It was worse than expected. You have definitely been warned as the 1 stars heavily outweigh all the other stars.

The writers took way too many liberties. I liked the more integrated cast and some of the updates, but changing the entire plot from a universal good against evil to a personal fight to save her father was entirely unnecessary. Also, there was no reason to move their house from the woods to a San Fernando Valley tract home. The stargazing rock was a major setting in their story. I agree take them down to plot way too far. Give us some credit for being able to understand an adult theme and by this I do not mean X-rated.

reviews.review_title: A Wrinkle in Time Film Review By Logan Coleman; I am giving this film 6 and ¾ stars out of 10.
reviews.content: A Wrinkle in Time is the first theatrical of the classic novel. I will start out by saying this film will probably be nominated next year's Oscar for best costume design. The entire cast did their best they could consider in my honest opinion the script needed a couple of more passes. The film is somewhat hard to follow because of the editing. The film had the look of the films that were made 1960's through 1970's. I am giving this film 6 and ¾ stars out of 10.

That's the best way I can find to describe this movie - a mess. I assume this movie is aimed at a younger audience, but I suspect most of them will be lucky to make it half way through. This movie really does get worse the more it goes on. It never misses a chance to sermonise New Age philosophy or to throw in saccharine emotional moments. It is hopelessly miscast too. What is Oprah Winfrey doing here? She's a capable actress, but I suspect that Oprah Winfrey is just so famous these days for being Oprah she'll never be able to submerse herself in any other role. You'll always be aware you're watching Oprah acting. Chris Pine is just tedious and it's not his fault. He just plays a tedious character. He should fire his agent. The lead character, Meg, is just annoying. On top of that, this film is saddled with a story that just gets weirder and weirder, bleaker and bleaker and is burdened with a soundtrack to match - it's excruciating; one of the worst I can remember. I've watched this movie twice now, several months apart. I forgot how bad it is in the intervening period. I won't make that mistake again.
What age was this movie aimed at cause the whole plot was freakishly useless and hard to watch that's all i av to say.

I never read any of the books. My grand daughter read the first book, hence wanting us to take her for her birthday.
The movie was entertaining, sort of. I had no idea where this thing was going. We had no character development, and a 20 foot Oprah was more than I could bare.
The acting was horrible. 
As I said, my grand daughter has read the first book. She said the movie was NOTHING like the book. She lamented that they changed everything.
I saw that there was another "Wrinkle In Time", filmed in 2001 by Disney. The reviews said nearly the same thing.
Maybe this story is above the heads of the adults who wanted to make the movie. 
Next time, maybe they should leave it to a bunch of kids. Surely THEY could do a better job of it.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Amazing! One of my favourites.
reviews.content: I loved this movie so much. The actors were amazing (and diverse!), the visuals were stunning and the music excellent. Though different to the book, I loved this interpretation. It was contemporary, the messages were great and the story tight. I just wanted to hug everybody... There was also a Hamilton quote. I feel like I connected more with Charles Wallace in the book (that's not to say the actor was bad) while I prefer the movie version of Meg. Overall, though both are great in different ways, I think I actually prefer the film to the book. A+

This movie was awful. I have to admit, I detest Oprah and her "look at me I'm awesome" view of life to begin with. Seeing her introduced as a bigget than life whatever she was supposed to further cemented my hatred of her. As far as the movie goes, let's see....bad acting, check...bad storyline, check....pointless visuals, check...This movie mad no sense and did not flow. It is without question, the worst movie I've ever seen.

This was a major dissapointment. I'm a fan of Ava DuVernay as a filmmaker, and I was looking forward to see what she would do with a big budget fantasy film. I'm not sure what happened here, but it's just a big mess with few good things in it. So the positives; this film has a wonderful message about self confidence which kids should hear. Oprah was something to behold, she didn't do much but she definitely had an interesting prescense on screen. And Storm Reid did a great job with what she was given, I think she has a bright future. Ok now the bad. This movie makes no sense, and it asks you to just start accepting all this crazy shit happening without earning it. Some things just happen for no reason and they're so bizarre and jarring. The acting from all the others mentioned is either real bad or just too much. Reese Witherspoon is just weird and over the top, and she gets rather annoying real quick. Mindy Kaling did her best with what she was given I suppose, but it wasn't much, and she speaks in quotes, which I guess could be cool if she didn't say who said it right after, and then she just speaks normally halfway through. Levi Miller plays the typical sidekick love interest that's typically given to women, so ok we can let that one slide, but he literally is there for no reason. Even when we're introduced to him, right before the magic stuff starts happening btw, they ask him why he's there and he says he doesn't know, he just felt like he was supposed to, and they never explain that, it's so weird and lazy. Now Deric McCabe...Oh boyI don't want to rag on this kid because he's young and inexperienced so I'm sure his performances will improve, but holy crap this kid got on my nerves. His delivery of this already pretty bad dialogue is just painful. And for some reason he's just aware of all the magic stuff from the beginning and it never explains that. Then they turn him into the bad guy at the end, so now he's trying to deliver this typical villain dialogue with his squeaky childish voice and it just comes across as cringy. All of the other actors do a good job with the very little they had. Overall I really disliked this film and contemplated walking out several times. The only reason I didn't was because I thought it could in some way redeem itself, but it never did. I could see your kids really enjoying this movie, but you shouldn't expect to.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst box office bombs of 2018
reviews.content: I finally got around to seeing A Wrinkle in Time since it's on Netflix. I can't say I was overly thrilled about watching the film, but I was bored and how bad could it really be? Turns out worse than expected.The story of the movie is supposed to be a feel-good family adventure about the triumphs of good over evil. The plot of the film follows a group of children exploring dream like worlds as they attempt to track down their lost father. All the while they are aided by the fairy tail godlike beings who want to protect the universe from darkness. Unfortunately the film was a narrative mess in every regard. The movie completely dropped the ball in adapting the classic A Wrinkle in Time novel and its subtle complexities.Even describing the basic plot of the movie is a bit difficult largely due to scripting errors. The movie is all over the place and filled with massive plot holes. Its all around very poor writing seems incapable of grabbing the audience. I never once felt compelled to care about the conflicts of the film or any of the characters in the least. I just kept waiting for something interesting to happen.The central conflict never felt grand or epic in any regard which is a shame considering the source material. Despite the beautiful backdrop of the movie the characters all felt like set pieces aimlessly wandering around. There just wasn't a single interesting character in the entire film. With a solid cast of big name actors not one of them brought anything of merit to their roles. They can't really be blamed though for poor writing and directing.A Wrinkle in time is supposed to be a feel-good family adventure about empowerment and the virtues of love and compassion. It's a noble cause to craft a concept around, but at the end of the day this was barely a watchable movie. I really expect better from Disney at this point, particularly when utilizing a beloved childhood classic.So there is one small silver lining which is the animation. The movie had some absolutely beautiful scenes. There were some moments of pure eye candy in the world building. I see where the majority of the budget went to with this box office bomb.At the end of the day not even Oprah with her fairy godmother like appearance could save this movie. While yes it was a shiny film meant for children, there is never an excuse for making a bad movie. The writing was all over the place and it never managed to craft an interesting narrative. It completely ignored the most interesting aspects of the novel. It seems like Disney has at least one bomb a year, this was certainly one of the worst major box office films of 2018. A 2.5 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Great Stars, Wondrous Visuals, Thoughtful Message; Poor Execution, Bland Motivation, Tiresome Movie.
reviews.content: A Wrinkle In Time (2018).Chipper F. Xavier, Esq. Meg (Storm Reid) is an intelligent problem-child and discipline problem in school because her father, Mr. Murry (Chris Pine) disappeared four years ago. Suddenly, her precocious brother Charles Wallace (Deric McCabe) introduces her to three magical beings: Mrs. Whatsit (Reese Witherspoon), Mrs. Who (Mindy Kaling) and Ms. Which (Oprah Winfrey), who promise to send the siblings on a grand journey of self-discovery. Can they unite their powers to make the Murry family whole once again?Director Ava DuVernay (Selma 2014) and screenplay writers Jennifer Lee and Jeff Stockwell seem determined to bring novelist Madeleine L'Engle's beloved book, A Wrinkle In Time to the big screen. Unfortunately, the result might best be described as a valiant effort.The good: Child actors Storm Reid and Deric McCabe are adorably well-cast as the Murry kids. The adult actors: Gugu Mbatha-Raw (Mrs. Murry), Winfrey, Witherspoon and Pine take their roles seriously, and I cannot fault their performances. The costumes are sumptuous and the filmography combined with CGI effects is stunning.The bad: The screenplay drags and fails to establish the proper tension required to invigorate the characters' actions. Miraculously, with all it has going for it, Wrinkle falls flat.Wrinkle is not a bad movie for its runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes, but it actually feels like forever, and it seriously misses the mark in its tepid delivery of such an important and timely message.
I'm different. I thought the movie was pretty good (very rarely can it be exactly like the book). I hope the other two, A Wind in the Door and A Swiftly Tilting Planet, get made as well.

What happened here? This had the recipe to be a great movie - great effects, acting, and music - but this was somehow really awful to watch.
For me, it was the fact that pages of the original book were cut out. Where are the twins? Why are the three Mrs so young? Did the writers even read beyond the synopsis of the original book? That coupled with the obnoxiousness of Mrs. Whatsit (who really irritated me for being so... rude) just made for a really unenjoyable experience beyond the beautiful effects.
Super confused why this has such a low rating. It was a perfectly fine movie. Not exactly like the book, and yes, obviously a younger audience was the target demographic, but it's really not bad.

What a life experience! This story - this portrayal - takes a civilized viewer through every possible emotion in existence. I am It is a sociological masterpiece, challenging the mind and spirit of every viewer with a scrap of humanity in them.I'll regrain from details that make the film "boffo." Suffice to say, however, the actors - nearly every one - was very good to stellar. IMHO, Reese Witherspoon ran away with it. What great writing for her character.Much can be learned - and much self-reflection - can occur. Contrary to those slamming the film, it is not "preachy." On is a social mirror that reminds us of the good - the bad - the ugly in global cultures. It is humbling!

reviews.review_title: Devoid of everything that makes a good movie
reviews.content: I wish there were a wrinkle in time that would make these scenes go faster because they drag on forever with cliche'd dialogue and moral platitudes without a hint of wit, humor or cleverness. The antagonist is an amorphous black blob that can apparently be easily vanquished by yelling "I love you" a few times. Plot holes and nonsensical plot devices abound, as do actors relentlessly mugging for the camera to overdrawn music. It's a tie between bad and boring.

reviews.review_title: could have been so much better.
reviews.content:
First of all, most people need to realize that this movie is targeted towards younger kids and aiming to teach them self respect yada yada. that being said, duvernay as a director was pretty whack. I know she's capable of making good movies, but with the fact that she had this target audience in mind, I felt like this movie was dumbed down and cheesed beyond my tolerance. the music direction was horrible and degraded it down to a disney channel original movie vibe (seriously the songs with lyrics just killed the mood for me each time), and idk why she's obsessed with off center close up shots, but that just made it even more cheesy and not artistic at all. the editing was also sloppy, and maybe this was because I saw it in theaters, but yo you could see the green from the green screen reflecting off of their skin, and maybe they thought "oh flying lettuce sun reflection science" but that was poor editing to me. the pace was also terrible, especially in the beginning. the only other time I've ever laughed in a movie theater was in spring breakers, and even I could stomach multiple rewatches of that movie. I get the goals duvernay were trying to accomplish with the morals and diverse cast, but please worry about the actual content of the film, not just the actors' checks. jesus. 
3 stars for trippy visuals and chris pine's nice salt and peppered beard.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the It got to all the haters lol
reviews.content: Full disclosure, I've never read the book...so nothing about it was ruined for me. There will always be haters, but I actually enjoyed this movie. Beautiful visuals, great soundtrack and wonderful led by a pre-Euphoria Storm Reid who is exceptional!

reviews.review_title: Pointlessly slow. I had no idea what was going on.
reviews.content: Aesthetically pleasing, with a great wardrobe and special effect. The mother, 'Mrs. Murry' (played by GuGo Mbatha-Raw) may have the only character that seemed to know what she was doing.This movie which boasts a fantastic cast including Reece Witherspoon and Oprah was extreamly convoluted and deiliberatly complicated. I am still struggling with what exactly happened. Most of the events that occur throughout the film seemed pointless, tacky and annoying. Including the small boy 'Charles Wallace' (played by Deric McCabe), with a voice that will go straight through you, was very awkward at times. Which I put down mainly to the direction.The direction was abismal. Ava DuVernay was able to make even Oprah's role feel uncomfortable. They could have shortened the movie considerably if all the characters didn't feel the need to spend 3 minutes between every word they said and their reaction times.I have no idea what the movie was about. Something about 'Tessersing'? There were scenes that made no sense, people just disappear and pop up a few minutes later with little explanation and if I'm honest, I could have done without the annoying children in it at all. There's one scene where this girl is just looking out of window, it was a bit strange the first time, but when you see her again, it just seems disturbing. Chris Pine who plays the father, 'Mr. Murry' didn't strike the cord. He is intense and again, slow. He should have stayed in the box they found him.I would love to time travel to get the last couple of hours of my life back. I've heard the books by Madeleine L'Engle are fantastic and I wasn't aware of them until this movie came out, so at least there's one good thing to come out of it.My advice for anyone still thinking of watching would be to watch it in double time.
Watch this if you want to watch Reese Witherspoon turn into cabbage.

I do not see what everyone's problem was. This movie was great! I enjoyed every actors performance and the cinematography was beautiful! Yes, the writing and plot had flaws, but doesn't every movie have pros and cons? Overall, I enjoyed this movie and everyone should go see it.

I recently watched this movie, and wondered why on earth they released this movie, much less made it with the screenplay that they ended up with. Why would the brains behind this take a wonderful, classic children's novel and turn it into a new age mumbo jumbo piece of trash? Terrible acting, terrible special effects and it bore no semblance to the novel. Very disappointing. For anyone considering watching this, don't, read the book instead and be entranced.
Something is very smelly about the reviews! Don't trust them,kind of like the folks who set out to give Black Panther a bad reviews just because and got caught :-/ watch out

I cannot believe how bad this was. Not only was the acting bad, but so was the music. In fact the only redeeming quality of the movie is the special effects, which I feel were overused in some parts. I can look past a little bit of "cheese" in a Disney movie, but this was too much. This movie felt more like a Disney channel original rather than a theatrical release. The actors were poorly chosen and the script was terribly written. Storm Reid was so absolutely annoying as Meg and I know that Charles Wallace is supposed to be a know-it-all kind of child, but it was very overdone and obnoxious. I found I read the book multiple times and I enjoyed it a lot. This totally dishonored the book. Overall I VERY much disliked this.

reviews.review_title: Film primarily for youth Audience, but okay watch for adults
reviews.content: I feel a lot of people rated this movie unfairly. Not many movies really deserve a 1, I feel like for a movie to really deserve a 1 it needs to be horrible. This movie wasn't horrible. The movie has great messages of connection with all, of being yourself and letting your light shine and owning your faults (which may actually be your gifts). I do feel like there was some flat acting in the movie, particularly in some of the beginning sequences, and the beginning was a little slow running for me, but it picked up as the movie moved forward, and there were scenes that were moving enough to have me crying.My 12 year old son loved the movie, and I thought he might pee his pants because he didn't want to take a bathroom break in fear of missing something. I would have loved this movie when I was his age too. This is why I feel the audience for this movie is ages 7-13. The movie seems to deal with situations for this age range (isn't that the age range the book is written for too?).I still liked the movie enough for it to hold my interest, I didn't feel burnt for paying to go see it, especially since my son liked it so much. I also loved the messages the movie had for my son - it was worth the watch just for that.This is a good family film to take the kids to - but don't expect oscar worthy performances.

reviews.review_title: a Racial-ist if not racist movie?
reviews.content: Https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1620680/?ref_=nv_sr_1Sorry, even 5*** is too much but i gave it to this so-so fantasy / scifi movie mostly for the sake of the effort, story and the not so fab (yet likeable enough) CGI imagery ...also liked certain few scenes for their content plus choice of location resulting in some (albeit familiar and cliche') social commentary too though ...overall, i could say the rather sensitive subject matter of races (probably the world's 'biggest problem' in general and America's in particular) is toyed around with rather excessively in this movie although it tries to stay away from it directly and on the surface at least ... (in order to avoid 'suspicions' maybe!? yes, racial issues ARE tricky in America but is the media helping in eliminating them the way they truly could really, or are they worsening it even further? why, for example, America did eventually have an African Black prsident but not a Native one yet? not that i know of at least, has there been one?)dunno if others would agree with me on this but trying to encourage some minority races (again, in the 'police-state' America more than anywhere else, where the topic is 'critical' surely!) into liking science and 'falling' for it when pursuing higher education is in itself a GRAND issue in that country, where, again, education in general and higher education in particular, is not an easy thing for MOST people to begin with, which is due to high expenses and serious financial obstacles such as high-interest bank loans, not to mention 'lack of job security' after graduation, which is also probably the biggest downer for many American young when thinking about becoming a scientist or even a business professional or anything when they daydream about growing up and getting rich!that means no matter what race or minority (or even majority!) group you come from in the US of A, although entering schools is not difficult for anyone, but staying in them (and remaining a 'sane' person too!) is the most difficult, almost impossible part of the deal!that is why America's been so reliant on importing highly educated experts and specialists 'from other planets' rather than producing them 'here on Earth' for a long time now ... (much less to export them 'universally across other galaxies' too!)also, this is certainly a ladies movie i'd say ... director is a female, one of the writers also is, and at least one of the producers too ... not to mention some other females in key positions behind the scenes AS WELL AS in the story: The THREE WHICHes (of Universevil?) are female, the protagonist is a girl, and her scientist mother ... another female 'key figure' there too ...nothing wrong with that of course and i have always loved and strongly supported most female-made art of all kinds my entire boring life post maturity ...but, and again due to the reasons mentioned in previous paragraphs (the rather big and ALARMING shortage of highly specialist DOMESTIC physicians, industrialists, scientists and so on in America thus having to 'purchase' them from other countries) and trying to get minorities (perhaps African Americans more than others?) into, ''Think about it Meg, THAT not so attractive yet very smart teenage gal defending and saving her 'handsome White scientist' ignorant yet loving and hipster father could be YOU! Who knows, maybe a handsome nice White boy will also like you someday just as your White pa did your Black ma, you see!?''but when the proper grounds for breeding such a rare and valuable stock is not only unprepared, but almost entirely ruined and wasted thus unavailable, sending such sublime messages across to the likely candidates is rather like offering them a delicious dessert before the main course and reminding them right away that there's not going to be any meal later anyway, deal with it! (did the current POTUS who's willing to reduce and stop exporting jobs offshore sponsored this movie by any chance? ((NAAAHHH! this movie is pro-Obama openly and for obvious reasons!)) besides, the current POTUS has already sponsored offshore drilling for 'cheap oil' in some nice and clean US places already though, hasn't he?) :Dand those direct hints at cultural and artistic or scientific "WARRIORS" by quoting them (who, not surprisingly, come from all nations in the world, well, almost, including America!) as if we're browsing through those cliche' Facebook memes ... and eventually naming them one by one in the end as well (with the exception of many lesser-known yet more influential ones!) doesn't help much really, especially when coming out of the mouth of an overweight business minded super conservative tv and showbiz celebrity figure (and a likely POTUS candidate in the future as well) disguised as a liberal, who happens to be anything but a progressive- or scientific-minded persona really! (just check out her choice of a psychiatrist whot ended up running his own show later!)or maybe that was the idea after all: attracting the attentions of that rather large section of the American society that watches tv all day and night long and loves nearly anything amusing BUT science!?(bringing her giant presence down from the sky and making her look like a normal-size human ((albeit still covered in heavy makeup and fancy expensive dress)) which one of the young actors also confirmed, was a nice touch though! i liked that ...) ;-)long story short, i'm not saying this is a BAD movie; it's actually even worth watching (once only and no more!) and probably the text upon which this movie's been made is a good read after all, but my final conclusion is that it's too mature for the young addresses it was made for (was it?) while also too childish for the mature audience (ignorant 'scientist' parents 'Lost In Space' in particular) who're supposed to like and 'learn' a thing or two from it ...

I picked up a copy of A Wrinkle in Time as a 4th grader in 1984. The book did not resonate with me. For whatever reason, it was not what I had expected and I put the book down for 33 years.At the start of this year I saw that Disney was making A Wrinkle in Time into a movie. I knew it was time to finish the job. I don't like to leave any book I start unfinished, and this was a chance to see if there really was anything interesting in that old book.I ordered a copy from Amazon, and in a few days I was reading it each night to my 11 and 12 year old boys. We finished the book just in time to catch the movie on its release weekend.I think the movie is fantastic.The movie brought the book to vibrant, dazzling life. What was rote back and forth dialogue between a small child and a celestial being, now became a supernatural event that opened up the universe to the earthbound adventurers.Yes there were differences between the book and the movie, but there always are. The changes save time, limit peripheral characters and in the case of the ending, give the movie more emotion and energy than the book's hurried last scene.The movie was made for a modern audience, updating setting, references and language to connect with today's children and adults.What makes the book and the movie great are the themes. Underlying the story are the ideas of perseverance, bravery, trust, family and most important of all, that love wins over fear. The movie captures the movies theme's perfectly, enhancing and amplifying them at just the right time and space.So why was the IMDB rating 3.7 when I looked on Sunday night? It has since climbed to 4.1, but that is still too low for a movie this good. Reading some of the user reviews, it was clear that the haters have come out in droves.Maybe some people simply don't like the movie. Having read the book, I certainly was in a better position to connect with the movie. But given that A Wrinkle in Time focus on interracial parents and their children, cast strong female characters that were part witch, part angel in the case of Oprah Winfrey, an all knowing demi-god, is it any surprise that there are people whose reflexive barriers prevented them from ever giving this children's movie a chance?Despite the overwhelmingly clear message of love, the haters had to lash out...and I know why.You see, the Black Thing has got them. They have been ensnared by IT and Central Intelligence, and they cannot help themselves. They watch a movie that describes the very thing that is the cause of their pain and suffering, along with the anecdote, but they are too blind to see.SPOILER ALERT
So I am writing this post to help you, the hater. You need to resist hate and the fear. You need to open your heart. You need to go back into that movie theater and realize you are about to watch a sad and bullied girl go on a journey across the universe to find the father she loves. She will be aided by angels, her future husband and her gifted little brother. She will have to be brave and fight in order to save her little brother from the clutches of evil. In the end she will discover that love conquers fear, and that she is strong and capable.If that doesn't make you happy and bring you joy, then maybe the Black Thing has its claws in you far deeper than any movie can rescue.
Disappointing and a huge waste of valuable cast and resources. Terrible story and the drama just doesn't connect with the viewers.

A Wrinkle in Time was one of my favorite books as a child. When the movie was released, my kid had already read the book. In our house, we know, understand, and accept that no movie can be as great as a book it was based upon. Any such film we approach with only the hope of experiencing a similar feeling as we felt when reading. For our family, this movie delivered. Yes, there were many inconsistencies from the book, but if you approach a film without expectation, just as you would a book, you can find entertainment.
Movie adaptations of books like this one usually totally blow, and this was no exception. One of my favorite books (and series) as a kid, but this movie was horrendous.
The physics of teleportation, the frequency, the love, the appreciation , I love this movie. Thank you! Forever a classic.

If you've ever wondered what a movie would look like if you took 100 bad cliches about love, good and evil and relationships, and gave them to a non-creative ten year old to turn into screenplay, and then told the production team to work with their eyes closed, and given the CGI crew computers from the 1970s, then you will love A Wrinkle in Time. Otherwise, avoid it like the plague. Honestly, I am being generous. I watch a lot of movies and I can genuinely say that that is the very worst movie I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Don't Expect to Understand the Story, if You Haven't Read the Book.
reviews.content: I never read the book, so I assumed that all the bad reviews were literature snobs who were disappointed that the movie was not a faithful recreation of the novel.I went in with zero expectations, but quickly found myself struggling to figure out the plot. This is character driven piece and the acting is very good, but the story made little sense. It would be like watching one episode of TV show from the middle of the third season. The movie was very colorful, but short on substance. my wife who read the book, my 11 year old son and I rarely agree on movies but we all left disappointed.
Loved the film and I lost myself in it. Why can't people just let themselves be entertained.I don't get the hate.
I started watching this movie then looked at the reviews. I almost stopped watching, I'm glad I didn't, it was an enjoyable way to pass a few hours. A good piece of escapism. Highly recommend.

Listen, I know that sounds exaggerated, but this movie is genuinely a masterpiece of bland, unenjoyable cashgrabbery. Sure, some other films may be technically worse, but nothing will beat this pure lack of passion and care put into this movie. For me, that's as low as it can get.

reviews.review_title: Don't bother if you like the book, or if you like good movies.
reviews.content: Bad acting. Bad director. Bad production. Bad editing. Bad adaptation from a good book.

reviews.review_title: There are no words for this. Terrible is a compliment.
reviews.content: There are few films that make you wish you had been in a coma. This is one. Whatever the running time, this film will seem at least five times as long.
This movie is a embarrassment. I haven't read the book but still the plot is plain and the characters are stail

reviews.review_title: Not your typical Disney movie, waste of time and money
reviews.content: I wanted to walk out of the theater but kept thinking it's going to get better. Well, it didn't. Don't waste your money and time on this movie. Disney movies are usually wonderful, not this one. It's the worst Disney movie I've ever seen. Bummer!

I understand they tried to adapt to modern times, but the story got lost. There are missed scenes and the characters have lost their essence. Charles Wallace is supposed to be shy and Meg a kind of outsider (bullying is out if place) and mr and mrs Murray are meant to be the most charming, loving parebts with prodigious mind. I hated this Mrs Murray from scene 1. Not happy with this... oh, and Mrs Whatsit was meant to arrive looking like a homeless person, not like a woodland fairy... I have always loved A Wrinkle In Time... I detested this version!!!

The movie is so bad! Who the hell thought is a great movie? I worked in the cinema and saw only 5 minutes before I moved to other movie. It's was so boring that I was afraid that I'll fall asleep. And there were only less than 10 people every time that watched the movie and most of them left after 30 minutes. And it was only one week in the cinema. I love Reese, she's one of my favorite actress but this is the worst movie she ever did.

reviews.review_title: I love fantasy sci-fi stories but this is a little too dumb
reviews.content: This started as a good story however film score is definitely not high quality, that any good director would know is 50% of a movie. The child actors have been not chosen the best either. The lead actress girl is really weak so as the boy who plays her brother, makes me wonder if they have been casted because of political correctness or because they're someone's someone. Costume design is super tacky even for a kids story as this. The script is very weak so as directing. There are multiple major actors in this film who are excellent in other movies but not in this strangely. overall I was disappointed

I went to watch this movie in 3D thinking that Oprah will not get her name in some trivial movie. I was wrong, it was all a stupid kids movie that showed Oprah and Reese for few scenes while the rest was all done by children. I felt my money and time wasted and even watching it in 3D did not make it a special one!

reviews.review_title: Best adaptation yet, amazing visuals, good movie
reviews.content:
First and foremost, this is a very good movie. What it is not is a direct retelling of the story. It's a story about family, love, and self empowerment with parts of the original story woven throughout. If you can keep that in mind as you watch this movie, I think you'll enjoy it. I did.
It's been a long time since I read the books, but I read all of them (and the related Austins books). As such, I can't remember more than a few scenes from the book, let alone the specific details. But there was enough of the original story "enfolded" within the movie that it feels close enough to be easily recognizable.
Is it a "perfect" movie? No. But it's the best adaptation of the books that I've seen yet. Very well done.
And the beautiful visuals are stunning. The acting is (generally) good to great (some of the supporting characters are too one dimensional to be really believable, but they are really only there to serve as instantly recognizable stereotypes anyway). But the leads all mail it.
The thing you have to understand is that this movie is loosely based on the book, but it's also it's own story, and it does as very good job telling that story. It's a story about how important love is in a world where hatred, picture perfect consumerism, and general nastiness runs rampant. Maybe if we take the movie's lesson to heart, we won't have to travel to the ends of the universe to figure it out.
If you're looking for a positive, visually glorious, slightly perilous (it made my youngest grab for my hand in a few places), and thoroughly entertaining escape for 110 minutes, then this might be a good movie for your to watch.
But, if all you want to do is compare it to the book or bash on Oprah, then you won't enjoy this and you'll leave toxic reviews like so many other people have done. People who chose to spread darkness instead of celebrating a movie that strives to bring light, good lessons, and fun to the world.

reviews.review_title: Geez. Calm down people. It was fine.
reviews.content: Just watched this with my class of 30 eleven and twelve year-olds after studying the book. They actually enjoyed the movie more than the book, although they were disappointed when a couple of key moments were left out. The acting by the young cast was fantastic, especially Storm Reid. The music is beautiful. There were a few spine tingling moments and some of my students shed a tear or two. I think it really helps to have read the book and if you haven't read it recently, you might find it's not as great as you remembered. It's a movie for kids. They gave it a 7 out of ten. I give it a six.

reviews.review_title: A nice slow paced children's movie
reviews.content: The movie is nice and sweet. It's very slow and simple. It's a children's movie for ages until 10 years.

reviews.review_title: I tried to have an open mind
reviews.content:
I went into this movie expecting to be frustrated and disappointed, but hoping to be wrong. I was frustrated and disappointed, but there were a few bright spots.Bright spots:The way Meg approached her father at the end was much more interesting than in the book. The eerie disturbingness of the bouncing-ball children was conveyed better in the movie than in the bookThe last tesseract was beautiful and cathartic.
Disappointments:There was not enough contrast between Charles Wallace and IT/Charles Wallace. It was like the difference between a 5yo in a good mood and a tired, cranky 5yo, not the difference between a loving but young genius and a child whose mind has been taken over by a planet-destroying source of evil.Dr. Mother Murray was written/acted as worried and scared most of the time. In the book she was so unflappable that her calm was practically science fiction in itself. That's what I wanted to see.Mrs. Whatsit was mean to Meg on more than one occasion. One of my favorite things about the Mrs. Ws is their frumpiness, that manages, for many people, to conceal their brilliant natures. I wish it had been possible to do that in the film. Instead, we had yet another conflation of beauty and goodness. :-(

reviews.review_title: For Abandoned Daughters Who Miss Their Fathers
reviews.content: Don't buy into all the cynicism of other reviews of this film. While I respect those opinions, I struggle to understand how anyone can miss the pure beauty and majesty of this movie. If you know young girls who seem to reject their own worth and who can't see how amazing they are because they are heartbroken, watch this movie with them. It might help them dispel those dark thoughts and begin to see their own light.

It's not your usual "Disney" movie, it's entertaining and a good story, a little slow and pretty dramatic. Interesting concept. Reminds me of Touched by an Angel sort of. The Universe of Darkness against the Light. We know who wins do you?!

I couldn't finish it. I have loved this book and the entire series for most of my life. I was so excited for this movie! But now having seen half of it I just can't bring myself to be tortured any longer. I don't understand why the writers, director and producers changed the story so much!!! Don't watch it. You'll just regret it.
The movie I'm sure for kids was very fun but for me I didn't particularly like it some parts I thought were enjoyable however some weren't and were cringey but overall the movie is ok .

reviews.review_title: Why did they turn Mrs. Whatsit into a vegetable?
reviews.content: It is SHOCKING how bad this movie is and how different it is from the book. For context, we had to read this book in class, then watch the movie. I heard from another teacher that we were supposed to do a compare and contrast between the movie and the book, so I decided to pull my notebook out and list all the differences. These differences lasted a little more than a page. The contrasts ranged from, "The cast looks different than described in the book." to "Why did they remove and add so many unnecessary scenes?"The only reason why this review isn't 1 star is because visually, the movie is stunning. Not the best ever, but definitely a lot better than other movies I've seen. However, I wish the budget wasn't spent so much on visuals, and spent more on runtime. The movie begins and ends so quickly, so you never really get to know the characters. I didn't care for anybody, because the scenes were going by too fast to comprehend. If this was someone's first exposure to the 'Wrinkle in Time' series, I think they would feel incredibly underwhelmed.
WATCHED with the kuds at Christmas.thanks for not entertaining them on any level.sat mostly alone contemplating why am.i still watching this nonsensical drivel

reviews.review_title: My daughter and I thought it was great!
reviews.content: I almost didn't want to watch this movie because of the many bad reviews, but my daughter really wanted to see it. I was preparing for a disaster of a movie, but was pleasantly surprised. It's really really good.

A lot of negative reviews and my thoughts were in that direction until I started to watch this film. This is intended for a young audience but some images may be too intense. Regardless, I thought the concept was original and fairly well presented. The kids did a better job of acting than I thought they would based on the reviews. Some of the special effects were somewhat amateurish but again this was intended for an audience that would over look those deficiencies. I enjoyed the movie and based on my age, 71, I'm apparently going through my second childhood and loving every minute.

reviews.review_title: Imaginative Adaptation of a Great Book
reviews.content: The novel, A Wrinkle in Time, was the first I read that really felt like "my" book. I was 12 years old, and was totally captivated and changed by the story. I have re-read it numerous times in my life, taking new lessons from it at different stages in my life.I approached the movie with trepidation, especially after the terrible adaptation done in 2003, but I was pleasantly surprised by this well-made film. I thought the movie caught the spirit of the book, while updating it cleverly.The kid actors were terrific, especially Storm Reid as Meg. A couple of the "relevant" jokes (Mrs. Who making hip-hop references) were too cute, but I liked how they linked mean girl culture to self-esteem and then linked that to the spreading darkness of "It." While that is not what L'engle wrote, it is definitely in the spirit of her message.The filmmakers made great use of a smart black girl lead. When "It" tempts her with a life where she's popular, the vision includes her having straightened hair. Making Oprah Winfrey, as Mrs. Which, her mentor also underlined this thread. Again, a brilliant way to make the film relevant to 2018 without losing the heart of the story in any way.The movie really needed another 30 minutes in its run-time (and it wasted 12 of what it had with a stupid sequence of "hey look at me!" CGI), and needed to work a little harder on selling the physics, but I thought it was solid.

After hearing the horrible reviews, I was dreading seeing this film. But I'd promised my kids so away we went! It could have been worse, and I was mildly entertained. I gave it a 6 because it wasn't s bad as a 5, but it isn't quite a 6 either The acting by Storm Reid was weaker than I expected, and the acting by the boy who played Charles Wallace was worse. I have liked Reese Witherspoon in everything I've ever seen her in but her, she is not quirky and adorable the way she's supposed to be (I think?) Mindy Kahling also just floated over her lines without infusing much meaning into them. The boy who played Calvin, and the other adult actors were excellent. Worth seeing on BluRay or if you're really in need of something to do with the kids.

reviews.review_title: At least appreciate the show stealing brilliance of 9 year old Deric Mcabe
reviews.content: The Disney Plus streaming service has introduced me to so many unexpected delights old and new that I would not have otherwise bothered with.This is one such unexpected surprise. In fact, I actually did read the novel a few years ago and I hated the saccharine overly done "love" theme and in your face religious aspects (I do enjoy subtle religious underpinnings in movies that give good morals but not when it's in your face). The book had some standout sequences that are memorable but overall it was not a children's book that I liked. To give you context, I adore children fantasy stories such as Tom's Midnight Garden, Moondial, Narnia series, Harry Potter, Dark Materials, etc.But I do love the promotional images of this film, it looks lavish and at least I thought to watch it just to appreciate the visuals. I am one who never ever watch or read something based on other people's opinions. I will decide for myself and I literally judge a book by its cover.One of the many positive stand outs in this film is the surprisingly nuanced performances of all the child stars. Particularly, 9 year old Deric Mcabe who literally stole the show for perhaps a good quarter of the movie's runtime. What a delicious performance, I hope this young child actor is well taken care of, has a happy childhood and not pushed into a career for the sake of wealth. But as long as he wishes to continue on that path, he will have my attention of high anticipation for greatness. The main star, 14 year old Storm Reid was also impressive with some moments of very heart felt nuances. There is no forced acting that one expects with child actors. The adult stalwarts did their part in their accomplished professional ways.But the film itself turned out to be a lovely visual journey with some heartfelt moments of psychological drama and surreal weirdness (something I wish it had delve into further)It has it's plentiful flaws for sure but seeing all those one star ratings is just utter madness. One of those flaws is a certain obvious godliness of Oprah Winfrey's presence that seems a bit unnecessary. I like Oprah, I just don't think it was really needed for her to be so godly! Being the leader would have sufficed.Another criticism I would have is that this could have done with much more humour. Reese Witherspoon's character has some comic relief moments but..just didn't feel enough.What I really appreciated is that unlike the book, this film gives a satisfying complete story. The book had sequels to complete it's main storyline. But as with all movie adaptations, much is cut out and I do feel the stripping down of some of the novel makes the flow of the film rather too haphazard.But the film works for me. It has some memorable sequences and is not anywhere as saccharine as I feared it would be. The journey is disjointed but the performances, visual imagination, Deric Mcabe's show stealing sequence and overall storyline makes up for the shortcomings.I give this a very worthy 7/10.

It was confusing, had too fast of a pace (felt like they were trying to squeeze two books into 1 movie), felt really dark for a Disney movie, and was way off from the book. I thought it was more like Disney was showing off their visual effects, rather than a story. Nothing special, just okay.

A flying lettuce, love makes interstellar travel possible, the darkest mind in the universe is a black cave of synapses, and they walk through ripples of love portals.. Decent soundtrack, a few nice moments of cinematography and color. Glad Netflix picked this up, glad I didn't pay to see it in the theater.

reviews.review_title: A movie that captured a moment in time
reviews.content: Wow! How do you put this classic book into the big screen? Through the eyes of Ava DuVernay, that's how. The story was weaved together so well that I was transported into a book I've read many times. It was brilliantly brought into the modern day with subtlety that is rarely seen. More than the graphic work, acting and visual effects was the under lying message that met my family head on as Meg's emotional journey mirrored my youngest daughter current struggles. It led to "aha" moments and a different perspective.I will watch this movie again and again!

This movie was awful. It wasn't the acting it was the storyline. All regerences to Christianity were removed and it ruined the entire film. One more example of Holllywoods warped reasoning. I would NOT recommend this film unless you like throwing your money away

I see a lot of reviewers here have read the book that this movie was loosely adapted from Well, coming from someone who HASN'T read the book. Maybe this review might be helpful to others out there who are like me:Plot: 3.5/10
Cinematography: 4/10
Visuals: 7/10
Actors: 7/10
Overall: 3/10I watched the movie almost nearly blindfolded. All I checked out was the cast and the plot summary. The pace of the movie felt slow. The actors were great on their own (except Calvin which I'll explain later), as well as the visuals but the plot was too cliche and predictable ... which made the movie an overall "bore" to watch. 
But it wasn't that boring though, given a lil thanks to the visuals. That's how I felt anyway, otherwise I would have yawn multiples times throughout the movie; but I didn't.Anyway, good acting came from the star actors, especially lil Charles Wallace (played by Deric McCabe). But one main character felt a bit odd to watch and that is Calvin (played by Levi Miller). Dude looks and sounds like he's high/drugged on some love spell. And I'm not sure if that's intentional or not but I did not feel any emotional depth in character. Like he's just there for the sake of being there. And the plot... ayy, nothing much to say about it other than it being absolutely predictable. Especially with the whole "there is light in darkness" concept. So yes, just like most of the folks here have said: "very poor script". 
And it's such a shame really because I felt there IS potential to bring out that hidden awesomeness in it---I wondered why the advertising for this movie was not that happening. Well, that's a good thing I guess because if it were then the hit from critics would be a lil more painful.

This mess is as bad a adaptation of a novel as I've seen. I read the book several times as a kid, loved it and was really looking forward to the movie. I hadn't watched any trailers or read any reviews, so I was going into this with an open mind.My heart sank as soon as I heard the godawful bubble-gum 'music' and I realised straight away that this was going to be another pile of manure, concocted to appeal to as many social demographics as possible.The young cast, especially the kid who played Meg, a complex (and interesting) character in the book, are terrible, the adult cast even worse.I can't bring myself to write any more, because that would involve me having recall memories of the time I wasted watching this complete and utter annihilation of a classic.Avoid.

reviews.review_title: I could have gone to the dentist instead
reviews.content: Really. Maybe if I were 8 and the fault of the filmmaker's was to allow this to be marketed as appealing broadly. I don't know anyone who would have liked it very much though. I'm not even sure what happened at the end - if totallu lost interest and went into the lobby to play Words With Friends. Giant Oprah. Yay.
Some bits didn't really make sense, and fit together. Thought it would be amazing considering the actors in the movie but it was below average.

This was one of my favorite books growing up. I'm not usually a fan of modern revisions of my favorite stories. This time, though, it was near perfect. Beautiful visually, excellent adaption of this timely and timeless story; the pacing was wonderful. Everyone in it was great, but the kids were fantastic. Storm Reid especially deserves much praise; Meg travels a greater distance internally than even her jaunt across the universe. I loved it so much. Planning to see it again!
I don't understand why people get worked up when a film remake is not same as the original. Or a book adaptation is not exactly like it was in the book.I think this is a good film.

I really wanted to see this film so bad when it was first announced as I loved the book it was based on, and was disappointed by that terrible tv movie they made years ago.Boy was I even more disappointed as this movie was actually in my opinion worse then older movie Disney made, and that is saying a lot.The acting was freaking cheesy, and was extremely corny as it was like they were trying way to hard to be whimsical or something. Like the most laughable line was was the " Flowers are the best gossipers of the universe line" which is just as laughable as the first films " These are glowworms they feed on laughter" line. The costumes the characters wore in the middle movie were terrible to the point of even looking laughable. They pretty much butchered the characters as they were bland, and weren't anything at all like they were in the book period. They completely got rid of several important plot points like the ixchel part which was important in the book, and the whole movie felt rushed also with some plot points not even making sense to me either.About the only thing I can say that I sorta liked about the movie as I kinda liked what they did with IT, but that's about it; speaking of which they didn't even beat IT either in movie did they? Like they just sorta left it, and to me that's a plot hole as that basically means it's still a threat to earth as they didn't mentioned it died or anything either.Honestly all in all I feel like I wasted money watching this movie, and felt like I should've listened to the reviews on this site instead of seeing it; I don't even consider this movie even good enough to get at a bargain bin because it was so bad.So In a way I kinda recommend the older movie more, but not much as even that movie wasn't that good; however it's still better than this movie by a lot honestly.

I don't understand the negative reviews. People giving this film 1 star have to be dealing with their own issues and prejudices.I'm a 30 year old man, and this film really touched my soul. I'm so happy to live in a world where children get to grow up watching a film like this, a film that encourages goodness and light while exploring ideas of consciousness and love in a ever expanding universe.My fear was that this film would be a greenscreen nightmare. It wasn't! There were some dazzling visuals in this film, and the soundtrack and music choices complimented every bit of the film perfectly.This cast was amazing, and the acting of the main actress was phenomenal!Thrilled to say that I will be watching anything Ava DuVernay puts her name on. She did a stunning job, and I will from this day on think of her as a visionary. Because she is!Just remember that this is a children's movie based on a children's book. If you enjoyed the book, there's no reason you can't enjoy this film.If you don't like this film, the film isn't the problem. Your eyes are the problem.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I ever seen
reviews.content: Damn, this is terrible, nothing in the movie makes any sense, if there's one word to describe this movie, the word is: RIDICULOUS

I didn't go to see A Wrinkle in Time at the theater after reading so many poor reviews. This was one of my favorite books as a child so I didn't want to see my love for it ruined by some poor attempt to bring it to the screen. It's been so long since I read it that I don't remember every detail, but the impressions and fondness have remained for decades. So, I finally decided to watch it on Netflix. Some of the poor reviews were from reader's of the book, that's why I can't understand so many bad ones. No, it's not completely faithful (at least as far as I remember), but the impressions, images, and feelings are recalled in this movie. It brought me back to things I read, visualized, and imagined. It reproduced the facination I got from reading the book, if not totally, enough to be worth it for me.Can a movie match a book when that book creates images and feelings that last nearly 5 decades? Maybe not quite, maybe not completely, maybe not with as much power. But I liked this movie and I am very happy to have an old love recalled in a way that brings back even some of that original fascination. I wish I'd seen it on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: It was a wrinkle but not in time
reviews.content: Great cinematography and soundtrack. Storyline was too difficult to follow .

This is an interesting film which is ultimately rather flawed and misses a lot of tricks.It starts off well promising a intriguing science fiction theme but then switches genre to an almost cartoonish fantasy hybrid. It feels like a series of clichés sewn together into a kind of patchwork mishmash.It has a fantastic cast whose talents are largely wasted in a rather pedestrian and stilted script.Disney's purchasing power is evident throughout the film which offers little charm.

Hello, I am Holly age 6. You guys are all wrong about this movie. It was really good. 
My favourite part was when Charles Wallace saluted at Calvin. 
My favourite character was the little brother, Charles Wallace. 
What was your favourite part?
Go and see this movie scaredy cats!

I always read IMDb reviews before I watch movies which caused me to go into a Wrinkle in Time with a very closed mind. I had heard it was inaccurate to the book and the story was all over the place. But, in the end, I was baffled as to why people hated it.Those that are complaining about the story need to remember that this story IS based off of a book, and it's actually pretty accurate with the exception of some of the scenes in Camazots and the character descriptions such as the medium and the it.The movie had very decent actors, and some of the child actors deserved oscars. For example, Charles-Wallas was probably the best kid actor in the movie and it's more impressive that he's the youngest. He could nail fake-crying and wasn't awkward or quiet.My one problem that costs this movie one star is Calvin. Holy crap did that kid make me want to pull my hair out. I know kids his age who are better actors and probably couldve made it into this movie. I know that he's a character in the book, but he didn't have to be added into the movie, nothing would've changed except the love subplot with Meg would've gone away. The lines that he was given were agonizingly awkward and the way he delivered them was just nails on a chalkboard.My favorite of these lines include:
"You have no idea how incredible you are""I like your hair...""I don't know... I just felt... that I had to be here."Despite that, watch this movie and form your own opinion. I was pleasantly surprised when I did.

I bought this movie today after deciding not to listen to the reviews I saw on here and I'm glad I did. It wasn't the best movie but not the worse movie either. The book is way better. Oprah Winfrey was great in this film. Storm Reid hopefully will go to do amazing things after this film. Chris Pine was good as Megs father. Mindy Kalling as Mrs. Who was cute, Deric McCabe did great as Charles Wallace and Levi Miller stood out as Calvin, now for Reese Witherspoon's performance one word great I loved her in this film.
This movie was beautiful and amazing in ways I cannot even describe!!!

Yes, Disney had made better movies, but this one is really not that good nor bad, if you were younger you'd probably like it or at least enjoy it, let's remember that the main target for Disney movies are children and not adults nor young adults.
The visuals were mainly good, in some scenes it was a little bad to be honest, the acting was good, the plot was good, overall I would rate it 6.5/10

I've never read the books, so I had zero expectations with the movie. On one hand, it was, at times, overly sappy and quite nonsensical. Other times, visually impressive and emotional. It had its ups and downs. This is a decent film for any child 8 years old or younger. There are plenty of family values to learn. However, parental guidance may be needed in the final climax of the film. It does get quite creepy and a little sinister. For some older crowds, it will be a snooze-fest And for some, an OK film worth seeing once. Younger kids will like it. Teens will hate it. The film does get weird at times and it seems unsure of itself. Some parts are Life-time channel sap. Others, borderline Burton. Some scenes cringe-worthy. Others pretty cool. If Christopher Nolan had made this film, it would probably have be regarded as a cinematic masterpiece. So, right in the middle. 5 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Indulgent, mastabatory, and not true to source
reviews.content: Awful treatment of a wonderful book. The movie completely misses the point of the book and proves that decent special effects cannot save a shoddy script. The acting is generally awful, Oprah's God complex is on full display, and it's just hard to watch this disrespectful mess.

This movie has no heart. It's boring and poorly acted. These kids could not carry the role, the plot was weak, the kids reactions and emotion were so hollow.It was weekday school special quality of production, really disappointing.

reviews.review_title: Surprised to see 4+ Stars for this movie on IMDB
reviews.content:
Don't waste your time, it's so bad that it's the baddest of bad in performance...
What were they thinking?!?!?! I am pretty sure, like me, some people just went to see the movie thinking it's from Disney, what's the worst that could happen...

The annual hypnosis masterpiece, Disney in recent years such a powerful and airtight quality control will still slip out of so unable to find the north of the work, unexpectedly also allocated a billion investment, it is difficult not to doubt that baby Di is familiar with the sacrifice of the policy will be popular again. Look at this boring script, broken art, always feel that the budget has been swallowed by the crew. If this is a children's bedtime story, then the world's babies should no longer lose sleep.

reviews.review_title: Great kids movie & very true to book's heart
reviews.content: This movie is glorious, sumptuous, & so true to spirit of the book. Like the book, it is pro-science, pro-diversity, anti-war, anti-commercialism, anti-capitalism. Like the book, it teaches that strength is the courage to open yourself to the vulnerability of loving others, it teaches the value of being generous and understood of others. Like the book, the movie show you evil is caused by fear and a desperate grasping safety through conformity, security at the expense of connections with others. Like the book, this movie is a light in the darkness.

reviews.review_title: A bloated and tone deaf adaptation
reviews.content: Madeline L'Engle, author of A Wrinkle in time was asked about the first filmic iteration of her novel, a 2003 made for tv movie. She said she knew it was going to be bad- and that it was. If Madeline were with us today, I'd be willing to bet she'd really dislike this terrible new version of her fantasy. There are a number of reasons for the truly awful viewing experience this film turns out to be, prime among them the fatal miscasting of almost every character in the book. This is especially true of Charles Wallace and Meg, the main protagonists of the story. Important scenes from the book have been omitted and the film's leaden pacing all but obliterates the suspense that made the novel so memorable. What really sinks A Wrinkle in Time is the fact that the book's sense of wonder, it's raison d'etre, if you will, is missing. Instead, we're subjected to overblown special effects sequences, stunt casting and bad acting. The irony is that the 2003 film that Madeline disliked comes closer to the heart of her story than this stinker.

reviews.review_title: The movie was so boring I could not watch till the end.
reviews.content: It started off nice. Then slowly it started going all over the place. Nothing wrong with the actors and actresses but the direction and story line was horrible and uninteresting. I just could not take it anymore after 49 minutes. It was so bad.

Wanted to like this, they had filmed some of it near where I lived in NZ and was hoping the beauty of it would help enhance the film. No. It didn't. Confusing, some terrible acting by some huge names. Bad script. Dodgy edits. Some of the effects are just awful. I actually fell asleep for a few minutes. Jumps all over the place.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely the worst Disney movie I have ever seen.
reviews.content: Absolutely the worst Disney movie I have ever seen. Considering the over 100 million dollars budget, 1 star is FAIR!

reviews.review_title: total waste of time, too bad even for Disney
reviews.content: Wasn't expecting an oscar runner but come on! worse thing ever watched in a while, and I've already watched Anon.
I loved this book, but this was just so freaking terrible. It did the book no justice. It was just trash... don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Excellent family movie w/ my 10 & 8 yr old boys
reviews.content: We liked watching this colorful and exciting movie! It touched on many things that kids worry about. It shows creativity & flexibility in characters as there are many changes throughout the movie. The dialog of light over darkness is hopeful for children & parents. It's a beautiful movie with some dark parts, which makes the light that much brighter.
Y'all haters this movie is awesome awesome awesomely awesomeness awesome

reviews.review_title: A HOMELESS GUY COULD MAKE A BETTER MOVIE
reviews.content: The plot of the movie was all over the place terrible acting and just the movie had me all twisted I had just read the book with a friend of mine to help her in school and I wanted to compare the book to the movie if I could give this 0 stars I would to be honest I would prefer the book over this pile of garbage any day. Would not recommend.

reviews.review_title: A Wrinkle in Time Review : Good Movie - 7/10
reviews.content: "A Wrinkle in Time" in general is a good movie. It portrayed amazing visuals. And as far as the story is, it was good! One of the some of little problems from the movie was the acting and character development. Although you get development, you don't really care about the characters until later in the movie. The spirits didn't really explain themselves until the middle of the movie. Calvin doesn't get explained a whole lot. And the explanation of how and why Charles Wallas came in contact with Mrs. Whatsit, Mrs. Who, and Mrs. Which is never really explained. Now as far as acting goes, Oprah Winfrey (Mrs. Which) Reese Witherspoon (Mrs. Whatsit) and Mindy Kaling (Mrs. Who) did fantastic. Storm Reid (Meg), Deric McCabe (Charles Wallas), and Chris Pine (Mr. Murray) also did a great job. Levi Miller (Calvin) also did good but didn't express emotion into his character. Overall the acting was great.All in all, this was a good adaptation of a wonderful book. They already made an adaptation prior to this one in 2003. 7/10 Good Movie :)

reviews.review_title: A Wrinkle in Time? More Like A Waste Of Time!
reviews.content:
Going into the theater I was with my seventh grade sister and my boyfriend. We were just finding a way to pass the time by going to the movies and to just hang out because what else do you really do on a Sunday night in the winter. I'm not very critical of movies or actors, I like most films I see even if they are a bit cheesy/cringe worthy and I never really knew what "bad acting" looked like, so walking into this I was expecting a mediocre film. I heard good things about the book that was published in 1962, lots of people said it was a classic that everyone adored. The casting also raised the stakes a bit considering Oprah Winfrey, Reese Witherspoon, Mindy Kaling and, one of my favorite actors, Zach Galifianakis were in it. They were also the face of all of the commercials shown for this science fiction film. The first fifteen minutes I was thinking to myself, "This isn't very good so far, but I'm going to give it some time, I'm sure it will get better!" Boy was I wrong. The acting and plot may have been some of the worst I have ever seen. Let me take this apart step by step. 
 Let's start with the plot. I haven't read the book, but I read a brief synopsis before we went in so that I could have a better understanding. To summarize it, the main character Meg (Storm Reid) and her younger brother Charles Wallace (Deric McCabe) have been left alone with their mother after their scientist father has disappeared for five years. Their father had thought up of a concept called a tesseract. A tesseract is the fifth dimension that can shorten the distances across both time and space therefore, forming a "wrinkle in time", hence the name of the movie. The kids, especially Meg, have been dealing with the absence of their father very poorly, affecting their social life and school work. Out of nowhere, (literally with no reason) Mrs. Whatsit (Reese Witherspoon) shows up and starts talking nonsense about their father and his study. After this incident, the kids get involved with two other mysterious astral travelers (Oprah Winfrey and Mindy Kaling). Now this is where it gets messy; the director did a bad job explaining on what was happening and why. One minute the kids and the travelers would be on another planet, and the next they would encounter an "evil force". To sum it up, the whole movie was these kids looking for their father with these mysterious travelers and !!SPOILER ALERT!! They find him and they all live happily ever after. The transitions between each part of the movie was unclear and confusing. The director did NOT do a good job.
 Now, I don't know much about acting and I haven't really noticed bad acting before but this movie was the definition of bad acting. The main character, Meg, was honestly terrible. I just remember this one line that she said and it made me cringe so much. Reese Witherspoon, Oprah Winfrey and Mindy Kaling weren't bad at acting but it just seemed like they didn't fit in with this type of movie. I view them as serious actors but this movie is like a joke in my eyes. The script was just not good, at all. The actors would say obvious things that just made you go "Really? Are you really that dumb?" I do give the movie some credit for having good actors to star in it to attract attention but that does not mean it was a good movie. 
 The one good thing that I will say about this awful movie is that the special effects were pretty cool. It was interesting and was probably the only thing that kept my attention throughout the movie. The whole concept of this movie was good and it has potential, but the way it was approached was just really terrible. I think after all the reviews this movie has gotten, the producers would do many things differently. So, to sum everything up, this is my least favorite movie I have ever seen and I was VERY disappointed. Definitely a WASTE of time. The only reason why I would tell someone to watch this film is for me to discuss the things that were so bad about it with that person. I wish I could wrinkle that time when I was in the theater.

reviews.review_title: Too many brainwashed people rated this low!!
reviews.content: Only people who haven't escaped the Matrix yet would rate this so low! People, who still think that time is linear. I don't agree with the concept of the evil that takes people away but the movie isn't as bad overall. I'd rate it a 6 or 7, only rating it 8 to counter the bad reviews!
Great watch with the kiddo. Not for adults looking for the next LOTR or something haha

reviews.review_title: Don't Waste Your Time Watching This Abominable Version of the Book, it is Just awful
reviews.content: When I went to see "A Wrinkle in Time" when I was young with my grade school I was mesmerized, enchanted and totally sucked in; it was an amazing tale of mystery, excitement and imagination, the acting was stellar and the story superb. This Disney version of the book was NONE of those things. This film reduced this amazing classic down to sub-par 3 year old mentality and regurgitated it in my face. I was so absolutely appalled by the silly, cheesy acting, the dorky outfits and weird sets that I could NOT stomach more then 5 minute intervals of this atrocity...excuse for a movie. This is such an abominable version of "A Wrinkle in Time" it's just ridiculous; the only actor I liked in this was Chris Pine as Dr Alex Murry. I suppose that watching 5 minute clips a day, perhaps space it years apart, maybe I'll have watched the whole thing sometime before 2025. This movie does NOT rate even a star. Don't waste your time.

I love Disney my whole life, but lately disney studio's departement seems to put less heart into their movies, this movie was again a dissappointment, 5th one in a row That I dont like, jungle book (John favreau)" Nutcracker, pirates 5, cinderella and maleficent, maleficent was the best one of these, but again considering the New style of movies they make I dont think they care about what they put money in anymore, the movies pre live action classics were kind of heart i'm calling frozen and wreck it ralph, heck even big hero six had his perks, but when disney goes trough with this I am afraid they wont make it anymore in the future. Gladly they have Marvel, Star Wars and Pixar, those People seem to care about what they produce.

If you've read the book the movie is almost unwatchable. So many missing parts that were integral to the story left me really disappointed. Easily should have been a two or three part movie to tell it properly. Such a great, imaginative book that you need to read if you haven't yet. Use the movie as an example of how not to bring a book to the big screen.

I'm a BIG fan of Disney movies, so I ignored the reviews and just purchased but and keep from Sky. Wished I hadn't the kids left the room to play on their gadgets. By the time the film finished I wished I had left with them.

When I left the theater I couldn't quite put my finger on it. I did not understand at first what exactly was wrong. And then I realized I loved the story I love the actors but did not like Oprah in this movie. I'm not quite sure if it was the distracting make up or the fact that it was just Oprah delivering Oprahlike lines there was no transcendence into the character. And I do realize that, that was her character. But it played too close to her real life. I wonder if she switch places with one of the other "misses" if it would've been better overall for the movie. It's not a bad movie It's just Oprah was too much - too much distracting make-up, too heavy of a custom, just too much. If they were supposedly made of light and guiding and searching for young warriors, Oprah was too heavy and grounded to be light and it left an imbalance between the three. The young actors, Chris, Gugu, Mindy, & Reese did their jobs and were immersed in their characters. Maybe it was me every time Oprah spoke it was just Oprah not her character. It may just be me ....but I'm not so sure about it. Hats off to the child actors...!!

reviews.review_title: Pay attention to the critics dates that they posted
reviews.content: It's pretty obvious that people are trying to give this movie a bad rating before it was even in the theaters. This movie is absolutely awesome! We read the book before seeing the movie and as in most cases it's a little different. It was great to be able to put a face to a name. This is such a great movie! I would suggest ignoring what the critiques say and make your own decisions for yourself. Again, the movie came out today but there are people who have posted reviews from yesterday so that says a lot about people's intentions.

It was so bad I fell asleep for an hour after the first 10 minutes and then surfed the internet for the last 1/2 hour of it. The best part of the movie is when the dad comes home after 4 years. Wouldn't it be incredible for a lost love one to return from the universe ie death etc. 
The acting was so bad. Oprah and Reese were the worst. 
Terrible acting and an incredible awful movie. Don't waste your time. And if you do want to watch it then kiss 2 hours of your life away into a wrinkle in time.

This movie is to the book as a plastic pizza slice dog toy is to an actual pizza. They took just enough components of the story to achieve a surface level resemblance. The loose or poorly explored plot points overwhelm the film. But all that aside, it's just a bad movie. As my title says, I'm simply disappointed that they threw away such a great story.
Great visuals. A fantastic book that unfortunately didn't transfer to the silver screen. Incredibly boring.

This movie is full of cliche after cliche, the same old plot where the main character's dad goes missing after inventing something incredible, the kid is left all alone with no friends. then she meets someone who says they can help her find her dad. great? no. as usual, the grown ups dont do anything themselves and expect kids to survive life-threatening dangers and do everything themselves. how did they even survive when the experts were not even ready to do this?? how did i survive this movie is the bigger question

reviews.review_title: I slept while I was at the movie theater!
reviews.content: Yes, I paid lots of money to watch this horrible movie in 3D! Then I slept while watching the first 1/4 of it. Can you imagine doing that while you came full of hope to see something special to find kids being the main actors of the whole movie. I am hugely disappointed not only in the movie itself but also how Oprah and Reese got their names in such a stupid movie after years of being absent. You return with something strong or stay absent forever, at least we can keep the good image in our minds not like now, when I think of Oprah I just see her in an ugly mermaid dress!

reviews.review_title: This was without a doubt the most heart warming, intense, and majestic film of my life
reviews.content: I had mixed feelings about seeing this movie, but through it all, I walked away far more impressed with A Wrinkle In Time, than I have ever been with any other film since The Shawshank Redemption. The film relates to the world as one filled with heart, passion, love, beauty, majesty, and angst. It was intense, dramatic, and filled with compassion to an extent in which I've never seen in a film. It was beautifully directed, and the actors more than outdid themselves, they were in fact phenomenal and I'm in fact shocked by the reviews that I've seen posted on here.
