Let me be the first to tell you that they are dead wrong. I don't take films or their artistry lightly, and by no means are the people downing this film correct in any way. This was by far the best movie I have ever seen in my 25 years on this planet. It had me in tears, laughing out loud, angry, anxious, and full of love to the point where it touched my heart to its very core. I believe that everyone who is interested in a well done and an artistically beautiful film needs to see this one. It will stay with me for the rest of my life, and I would see it 1000 times over, just for the sheer joy it brought to me and my loved ones. It is more than worth it, and you'll walk away from it feeling better than when you'd walked in. Prepare yourself for an amazing ride, and enjoy!

reviews.review_title: not the best but nice to watch
reviews.content: The best thing was the musical effects during the movie. reminded me lots of thr labyrinth and neverendingstory. visuals were nice too, all in all just a bit boring. but as i said,nice to watch anyways!cool special effects and a happy ending

Why oh why did Disney mangle such a classic book? As many others have said in their reviews the plot had more holes than Swis cheese. Why weren't Meg's younger twin brothers in the movie? I know they didn't have that big of a roll in the book, but it felt off not having them there.

My Mum fancied this film as she had apparently heard some 'good' things about it, so I thought I'd tag along and give it a go. I went in not expecting much and some how came out extremely disappointed and actually pretty annoyed. The scripting, directing, acting and over all story line was just crap. This film is full of plot holes and confusing and unnecessary characters. I feel like this film is a waste of time and money and it just really shouldn't exist. Seriously don't waste your time, if I had a choice to stare at the inside of my eyelids for 2 hours or watch this, I certainly know what I'd prefer to do.

reviews.review_title: Okay movie - don't see if you are a big fan of the book
reviews.content: Well acted, poorly scored (at least for the first 20 minutes), thin story taken from the classic book. If you have never read the book, you will likely enjoy it as a big budget, kid based action movie. If you have read the book, be ready for disappointment.

As a person who has read the book this was honestly pretty bad. 
Bad child acting (specially from Charles Wallace)
Calvin does almost nothing besides falling down
Bad editing 
Stuff that weren't mentioned in the book
Bad acting from the mom In the end I certainly wouldn't whach again for any reason at all.
The movie day was a pleasant experience because I was in a fieldtrip with school. if I wasn't I wouldn't enjoy the day at all.

reviews.review_title: Really enjoyable--DON'T listen to the haters!
reviews.content: I'll start by saying that I never had to read this book in school so that's where my difference of opinion comes in. With that said, the MOVIE version was adorable, bright, fun, colorful & sends a great message. Embrace who you are because we are all at different stages of our journeys and self acceptance is key & comparisons are the death of joy. Message was loud and clear...no matter how you adults feel about how it doesn't match up exactly with the book, if I'm a kid, that message will resonate with me. Just take the movie for what it is- an adaptation. Well worth the time.
First of all I did not know or hear of the books until I started watching this horrible waste of otherwise elsewhere much needed money. Disney should apologize to all of us by buying us the ori

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the other reviews say
reviews.content: While the other reviews accurately point out the loose-ended plot, poor acting, and unevenness of story movement that keep this from being a very good movie -- all these problems can't stop a good story from being entertaining. I had not read the book, so maybe that helped me like the movie. Also, I read the bad reviews before I went, so my expectations were low. Oprah's costume was distracting and fairly ridiculous, and the characters were cardboard representations of stereotypes. But regardless of the fact that the characters were flat and undeveloped, the theme of the story and some of the effects were enough to make this better than your standard "after school special" juvenile borefest. While this movie is not a great multi-star movie, it's worth a solid six.

reviews.review_title: PC plug with nothing to offer
reviews.content: I have read the book A Wrinkle In Time a dozen or more times, since I was in fifth grade and in that time, I have dreamed of a movie made from the book. I am still dreaming of that day. This movie slightly resembled the book, in that it was about the same basic thing, i.e. folding space and visiting other worlds. This movie, however, is so poorly made that had I purchased a ticket to see it in a theater, I would have sued for a refund and pain and suffering. First, the makers of the movie have completely changed the characters, all in an attempt to rid the movie world of those pesky Caucasians who have done so much evil in the world. It wasn't enough that a character named Margaret Murry, a red haired Irish girl is being played by a person who I assume is an islander, or perhaps half black, half white, but they had to change almost every character from the way they were described in the book, to something that satisfied the PC police, but ruined the movie. Then, the acting was horrific, the plot was off by a mile and the FX were something a kid could create on a PC. Anyone who says I am a racist for objecting to the multiculturalism in this movie is brain ded, it has nothing to do with the race of the actors, and everything to do with the book and with the fact that Hollywood is reinventing every movie and story, to punish Caucasians for our existence. This is sickening.

reviews.review_title: Literally the worst movie ever made
reviews.content: Crapped all over the story, crapped all over the medium of cinema. Irony: all the bull they keep shamelessly trying to make the "message" of the film lies, in reality, in the subtleties and subtext of the book- clearly out of the intellectual reach of whoever wrote this pile of goat feces. Conclusion: this movie is the personification of IT.

My god this is the first time I didn't finish a movie and just left, I really tried to stay but nope I can't. the plot was horrendous, feels like a team work but everybody hates each other, so many unnecessarily long and meaningless cut scenes with awful background, some scenes' background looked so fake almost felt like a painting. i thought the trailer was weirdly kinda bad, but nope the movie was worse. also kids movie is not an excuse for bad movie

reviews.review_title: Don't believe the low ratings. This movie is amazing.
reviews.content: I absolutely loved this movie. It's beautiful made with a heartwarming story that's dark enough in the right places that the story is still very compelling. All the well-known actors are of course amazing, but I'm really impressed with the child actors in this movie. Along with the scenery and story, their perfomances were the ones who made this movie so good. Would definitely recommend it to anyone regardless of age.

reviews.review_title: Top pick for Mystery Science Theater 3000
reviews.content: Omg this movie is so boring and poorly adapted and acted. What a complete dismissal of the original. I don't even get it so how is my 7 year old to understand it? Thankfully I did not pay to see it so I decided to fold laundry instead of waste one more minute of my life couch critiquing this hot mess. I can't even... lol Oprah the 20 foot space mermaid...and poor Reese... not her wheel house either, ugh it's just such a disaster.., Mystery Science Theater top pick.
I watched the DVD with mixed emotions. Then I went to watch the bonus features and here are these two girls waving their asses as they get on a elevator. How Disney is that?

reviews.review_title: Not the disney movie I expected
reviews.content: Had to see the movie because my wife wantd to. Not the kind of disney movie I expected.

reviews.review_title: Yall are stupid for leaving hate reviews and for not enjoying the actual lessons of this movie.
reviews.content: I might look blonde to some or thick to others but I found this movie very interesting and I got taught so many things. I was depressed and I was roaming to what movie to watch and this popped up , I thought to give it a try and now I feel way better about myself and I thank the movie for it. I can acknowledge the effort that the people have put into making this to at least show the ones who know how to appreciate that time is valuable and only if you can think outside the box you can see the true colours of this movie!!

I didn't like this Lifetime movie as much as some others I have seen, but this is the first one I saw in a theater. Nothing happened, and there was no tension. I went to the bathroom and took my time because it was more interesting, and I am one of those people to sprint when I have to leave the theater.

I recommend watching this movie in the evening with some friends. The catch is that you have to drink one shot every time someone is saying the word tesseract. At the end you will realise what great potential this movie really has.

reviews.review_title: It would be a waste of my internet data to even pirate this garbage.
reviews.content: This movie was a complete mess, the other reviews speak for themselves.

reviews.review_title: It's amazing to be a geek girl ;)
reviews.content:
This movie has Chris Pine!!! and Oprah, and Reese Witherspoon. And 3 child actors that will do really great things. That Deric can be whatever he wants to... It's fricking amazing. "Calvin" will grow up and break a lot of hearts, intentional or not ;)
The movie: ehm... it's really weird, but the take on some things makes you to start to think about a lot of things.
It's definitely not the worst movie ever!
And yes, great music.
Really great family movie.And Reese transforms into... into...
You have to see it to believe it, Reese deserved her Disney princess time, for a while now :)

reviews.review_title: It was pretty good, only to be taken as a children's movie
reviews.content: It was a pretty good movies, Dont feel it was the best. It confusing if you dont understand the book (or the older version of this movie). My kids never read the book, so they were completely lost.
I dont know how to say and where to start. This is the worst Disney movie I have ever seen ;(

reviews.review_title: Save your time and just read the Reviews, it's far more entertaining!
reviews.content: Pretty much every review her is spot on, just terrible. I'm so surprised that nobody had the guts to tell Disney, please just throw away the 100 million and keep your reputation.Like my Wife said, the move is so bad that we now want to read the book just to redeem the story. I normally don't like to be so negative but I was constantly cringing and wondering what just happened. I don't even do movie reviews but this is just so bad that well... there is just no words to describe it.

"A Wrinkle in Time" is a baffling movie experience. It's an ambitious adaptation, and I'll give them credit for trying, but they come nowhere close to pulling it off. The story is a complete mess. There's no rhyme or reason to the events that happen, the places they visit, and the people and things they encounter. I'm sure in the book these things were all developed and explained thoroughly but in the movie it all just comes off as random and nonsensical. One moment they're on some planet riding a space wizard, the next moment they go to another planet to visit another space wizard, then suddenly they are in another place facing an inexplicable hazard that of course they magically overcome, then they're at a beach running into a red-eyed Michael Pena, etc. It's science-fiction/fantasy at its worst, where the story is completely incoherent and all the explanations for what's happening is just 'magic' or 'love' or 'because'.The dialogue is also so artificial, that's just not how people talk to each other, at least not in the modern day setting it's supposed to be set in. And 'Charles Wallace' is an incredibly dumb and annoying name. I find it very hard to believe that at least the sister wouldn't have found a shortened nickname to use. That may sound like a minor nitpick, but considering they say/shout the name about a hundred times during the movie, it just becomes grating to the ears.It's a shame, because there's so much talent involved in the making of this movie. The cast is top notch, although many of the actors are wasted on dumb characters, and even all the younger actors do a very good job, particularly the young girl. It has a talented up-and-coming director. Visually it looks pretty great most of the time and it does some really cool and unique things with the visuals, but visuals alone can't save a movie if they serve no purpose to the story. The one area of the movie I do consistently really like is the score, particularly in those moments that are meant to avoke wonder. It's nothing too revolutionairy, just very well-executed, and I was not surprised to learn from the credits that the composer is the excellent Ramin Djawadi of Game of Thrones and Westworld fame.Overall, this adaptation was a sorry misfire that was unfortunately doomed to fail from the start. Complex science fiction and fantasy stories that deal with complicated matters such as different dimensions and time travelling/bending (of which there is a severe lack in a movie that has the concept of 'time' in its title by the way), simple cannot be accurately translated into a 100 minute movie, mainly aimed at children. It usually either becomes an exposition dump of dry information, or they simply don't bother to properly explain the concepts at all, both of which result in poor story-telling. Maybe in the future, these novels get the elongated television series treatment they deserve, similar to how the upcoming His Dark Materials (2019) tv series will hopefully clear the stain of the horrible 'The Golden Compass' (2007) movie adaptation.
This movie was a feel-good movie that had a great ending. The movie was sweet and the cinematography was really amazing. Overall they made a great movie!

reviews.review_title: The time I spent watching it could have been better spent watching the grass grow.
reviews.content: At least, I could have been outside in the fresh air watching the grass grow and woudn't have to endure many cringe-worthy scenes. A meaningless film that tries very hard to let us know love conquers all. OK, what else? Awful costumes, very dark scenes and bad acting. Image of a 20+ feet tall Oprah is not something I remember with pleasure and neither are almost any scene in this drivel. Avoid it and definitely do not expose any children to it. They might be turned off to movies at best and have nightmares for a new nights at worst.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst but not the best from Disney
reviews.content:
Having not read the book and seeing all the interviews with the the 3 strong female actresses who play Mrs What, Mrs Who and Mrs Which I was very excited to see this film with my kids. 
 Sadly it didn't live up to the hype. My kids and I found it confusing at times as the plot jumped around with no real explanation. There were some beautiful visuals and all the cast acted well especially Meg played by Storm Reid.
 It's a shame because the moral of the story was strong but there was no structure and it just missed something whether it be a little comedy to lighten the darkness or more time spent on the characters and knowing them better. 
 Wished it had been the movie we had hoped for from Disney but they can't win them all....

I didn't hate this movie. I didn't love it. It was pretty to watch, but the script was awful. I think the actors were fine, the kids were cute and fun to watch. There were a couple of really sincere deep moments where I wanted to cry. Overall the movie is fun. It's not Disney quality, but I enjoyed it.

I feel like I fell asleep in the middle, and missed half the movie? A good beginning and end, but for a movie that seems to be about the journey, it feels like most of the middle ended up on the cutting room floor. I haven't read the book, but it does feel like this adaptation has skipped a lot of finer detail assuming the viewer has more knowledge of what's happening. A shame, as there is a lot of potential with the cast and effects.

Great acting by the 2 kids. Reese Witherspoon was perfect too. But the movie was a weird, crazy object lesson in the package of someone's weird time-spirituality worldview - that I'm just glad I don't share.There are some good timeless truths esp about accepting and loving ourselves and forgiving ourselves and love conquering all evil.Not the worst movie but certainly not the best for me.

reviews.review_title: I should have believed the reviews
reviews.content: There's nothing good I could say about this film. The writers and director officially created the worst movie I've ever seen. If i were them, I'd probably avoid ever admitting I worked on this production.
Horrible movie, didn't understand what was going on half the time....ranks right up there with the Matrix....it was that bad.

reviews.review_title: Magical - Don't understand the poor reviews!!!
reviews.content: I'm completely thrown by the critical reviews. I am a fan of the original work *and* I absolutely LOVED this adaptation. In fact, this film connected me more deeply to the spirituality of the story's message. Sure, it wasn't perfect, but I was overwhelmed by the beauty, love, and magic this film conveyed. I really think people who hated it just did not let go and let it in. Absolutely loved it.

reviews.review_title: A touching movie aimed at younger audiences
reviews.content:
I am really shocked to see so many negative reviews, because this movie was beautiful. Sure, it was cheesy at some points, but this movie was aimed at kids, so the way messages were delivered was appropriate. 
As someone who struggled a lot with being bullied in school and accepting myself, and understanding that I deserve to be loved, I found this movie to be hitting so close to home. It was super relatable and the main character had a ton of character development! It was awesome to see.
I also found that the actors/actresses were so young, and they had such a good performance!
This movie is really worth watching, it's heart warming and emotional with really nice messages. :)
I wanted to like this movie. I really did. I gave it two stars because the visuals were nice. That's about all it had going for it.

reviews.review_title: Disney got experimental and it wasn't horrible at least.
reviews.content: So basically is a movie about kids taking acid. I do appreciate the experimental and cinematography qualities of this film, there are a few times when it gets amazingly done! And others when it looks cheap and bad written. It's indeed and unforgettable piece. I little to over the place. And the main character the little girl, she's the while movie. Amazing amazing performance for such a weak script.

I could tell from the previews that this was going to be far from the book so I tempered my expectations. Even with that I was so disappointed. Beautiful as it was the movie was disjointed and had no real flow. It was rushed in some parts and dragged in others. The actors were lovely but overall this was very poorly done and a giant disappointment.
Rather a disappointment, confusing story, not explained well. Hard to stay awake in the beginning. FX good.
Beautiful scenery and visuals but the overall story was quite lacking and that is a mild assessment.

First, if i was the screenwriter of this movie, i will not want to have my name in the credits. It script was awful ! And if you want to pass some hidden message, DO NOT SHOW US WHAT THE MESSAGE IS ! Let me as a viewer find it ! About the dialogue. I didn't know what to say about it. It didn't have any sense from time to time. And also those kids, exept Charles Wallace were dumb. Like for real dumb. The girl got so many leads on what to do and she wasn't able to figure that out. She went to another world and didn't wanted to start belive that she can do stuff. Her brother who had funny name was the one who understand the world and how it works. But still. SHE DIDN'T GO WITH THE FLOW ! And also i didn't find the reason for the Pan guy ( Calvin ) to be in the movie. He looked like he was high all the time.
Casting:
Storm Reid - Meg ( pretty decent job )
Oprah - I know that she has a nice voice and it really suits her character but damn, she had some really bad delivery.
Reese - I don't like this actress so i don't want to talk about her performance
Mindy - Why on earth did they casted her ? It didn't felted like all of these three actresses ( Oprah , Reese and MIndy ) were suitable for these characters. And also i'm againts about changing the race of the characters.
Levi Miller - Calvin : he tried ( bad script can make you look bad )
Deric - Charles : good job kid !
Chris Pine : He did the best he can.
Gugu Mbatha-Raw - She was good too.
Okay. So now the reason why i gave this movie 4 stars. I liked the music and the amazing world it showed to me. But I wanted to see more of that first planet. Or planets like that. And from the dark side perspective it was cool again. The IT reminded me of the upside-down from stranger things. But also felted really bad for the makeup. It was just terrible. They've made the Misses especially Oprah to look like Pharaoh. And the costumography was not that good too.

reviews.review_title: Wow this movie cant get any worst
reviews.content: This is one of the worst movies that I have ever seen. didn't think that Disney could stoop this low.

Based on the fantasy novel, A Wrinkle in Time follows a girl and her younger brother as they venture through reality to find their father who went missing years ago. Along the way, they come across a slew of creative characters and eye pleasing visuals. And that's about all the film has to offer. A Wrinkle in Time is not only overly whimsical, but also contains moments that are so awful they're almost laughably bad. One of these scenes involves a gigantic Oprah Whinfrey who plays Mrs.Which, gazing down like a diety at the main characters as they whimsically run through an enchanting island, even though their father's life is on the line. The rest of the film is a series of forcefully enchanting moments that don't exactly propel the story. Sometimes the filmmakers even throw in some modern pop music! It only gets cheesier from there. The film's only saving grace lies in the relationship between Chris Pine and Storm Reid. Both of these actors do a good job conveying a father-daughter relationship through acting alone. Keep in mind I said "acting" alone. Toward the end of the film, one of these characters does something very unforgivable that isn't addressed for the remaining of the film. In terms of dramatics storytelling, this ruins the once believable relationship. Aside from some nice visuals, which honestly could have been better considering the film was made under Disney, A Wrinkle in Time is a forgettable and overblown fantasy that is worth skipping over.

One of the worst films we have seen in a long time. Story is full of plot holes and in the end zero emotion. Just don't really care about any of the characters. Forced and contrived mixed with special effects that are not even special. The 1 star reviews are true. Nothing here to see folks. Best to move on.
I feel like the crew didn't take their time when this film was made because the story felt rushed. Also the editing seemed off. The story also seemed somewhat confusing.

This film would have rated as a bit sub-standard in 1972. The idea that it was made in 2018 beggars belief. Oprah? Oh, she's an alien goddess fairy godmother thing. Just give her lots of silver eyeshadow and a mermaid tail and it will be fine.

reviews.review_title: Good effort....saw where it was going but not a good plot to get there
reviews.content: I normally do not give reviews but I had too this time. I saw where the story line or plot was going but it was not an easy place to get there. The movie just did not flow to me. It was a bit everywhere and to me it was not easy for viewers to follow. It was a good effort and try but could had been written better. I like the message and hate that this movie did not give a good delivery of it. It just did not have the best actors to carry the message out. We are all light beings and yes once we see our beauty, the true self, we can break any form of darkness upon us. Darkness can only survive through energy and when we give into it then yes we give darkness power. But in order to weaken darkness we have to ignite our lights through removing the layers of the program that has been placed on us through societal ways. Yes, oneness is key to being whole with the universe that A Wrinkle In Time was not able to deliver well. Good try and I hope we can get better plotted movies out to deliver this powerful message this movie attempted. Or a redo of this movie in the near future.

I never read the book, never even heard of the book till I read the reviews. The movie has parts that are very slow and then long songs where nothing happens. I heard it wasn't very good but it was on Netflix which we have. I wish there was a little comedy in the movie but it was all serious and sad stuff but it did have a good happy ending.

Most of the reviews are comparing the book to the movie. I did not read the book so I have nothing to compare it to. I enjoyed the movie. It wasn't a 10, but it definitely does not deserve some of the low scores it's getting.

reviews.review_title: wrinkly watches time and space movie
reviews.content: I just love to see the reviews by people who obviously have passed their 40th birthday and have no imagination or wonderment left in any corner of their minds. I loved this film and my wife did too. It's also a very good example of a lot of hard work in the graphics side. We both said (hint at age spoiler) the grandchildren will LOVE this movie. All I had when I was young was Popeye etc, that's a hint too. Great film, take your children and let them watch the movie eating popcorn loudly if they are near any amateur film critics...
What in the hell? Seriously? This is as bad as Eragon was!

reviews.review_title: A Good Film, Great Cast.. Underrated?
reviews.content: All in all, this film was 'Good'. But I would have liked to see more of the plot from the book it's self. As A big fan of the book, I naturally eagerly awaited the released of the movie. I felt that the movie got underrated, it was a substantial film, with a well known cast, so I don't know why it didn't gross well in the box office. I would recommend seeing this film, I did feel that the story moved a little to fast, at least faster than the book, but the movie did leave out some main plot points. Though the Screenplay could have been written better, I do recommend 'A Wrinkle In Time' as a great children's pick, I enjoyed the movie, all in all.

reviews.review_title: Confused by reviews - I enjoyed it.
reviews.content: Saw "A Wrinkle in Time" on Saturday and enjoyed the movie very much. I was in a theatre FILLED with families and the children were quiet and engaged throughout. As a lifelong fan of the Madeleine L'Engle series, there were some things missing from the movie that disappointed me. But overall it is a pretty good adaptation.Yes, there might be a little too much clunky CGI but I thought all of the acting was very good. Meg was very good, with all of her wonderful faults. Charles Wallace was not as developed as I would have liked, but knowing the story, that was OK. (One of those missing scenes where Meg confronts her father and all the ways they try to break CW away from the IT should have been in there...)I will admit that would actually give the movie a 7 or so, but I rated it higher because I fear that MANY of the reviews are racially motivated and thereby bringing the overall score down. This makes me very sad, especially considering the theme and point of the book and film.
Ava Duvernay is bae. She did a wonderful job. Bless you Oprah.
The movie does not captivate and found myself turn turning it off for other amusements....

Saw it on Sunday, opening weekend with my wife and 10yo daughter. This is based on a beloved book, that my mother told me was one of her favorites of all time. We loved it. It was a good movie, that isn't meant for everyone.
I liked it, but my daughter loved it. This movie was made for her. She's gifted, she's got ADHD, she marches to her own drum, and is now at the point in school where she has learned that not everyone wants to be her friend.
She cried happy tears many times. She snuggled into her parents during the movie. That's why I know this movie hit where it was supposed to. 
My mom would have loved it. It had everything she loved about the book.
I'm good with that.

Ava Duvernay has done it again.A Wrinkle in Time is stunning. It's gorgeous, thought provoking and filled with adventure. This movie of course is based off the novel by Madeleine L'Engle. It focuses on the Murray family, namely Meg and her younger brother Charles Wallace. Their father, a famous scientist, has been missing for four year and three mysterious women appear to help the children find him.If you're a person who likes dark, depressing movies, I'm going to go ahead and say skip this movie because one of the main themes about this film is love. It's like the book as well. One of the reasons this film is so great is it shows young girls that love can be a powerful thing. Storm Reid (who plays Meg) does a fantastic job, giving us a character who is relatable and admirable. Deric McCabe (Charles Wallace) also does a fantastic job. The casting in this film is phenomenal, giving us a fantastic cast and each actor delivers a wonderful performance. I honestly think this film did a great job of adapting the source material. I couldn't be happier and I enjoyed this film. If you liked the book, go see this movie. If you haven't read the book, I would say stay away.

When I heard that Ava Duvernay was making an adaptation of one of my favorite books, I was excited; finally, a great filmmaker can do justice to the story after the TV-movie fiasco. Unfortunately, the studios must have tampered with the adaptation as it isn't a movie directed by a talented director; instead, it is more of a nauseous CGI-induced trainwreck being conducted by unusually drunk circus animals.Before I get my numerous gripes with movie out of my system, I'll at least commend it for casting a black girl as Meg Murry. It was a very brave decision, especially considering that it was a major blockbuster coming from the image-obsessed corporate known as Disney.I also want to state upfront that race has nothing to do with me not liking the film. I'm whiter than snow and thus don't get racist crap thrown at me with the same intensity/frequency that some of my fellow citizens sadly do. I accept that everyone is different, but I judge people based on their character, not their physical differences.
This comes from my unique upbringing - I'm autistic and suffer from OCD. I'm extremely sympathetic towards people. I grew up in a multicultural diverse church - Bridgeway Community Church, if you're curious; my father has traveled all over the world and taught me to love all kinds of people for their differences. I'm a social advocate who believes in the Black Lives Matters movement as a stepping stone for much-needed racial conciliation. There's not a racist fragment in my being. I also don't have a vendetta against the director. On the contrary, Ava DuVernay is a great person who has made great contributions to the art of cinema, especially with her wonderful documentary 13th. Rather, I'm just stunned that her latest movie was poorly made studio-processed garbage.The movie's basic composition/mise-en-scene was shockingly most unprofessional; its ugly color schemes made the Transformers movies, aka decomposing roadkill, look attractive by comparison. All the acting performances were horrific, especially with the child actors being the most guilty of making wood look more human. The music comprised of soullessly generic pop hits that it arrived deader than a doornail.Worse of all, the script reeked of corporate pandering. First of all, it censored the book's inherent liberal Christian ideology to the point that it became a name-in-only adaptation. Second, it became a boringly bad-at-motivational cliche fest that not even an innocent child would willingly accept. Third, it got rid of what made the book special, which was making kids think for themselves. Gone with the cool scientific concepts, in with cringeworthy CGI and overblown nonsense that insults basic intelligence.The more I write about this disaster, the more I feel sorry for Ms. DuVernay. She clearly has talent, yet her vision conflicted with the studio's financial priorities; hence, we end up with this cinematic travesty. Worse of all, this movie doesn't work with its prime audience as we don't find the characters relatable like how we do with Madeline L'Engle's timeless book.I watched the movie with my older sister and her two kids- both of whom are in preschool. When the movie ended, my sister was gobsmacked at how awful it was. Her children played with their toys once the movie lost their attention yet they stayed within distance of the dreadful thing. Wanting to know what her children thought of the film, she asked her youngest child if the movie was any good. Barely looking up from his toys, he shook his head and replied with one new vocabulary word: "No".

reviews.review_title: Film adaption, did not have much to it.
reviews.content: I have not read the book but I still thought there was not much to it. From what I have I heard the book is really good when I went to the movie it was not as good as I heard the book was. I read part of the book and the included just a portion of that. It is probably one of my least favorite movies.
Complete waste of time. Heads should roll over this, What were they (execs at Disney who permitted this to be shown) thinking? A travesty - an excellent book, reduced to meaningless, emotionless pap.

reviews.review_title: Not great, but also not as terrible as they'd let you think
reviews.content: So let's get the good stuff out there: the visuals are pretty great. I loved the costumes of the Mrses, Nobody, and I dug Zach Galifianakis as Happy Balance. I liked the diversity of the cast, as it didn't seem to make much a difference either way, which is refreshing. I thought much of the cinematography was well done and quite beautiful. Now for the faults: like most people who have seen this film, the plot is severely lacking. I understand that they're going to find Meg's father, but that is clearly the McGuffin here. Though it's role as the McGuffin is largely undercut by the fact that Meg's father's disappearance is supposed to be the foundation for her despair; so the fact that her search for her father doesn't really matter much means that when they do find him, I don't particularly care. I mean, sure, the reunion itself is emotional, but as far as what it means for Meg as a whole person, it doesn't seem to matter at the bottom line. And I think that's a lot of the problem with this movie-much of the emotion is forced and hollow, with the film telling you how you should feel rather than allowing you to feel it. For example, Calvin just suddenly appears on the street with Meg and Charles Wallace and just stares at Meg and compliments her hair. It's incredibly awkward. I also don't understand why Meg is so important. It's made clear that she's smart, like her parents, but not an oddball savant like Charles Wallace. Yet the Mrses (Mrs. Which, specifically) is convinced that only Meg can save the universe from the Darkness. But why? And besides, if the Darkness is pure evil, why is it not a more powerful force? Why is there no dark, tentacle cloud over Earth? Why does it just manifest as jealousy or abuse in humans? I'm sure this is probably explained in the book, but to be frank, I don't remember much about the book when my fifth grade class read it. There are a lot of questions about the universe that are glossed over or brushed aside and it weakens the movie as a whole. So aside from convoluted story and plot (which I can put squarely on the shoulders of the screenwriters) the pacing also feels off. We spent a good 15 minutes of run time on a flower planet, that while quite pretty, doesn't lead us to much, other than Mrs. Whatsit deciding they need to see a Seer (Happy Balance) to find their father. Why not do this in the first place? They waisted 15 minutes of the movie on a flight sequence that had very little to do with the plot or story at the end of the day. And it's instances like this that make the 1hr, 49min run time feel heavily bloated. I sat through Wall-E (slightly over 2hrs) and the time flew by. By the time Meg finally has her Boss Battle with IT, I was ready to head out. They spend the first 45mins of the movie setting up the characters, but none of it feels particularly necessary. If Act I had been shortened into 20 minutes, it would have left more time for them to explore more of the Universe on the way to finding Meg and Charles Wallace's father. Or they could have just cut it down by 20mins and have been fine. I have to say, people are railing on this movie, and it's really NOT that bad. It's pretty heavy subject matter for kids (some pretty heady ideas being tossed around) but if you think your kid will sit through it, then I think it's worth a watch. I wouldn't spend $15 on it, but $5-$8 sure. I also have to say, hating on the acting is a bit unfair. For the Mrses, Nobody, and Happy Balance, they are beings who are choosing human forms so that the kids can relate to them. They can be whatever they want to be. To expect them to be emotionally human as well is unfair, thus I believe that the irritation one might feel with the acting stems from that. I'm of the opinion that it was a directorial choice and should be noted as such. In conclusion: an OK movie. Not great, but not the worst movie I've ever seen.
Garbage movie, boring, bad acting. I hated that I watched this movie and wished I didn't. It was a waste of a nice childhood favorite book.

I am one of the people that heard the bad reviews and took some time to actually watch. I read the series as a kid and remembered loving the concept. Upon viewing I get that it is a kid movie but it was boring 😪. the acting and feel of the movie was like an abc Sunday night movie, that I remembered watching as a kid. Cheap and looks like everyone in the movie wasn't into the movie. avoid avoid

I went to see this movie with my sons, and had a wonderful time. My older son commented with pleasant surprise that he had not originally wanted to see it since it looked like a girls' movie. He said he enjoyed the "technology" (science) and was impressed by Meg's bravery. I loved the beautiful costumes, scenery, and uplifting message.

I stupidly ignored the 4 star rating and went ahead and watched this movie (well half of it).I won't spend too much of my time on this review as I already wasted an hour of my life that I won't be getting back!In summary.The acting's poor (despite the cast).The special effects are terrible, first hour of the movie is just the actors standing around in front of poorly cgi'd backgrounds.The "plot" is rushed / non existent. They just start jumping around from place to place with little explanation.I expect a lot more from Disney. Terrible movie.
It's a disappointment. A lot of unecessary scenes and the plot is a trying hard science movie. It doesn't give justice to "wrinkle in time" theory if there really is any.

The movie could have been completed even without Storm Reid -- and the too many close ups that come along with her exposure. McCabe could have carried the story all by himself. Props to Reese and Mindy for adding life and light to the film, but other than that, it was too slow-moving and boring. I tried watching despite the negative reviews and I gave up half an hour into it.

reviews.review_title: A great use of my time!
reviews.content: A well done movie, with a great use of visuals and special effects. The cast is fine and the story is decent. A good family movie. Only problem is it is slow in a couple of parts as the story builds. Overall, a good and enjoyable movie.

I loved L'Engle's books when I was young, so I was excited to see this movie coming. It's a common saying: "the book was better," but this one unfortunately goes beyond that. This adaptation was a total flop. It seems like they were so caught up in visuals that they forgot to explain anything with the story. It's been a while since I've read the book, but I know there was SO much more... The movie just left me thinking, "What? Why??" How did that little of a story line even fill up that much time?
Poor Madeleine is rolling over in her grave. :(
What a disappointment!!! I would rather watch frozen then to waste time watching this one again...

reviews.review_title: stop calling him by his full name!
reviews.content: The main character, the young girl, is very confusing: is she a shy child or is she a mature adult who doesn't like her hair complimented? I cant tell, it's like whoever wrote her dialogue switched from between her being a child to her being a wise adult. Also, why'd she have to keep calling her brother "Charles Wallace", repeatedly? just call him "Charles" or "CW"! The cast just make me uncomfortable. And each time I see the title of this, I keep thinking it's called "Winkle in time". Only reason to watch this may be for Oprah Winfrey.

reviews.review_title: Without knowing the source material it wasn't bad and wasn't grear
reviews.content: The movie doesn't explain anything, it's intentions seem good but the display is bad. Who what why when.

This movie audience is definitely targeting 7-12 years old girls. If you are not within that age range, don't loose your time. Movie is terrible, terrible acting, terrible motion, terrible scenes, overall a terrible experience. I can't say anything good about this movie, just awful.

Awful movie, bad acting, bad directing, bad screenplay. One of the most stupid setups is that the children go after their dad, do all these brave searches and than daddy just leaves his son there with IT. Actually leaves both of his children and returns home alone with the neighbour kid..... such stupidity, it hurts. 
Same feeling as with Movie 43.
I thought the CGI effects were really rubbish for this day and age. My kids read the book and so it was nice for them to see the film, but they generally really enjoyed it though.

reviews.review_title: The Neverending Story meets Hook meets The Oprah Show
reviews.content: This movie is basically 2018's version of Hook meets The Neverending Story meets the literal Oprah show. If you go into it with that expectation, I legitimately think you'll like it. It was sweet and weird and two of the four of us cried. I was not one of them. But I had a good time. Plus, it's directed by a badass black female director, stars a mixed race teenage girl, an adopted kid, a biracial couple, and an eye candy teen boy who plays the useless tagalong that girls usually have to play in movies. Oprah basically plays herself, Reese Witherspoon also pretty much plays herself, and Mindy Kaling kind of plays a kindly stoned human Wikipedia that only speaks in quotes. But probably the best performance from this movie is Chris Pine. Sir, we do not deserve you. I think it's also important to remember that this book was freaking weird. So the movie is weird. And I think Ava did a great job translating it to screen. It's definitely a kids movie and has a simple message and a fairly paint by numbers plot line. But you'll probably have a good time and it will probably make you feel nice. So yeah, I recommend it. If nothing else, go see it to support a movie that has less white people than non-white people on screen in a movie that doesn't feel the need to have the word black in the title.
Great film, great message and fantastic for kids. Perfect fantasy with a good dose of sci-fi. Judging by some of the other reviews if you don't follow the genre you may find it difficult.

From the opening scene, this disjointed, terrible storyline took all the scifi elements of the book and spent about 5 total minutes of the movie on them. The rest was some terribly written and acted garbage about feelings joined together by undeveloped characters and unexplained scenes.This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: wtf was happening i fell asleep
reviews.content: The only good thing about this movie was when i slept through it

Despite an exciting cast and great visuals, I found this film very dull, boring and bland. I rarely felt excitement, and had next to none investment/interest in the plot.As a personal dislike, I found the little boys (Charles Wallace) voice to be extremely irritating...

reviews.review_title: No Wrinkle but Waste in Time
reviews.content: That's 1 hour 49 minutes of Time I'll never get back 8n my life

reviews.review_title: A wonderful message with a few wrinkles of its own
reviews.content: I have been waiting so long too see this movie, and for me, it did not disappoint. the message portrayed in "A Wrinkle In Time" is more powerful than any plot or character flaws. However, there were some flaws. At times, Oprah's character felt as if she didn't understand the meaning of what she was saying. the intensity and important tone was not there. I also felt like the climax of the movie came all of the sudden. Boom, here it is, and then it is gone. This was a bit disappointing. A great movie overall to see with kids. The message was by no means undermined by these few flaws. This movie continues to have messages meant for children that even some adults won't understand.

Given all of the one-star reviews, I was expecting an uneven movie, at best. What I got was a beautiful quest narrative led by Storm Reid and a host of incredible actors that actually surpassed the book in its storytelling.Let's be honest. The book was written a long time ago. It glosses over a lot to keep moving from place to place and the final boss would be seen as goofy these days. But while the movie cut some elements, they are ones that would've dragged the plot down and taken focus away from the emotional core. More is explained (more clearly) and more connections between the parents and their children are SHOWN. If you don't cry at some point, you must actually have succumbed to IT.The only weird acting I saw came from Reese Witherspoon, and it makes sense when you figure out what she is. Mindy Kaling did so much amazing background acting, just with her face, and Oprah... well, who couldn't use a pep talk from Oprah on why you should love yourself? Love is the message, and you aren't beaten over the head with it. Love for yourself, love for your family, be a positive force in the universe because darkness is everywhere.You can choose to do and be better. It's a great movie that I will be watching over and over. The extremity of the negative reviews make zero sense. Neither does their inability to understand the plot or realize that no unicorns are in this movie (wait for A Swiftly Tilting Planet). IT WAS GOOD.

reviews.review_title: The credits are the best thing about this movie!
reviews.content: I finally saw this on Disney +. It opens up very straightforwardly and then dives into a disjointed, unenjoyable, unimaginative, silly movie. It's as if the director lost focus and whatever character arcs or lesson we could take away from it were lightly touched on with no character development. The lost dad was a character I barely knew and so for the rest of the movie their quest seemed mundane and arduous. Some of the acting was marginal and painful to watch. The dialogue matches the rest of the movie which is not a compliment. The special effects were okay and there were moments where the movie garnered marginal interest from me but as a whole I think this does a horrible disservice to the source material. I love Oprah and yet she could not carry this movie. Sorry Oprah!
I wasn't sure what to expect but was impressed with the journey and the visuals. The story unravelled and wasn't bored at all.

reviews.review_title: Well.. not the worst I've seen
reviews.content: I have not read the books, so no idea of the original story. I had the luxury of having completely open mind. Nice story, nice teachings.. any size is good, you matter, you are important etc. Did not like that all the bad, that people do, was blamed on some universal darkness.. but again you know the movie is a tinky winky and la la land where love conquers all. One of those movies where you can see that you can have as many star actors as you want, but without good directing...

reviews.review_title: What did I just attempt to watch?
reviews.content: Dunno if this qualifies as a movie at the first place. it's a complete messup! The cast all came in to please Opra, they all failed miserably.
I couldn't watch 2 minutes of that thing. Wifey was watching, I spent the time playing on my phone. I enjoyed the sound track though

I had read the book when I was in college and had watched the 2003 movie only to be disappointed. I was so hopeful that this remake would be good since now CG is way better but I was still so disappointed. The plot drags along so slowly only to cram in Meg's confrontation of The IT as an afterthought when the writers realized that they had to wrap it up. The movie leaves out so many important parts of the book like why Charles Wallace gets taken over by The IT and the whole part with Mrs. Beast after Meg, Calvin, and her father first leave Camazotz without Charles Wallace. That part is a crucial part for Meg's character development! It's why she is able to go back and save her brother from The IT by using her love for her brother instead of focusing on numbers to keep The IT out of her mind. They completely skip that part about The IT having the power to reach into and control/play with their minds so much too! Ugh. The movie does nothing to explain what is actually going on with the characters and focuses so much on love and trying too hard to get the message across with special effects that it just ends up being sloppily thrown together and waters down the message. They were trying WAY too hard.
I didn't give it the lowest rating only because I was comparing it to the 2003 movie and it has a lot of improvements visually compared to that one, and I appreciate the costumes and parts of the movie, plus my 5 year old likes it.

reviews.review_title: The book is better- and this movie could've been better, too!
reviews.content: The only reason I give it three stars is because there is enough with original story for those of us who read the book. We can glean the authors original intent. This movie could have been so so so much better (given moviemaking technology today), but it threw away the heart of the story. The only redeeming factor was that it kept the right answer-mom, dad, family, home, and love :-)

I loved the book as a child (I'll soon be 49) and I'm absolutely enthralled with the movie. I can see myself watching it many times over. A rare and beautiful find. Couldn't have picked better actors for the parts.

reviews.review_title: Worst I've Ever Seen From Disney
reviews.content: I can't believe they actually released this with Disney's name on it!! Not only were they so far off Madeline L'Engle's book that it bore very little resemblance to her phenomenal story, but the acting was atrocious, the dialogue sounded completely scripted, and the characters were all wrong and entirely unbelievable. I felt like I was watching a low-budget made-for-TV movie. The only thing this movie has going for it is the special effects, but what are effects without a believable story?? Don't waste your time!! This movie is a disgrace to Walt Disney's name, and he'd probably roll over in his grave if he knew such a piece of garbage was created under his umbrella.
Bad acting, bad lines, overall flat movie. Disappointing

reviews.review_title: A really fun and great movie.
reviews.content:
I dont understand the hate. It may not follow the book or it may be a completely different movie from the book but its really good. The book may include scenes that made the movie pretty good but the movie doesn't have them. Instead they are replaced with something good or bad. But in my opinion, they are great. The movie deserves some good stuff not bad. I understand that yall don't understand the film. But give it a watch and yalls opinions may change. But if you dont like it still, then this film may not be for you. No need to ruin the movie for everybody else by spilling out your harsh opinions about the film. Anyways here's my opinions:
The story of course i admit is a little weak but its a great story. And it gets better as the film progresses.The music is amazing that it matches with the film very well.The casts could do a little better work on their lines but they seem to do a good job.The tesseracting is very satisfying or terrifying depend on age of the child or adult that watches it.The other planets scenes are either beautiful or terrifying but has a great view for fans to watch.

The performances by the kids in the disaster were pretty good but the adult actors could barely be bothered to phone their performances in. Oprah was the worst, showing about as much range as a lamppost. Mindy Kaeling wasn't much better. Reese Witherspoon was the best of the lot and that's not saying much.

reviews.review_title: Did the writers READ the book?
reviews.content: So, ditto everyone here on the actual quality of the acting, directing, costumes (it looked like the Mrs raided a CVS at Halloween!). The multicultural casting was a welcome change and was the only remnant of the original's spirit. When I was a hearing-impaired fat misfit 4th grader, the book made me feel that it was OK to be different, and that bullies and adults in authority were not always right. Camazotz is a totalitarian planet. Maybe the Cold War has gone away, but the threat of being enslaved by evil because of passivity and conformity has not. The kids in the book walk face IT together (they are not thrown in by a special effect dirt cyclone) and it's an astoundingly brave thing to do--but it's preceded by another brave act: the little boy who dares to bounce his ball out of rhythm, and who they later see being tortured into compliance. Meg goes up against these forces and wins, not because "Love is the key to everything" but because she stubbornly refuses to believe the poison spewed by IT. She refuses to submit to the idea that she is unlovable. Mrs. Whatsit says "You have something that IT does not." She discovers that she has love. Sigh. Maybe someday they'll get this story filmed right. In the meantime, if you have a kid, do them a favor: buy them the book.
I didn't even finish the movie. Poor acting and boring.

My daughter and I watched the movie after reading the book together. This movie completely deviated from the book. No true honor or respect was paid to Madeleine L'Engle, especially with regard to elements of faith. This was an insult to me as a fan of the books and as a believer in Christianity. We both agree that halfway into watching the movie, we stopped to read the reviews. The reviews were very entertaining.From my daughter: Goodness gracious, what an abomination this is!! I never want to see this monstrosity again. The only thing I have to say that's actually entertaining is the part where Mrs. Whatsit transforms and into a flying lettuce, which by the way doesn't even happen in the book.
We had more fun reading the reviews than actually watching the movie. I feel like I'd rather watch Sharknado 3000 times than watch this once again, even though I'm too young to watch Sharknado. I feel like watching this is torture so I recommend this to your enemies if you want to torture them, and if you want them to have nightmares that night.

The movie has incredible color, costumes, and overall cinematically is gorgeous. What it carries in all those categories it falls completely flat in storyline, story progression, and logic. If I hadn't read the book I don't think I would have followed this storyline at all. In lieu of actual story there are a lot of long, dramatic shots that leave the viewer feeling bored; I often wished they would just fast forward to where the movie got interesting - sadly, that moment never came. I absolutely adore all of the actors in this film - unfortunately most of their appearances were a major letdown to what could have been. If you want to watch "A Wrinkle in Time" instead of reading the book, I highly suggest the 2003 version as it's much truer to the story and is actually interesting.

I watched this movie and waited for a plot. Once all the witches showed up it got really confusing and this movie seems to have no meaning whatsoever. Towards the end it got really boring. I would not recommend watching this movie.
It was an excellent movie- sure it had a couple of flaws but really people, 4 stars. I wouldn't usually give it ten stars- more of a seven- but I feel like the reviews it gets are wholly unfair.

(Maybe spoilers, but you knew how it was going to end anyway.)This movie is about a misunderstood girl, who is bullied at school by some mean girls, and her father who somehow goes away to somewhere and for some reason some women come from somewhere and kinda help her and her brother find him. Kinda. Actually, they don't really help much at all. And for some reason they're joined by a boy from school that she doesn't seem to know very well. He does nothing. Mostly stand around watching her do stuff.After the movie ended I had SO many questions. Where did they go? Another planet? Another Universe? Another time? How did they get there? Something to do with frequencies apparently. Where did the women come from? The same universe her father was in? Apparently the women somehow help people, I guess. Kinda. Why did the women wait so long to help her?There's lots of visual candy and little kids will probably like that. But there's lots of nothing as well. Also lots of vague warnings and such and confusing things that are never explained and nobody seems to care. They say things like "where are we?" "Were on such and such. "OK". No, it's not OK. Where is that? Is it a planet? Is it in our galaxy? Universe? We'll never know.The performances are pretty bland. Chris Pine and Reese Witherspoon seem to be going a bit overboard to make up for everyone else just standing around talking.It was hard to really care about these characters. The movie wanted you to care about them without really giving you a reason to.I haven't read the books, so hopefully they explain things better than this movie did and if you've read them it makes more sense.Oh. And one last thing. I'm sick and tired of people making up definitions of what a tesseract is. No, a tesseract is not whatever they said it was in this movie.
I wanted to turn it off half way but kept thinking it would get better noooo it did not this movie was all over the place!

The idea was interesting however the whole execution is to blame for this disappointing movie. 
Full marks to the people who edited the movie trailer that probably pulled the audience out in addition to famous casting.

I read this book countless times growing up, and was terribly disappointed in the TV movie. When I saw that Oprah, whose Book Club was so inspired and inspiring, was taking this on, I really couldn't wait.Well.The money, energy and time dumped into this "movie" was blown on stroking her and the others' egos with almost no regard for the actual story. Little Meg tried her best, but it wasn't about her, it was about 3 stiff, bedazzled queens who bore zero resemblance to the characters they were "based on." Why invent a green flower-snake when the Centaur is so grand... and why did they go to the trouble of creating Aunt Beast's world and appearance and show it for just a brief moment? I could go on for days.Wasted time, money and opportunity to bring a stellar story to this generation, who might have discovered the splendid book series. It actually makes me wonder if these "movie makers" set out to ruin it.

reviews.review_title: Movie for kids not for adults
reviews.content: I just can't believe why so much people are so negative about this movie. I watched it with my daughter. To be honest it's not that bed.

...but very close.Overwrought, overlong, and overcome with a sense of its own importance.Even given the melodrama, it could have been made a whole lot more watchable with just some tighter editing - too much of the movie is taken up with standing around talking, and long dramatic pauses that instead of adding to the tension just make it BORING.I got the impression that this film, if not intended to be an update of Never-ending Story, was at least inspired by it; either way, the intention is clearly to be for older kids and of course the accompanying adults. But most kids - of any age - are going to be bored out of their minds, and their parents are not likely to be any more engaged.One or two good lines (Zach Galifianakis's "Thank you. Earth tones" in reply to a compliment on his outfit comes to mind); the three leading ladies ("The Misses") all can be good, but not with these bad parts; the diversity of the cast was unusual, and commendable, and I liked it; the leading kids were all decent actors and nice to look at without being obviously just "eye candy". All wasted though on a highly missable movie.

reviews.review_title: If you haven't read the book, you might enjoy it.
reviews.content: I consider myself a film buff, and have been waiting to see this one for quite sometime. I think I may be one of the only ones not disappointed by this movie. I thought the costume design and cinematography were both visually stunning! The actors did a wonderful job, for those complaining about that, I think they forget that this film is geared towards children. These are mystical creatures. They are supposed to come off as "ditzy" especially Reese Witherspoon's character. If you can keep in mind that it is a kids movie, and you haven't read the book (I heard they changed a lot) it will probably be something you enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Not even loosely based on the book
reviews.content: Sorry, I wanted to like this. Wild visuals, little story from the book and strident acting. Bah.
The movie was magnificent although the acting was not very good. especially charles wallace's. and the green screen magic was not the best

reviews.review_title: Fantastic Fantasy/Sci-Fi For The Not-Dead-Inside Viewer
reviews.content: I had to sign up for IMDB just so I could write this review and tell people out there that this was not a horrible movie. In fact, we loved it. I felt that the sentiment and the story stayed true to the book and it was so refreshing to watch a story about a girl on a hero's quest. Her acting was great and I personally loved all the Mrs's. It was refreshingly female-focused which was powerful and inspiring.The story is not just about intellect but is also about heart, in a big way. Clearly you need to have a heart to appreciate it. If you are looking for a story about a hero that takes on not only outer darkness but her inner darkness as well to find whether or not she is a hero, you will enjoy this film. It may not be an academy winner but for what it is, it is inspiring and heart-warming.My one complaint has to do with music choices which I feel will date this film which is a shame because the story is a classic. I think they worked too hard to make it contemporary and that pulled me out of the movie but the rest of it, I loved.

I LOVE this movie, I don't see why people don't like it. Maybe it's not perfect to the book and I wish so much wasn't left out, but this really brought the creative story to life in such a vivid way... watching this movie is like being in a dream, with happy moments and sad moments, and an all around sense of wonder. This movie has such a amazing style and a fantastic cast- it's like a rare gem of a movie, I wish more people appreciated this, and I wish they had done the sequels too. But this film is very powerful with a really nice message- honestly, this is one of my favorites.

I didn't read the book... Shouldn't matter when it comes to a movie review. There are too many harsh reviews here that makes me think that there was some score to be settled. I avoided seeing this movie early on because of all the bad reviews, but just watch it with my 9 year old daughter. She thought it was good and touching and was entertained. As kids movies go, it was pretty good, worth a watch on a rainy day. Again, I'm not a purist and didn't have any expectations, but I don't think that all the 1 star reviews are fair. This movie should be more like a 6.5 star at a minimum, so give it a chance...

reviews.review_title: A weak kids movie about atral projection
reviews.content: I'm not even sure what to say about this.. it seems in line with the intensifying stream of new age propaganda that Disney is spewing out. I'm sure Walt would've loved it.But it's terrible on many fronts.. the kids acting qualities are not bad.. but most of the grownups are terrible.. especially Oprah and her coven.
Appeal to very young children but not a great moment for Disney good effects good concept great cast but poorly executed. and script was poor.
I guess I'm the only one enjoyed this movie according to the critics (luckily I didn't read them before watching the movie) 😁
If you wanted to see this movie before reading reviews here, go see it. I was pleasantly surprised. The absence of cynicism makes it an enjoyable experience, with many touching moments to be found.

Ignore the haters comparing this movie to the book or previous versions. Ignore the actual scientific facts of space overanalyzed by other haters. It's a fantasy, stop trying to make sense of it and use your imagination. I think this movie is great on its own and as a great movie for young minds having to deal with pressures of school and finding themselves. I found good themes of overcoming grief of a loved one, family togetherness and love, a child who is battling bullying in school and low self-esteem. I can see where the director was going with this movie and I enjoyed the ride!

Star studded movie with touching performances. The love a Daughter has for her Father, a Wife's longing for her Husband, the pure innocence of a little boy, and the kindness of someone who understands pain. Certain parts of the movie, however, is confusing. For example, when Charles Wallace was influenced by The It? Spent quite some time trying to figure out while it was unfolding whether he was possessed by The It? Influenced by the It? Was he affected cos he ate the sandwich? And towards the end, when Dr. Murrey could teleport his own way home. How could he do it on his own and why didn't he do it before to save himself? Lovely movie however I do struggle trying to make sense of it.
This film was just so boring. There was no point to the story. They were just being transported all over the place for no reason. I gave it 2 stars just because it had good actors.

A Wrinkle in Time, summed up in one word is Amazing. Amazing All-Star cast, amazing music, amazing CGI, amazing plot, and amazing sound/visual effects. I want to see more of the Time Quintet, the book series by Madeleine L 'Engle, become amazing films like this one.
One word that Mrs Whatsit said herself - underwhelmed!

reviews.review_title: Very very BAD maked up characters ,
reviews.content: What the hell was that with every characters, very disgusting weird type of make up that makes them more gross..And the story of it so much boring. I had to skip all along.

reviews.review_title: First movie review I've ever had to write
reviews.content: This movie is like watching a snail give birth. The kid actors sucked, even the well known actors bored me to death. Seriously knocked them all down several notches in my mind. The story literally made no sense. They jump from random place to random place without any explanation and fight a dark blob with "love." Pure stupidity. You can't understand a thing they're talking about or what's going on. 100% of the movie was confusing and a complete waste of time. Honestly angered me by how much of my time it wasted. Never in my life have I hated a movie enough to take the time to write a review, and this is coming from a movie goer that's seen that other horrible movie known as Lovely Bones. Literally hate the fact that this movie has wasted space in my brain.

reviews.review_title: 2003 version is a million times better
reviews.content:
I'm not sure why Time magazine had an article stating that is took 54 years to make a movie from the book, because a movie was made in 2003, and it is vastly superior to the 2018 version.
The 2003 version more closely resembles the book. It contains fascinating ideas and imagery.
This 2018 version of the movie is a contrived propaganda-laden movie, very loosely based on the novel (almost not anything like the novel at all). The cast was carefully selected to be multiracial to the point of ridiculousness. The only two white women in the movie are also the only two mean women... hmmmm... what are we trying to say here? 
I like both Meg's, but the 2018 Meg looks nothing like either of her casted parents - even though I think she is completely adorable. Other than Meg's adorability, the movie seems poorly directed. The costumes are outlandishly distracting, to the point where I spent most of the movie wondering why Oprah Winfrey was covered in so much glitter and so many gems to the point that she looked like a sparkly amazon warrior. Later, I discovered that her make up artist was trying to go for a "wispy" look - complete fail.I recommend you avoid this monstrosity of a movie altogether (unless you just can't stand to not stare at a bad accident), and instead - if you really want to immerse yourself in the movie version of "A Wrinkle in Time," watch the original 2003 version of the movie (I found it on amazon).

reviews.review_title: The best ending to a film! EVER!!
reviews.content: Was so happy when it finished! totally made my day that ending!!

reviews.review_title: Wishing that this film gave me the answer to get my time back!
reviews.content: Not quite sure what happened in this movie... The idea of the It is the only thing I could follow as there was little to no character development.There is no point watching this.
Ava Duvernay won't get work after this trainwreck.

I usually HATE Disney movies either because they're babish, animated, or boring! But this is awesome! These stupid, clueless people who say that they have CGI or lizards or whatever don't understand that it is a DISNEY movie! Of course it might be stupid, but it's probably the most realistic non animated movies I've seen! Everyone is complaining about overrated acting and Meg Mury being black, but it's so not true! I know, I was kinda surprised too! So no hate!

What an awful movie!Sometimes you wonder when a movie is made worth millions of dollars, surely there must be some oversight to ensure that the final product is at least watchable, this movie isn't.The premise from the onset is laughable, so sorry script writers, whoever you are just as much to blame for this atrocity.I can't tell if the scenes were the result of the editors not having anything to work with or the director not providing anything worth keeping.Save yourself the pain skip this, ohhh and shame on you Netflix for including this as a viewable title, it belongs in your list of Bollywood trash can titles

reviews.review_title: The worst is I have to read this shxt for exam.
reviews.content:
But the flying vegetable was pretty humor
It occured at about the 20 to 30 minutes in the film.
Not great, not horrible. Has a few good scenes. But is just doesnt really get up to speed.

The movie worked way too hard to tell us how special Meg was. If they had done the story well they would not have needed to beg the viewer to believe in her. 🙄 Calvin was a totally unbelievable character. Read the book, skip the movie.

reviews.review_title: I know why it didn't do well
reviews.content: The story was too hard for most people - especially critics - to understand.This was a beautifully film, beautifully told, but you have to engage your mind as well as your emotions to follow it. Of course, it wasn't perfect, but then, what is?
Plain and simple...this movie sucked. Worst Disney movie ever..Walt Disney would be disgusted.

reviews.review_title: I don't understand why it's getting bad reviews.
reviews.content: It was a decent movie. It's a Disney movie I don't know what you guys were expecting from a KIDS movie. I'm confused.
What is this movie based on? It sure isn't the book. I mean come on! Even my young children were calling this movie out for being so odd & so different from the book. Terrible & disappointing.
I went in knowing nothing and I thought it was a really great movie. The colour was good graphics I actually like Opra
This is an excellent, hopeful, magical movie that celebrates intelligence, science, and the spirit all at once.

It's been out for a while. i still absolutely detest this movie. my class read the book, so in excitement i went to see the movie. it was never on the storyline of the book at all! they missed very important parts, and aunt beast was one of my favorite parts in the book. :(

reviews.review_title: It is not as bad as everyone is claiming
reviews.content: Come on guys...I've sat through more painful movies... Spongebob comes to mind...for the incredible cast this movie has, there is missing something, it is weak, but I can't put my finger on exactly what that is. But it was an incredible departure from reality into a creative and visually stunning world that dived into the recesses of different minds. I appreciated the weird imagination that went into this...it was almost refreshing. Keep an open mind and you will be pleasantly surprised.
Shame on the producers for approving this movie. It's dreadfully directed, acted, cast, and the makeup and costumes are horrible. The director should never work again.

You know those flaky motivational phrases that are shared in social media? The ones that can guide a psychopath to their first murder just as easily as helping someone decide to leave the house without makeup on?Well, this is like reading a thousand of those, one after another. Just as rambling, well-intentioned but incredibly confusing, dull and induces more eye-rolling than a teenager being forced around a supermarket. This film proves the power of diversity these days: multi-racial cast; female author and female director. Whilst I laud these, clearly Disney considered that enough, at the expense of the things that normally make a film memorable: a story, a decent script, characters that aren't dreadful clichés, a detestable baddie and someone to root for. This film has none of these.It's all way too CGI and the costumes are OTT.Last but not least, the name 'Charles Wallace' is said so many times, a drinking game based upon its utterance could claim thousands of lives alongside the theft of thousands of hours.Save yourself. Run and don't look back.

Perhaps the worst film of the past twelve months. The acting, writing, editing, and, foremost, the directing, were all terrible. Ava Duvernay apparently can think of nothing more creative than a never-ending series of close ups of characters with strange smirks, always shot from odd angles. Chris Pine and Gigi Mbatha-Raw try their best in limited roles as the parents-everyone else is awful, including a robotic Oprah and an embarrassing turn by Mindy Kalining. Fortunately, I have Movie Pass. Otherwise, I would have left after thirty minutes and asked for a refund.

What an interesting concept. I can only imagine the Disney meeting, let's make a movie based on a beloved novel, but, through cultural appropriation we'll change the characters so we can go to generic typecasting central and not worry about characters with grit and personality. We'll change gender and everything. It'll be so good.I gave it one star because I can't give fewer.Thankfully, Madeleine L'Engle's marvelous book is still great.How bad is this film adaptation? If Ms L'Engle were still alive, she would have demanded that her name be removed from the credits. All Disney wanted was the title of the book. They discarded the remainder.

reviews.review_title: The trailer was better than the whole movie
reviews.content: Confusing, never knew what was going on, planning on reading the book, hopefully that's better.

A visually stunning but emotionally void adaptation of a timeless story. Gorgeous costumes, fabulous camera work, and a potentially phenomenal cast didn't translate into the warm, intimate, and insightful book I've read over and over. Quite disappointing.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as advertised; not as good as it should
reviews.content:
I read this book when I was a kid and loved it. Was looking forward to seeing the adaptation.
It has some serious flaws, but it's not as bad as the reviews make out. It's enjoyable and interesting to watch, with largely good effects and performances by the actors. The reason I give it a lukewarm 5/10 is because of a key failure in the story.
The key message of the film is taken direct from the book: the power of love and family. It's a message everyone can agree on. But the story inexplicably fails to honor the theme in ways that lost the plot for me.
One of the key instructions for the children from the Weird Sisters was to stay together. The kids are on their own in the realm of evil and it's good advice, but the first thing that happens is they split up. Not only do Meg and Calvin lose young Charles Wallace, they don't even seem to notice he's gone. When he suddenly reappears with no explanation they don't even seem surprised.
It's a poorly constructed scene that broke the spell, but it wasn't unique. The people that they love suddenly disappear and no one seems to notice. They suddenly reappear and everyone just blithely trudges onward. It really undermines the story and the message.
That said, there is still plenty to enjoy. Read the book to get a measure of how much better it could have been.

reviews.review_title: And I thought Infinity Wars was bad!
reviews.content: Worse and an even bigger waste of time than Avengers Infinity War!The entire movie appears to be computer generated with very limited real scenery. Action almost non-existent and most chances for some good acting sadly missed. Main protagonist promising, the rest colourless.

I wonder if the person who wrote the screenplay and the director of this tragedy had even bothered to read the original novel.
So bad for so many reasons.
