My 6 year old son and I watched this movie and we both really enjoyed it. I read the book a long time ago and wasn't all that into it, so I wasn't disappointed in it not being like the book. This movie has a good moral for children to not get trapped in your sadness, anger, jealousy etc. Only loses points for wasting talent of Mindy Kaling, Zach Galiafinakis, and Michael Pena. I enjoyed all the other actors though.

reviews.review_title: "A Wrinkle In Time"? More like, "A WASTE of time"
reviews.content: Total and complete SNOOZE FEST!! I don't even have to worry about giving any spoilers as I'm not "that invested" in dedicating too much time to this film. I'm a fan of bad movies usually. Or movies that make no sense, lack plot, etc. But this film kept building itself up that you kept waiting with bated breath for something to happen, just to have nothing delivered. I honestly don't fully know what I was expecting, but this? Films like Sharknado, Zombie Nation, and such had better plots and excitement!

First off, if you haven't read the book, you should. Second, if you can avoid watching the movie and just stick to the book, you'll be eternally grateful!I was so excited when I first heard they were making it into another movie and it had so much potential to be great, but in the end if felt like it was dumbed down for kids, lacked good character development, and tried to cram too much into the movie without fully fleshing anything out.I wouldn't recommend it except for a time killer and definitely wouldn't recommend it if there is any chance it would keep you from reading the book.

Inspite of all the bad reviews i wanted to see this movie. Turned out to be a very nice movie. It was entertaining all the way through. Very nice artwork.I have seen a lot of movies. I have more then 1000 ratings here. Never wrote a review. The bad rating made me to write my first one. There is no way this movie deserves 1 Star. There has to be someone who pays the ppl to rate so bad and write bad reviews. Dont believe the bad reviews. Its a nice movie.

I would have to say this is one of the worst movies I have ever had the displeasure of sitting through. Cheesy as a pile of nachos the size of Wisconsin. Terrible acting, laughable CGI (I'm referring to the scene in which Reese Witherspoon turns into a flying lettuce wraps, no seriously, she does), and a plot as empty as the vastness of space. But hey, every major filmaker is entitled to at lease on catastrophic blunder right?

reviews.review_title: Good- if you don't read the book.
reviews.content: I recently watched this and found it an easy watch. I've never read the books, so I had nothing to base it off of. I do admit the plot was a little all over the place, but it wasn't THAT bad. The acting and the CGI were great and don't get why it has such a low rating; although it could have been done better though. Overall, a decent movie. (*cough* and Chris Pine *cough*)
It was a great movie with excellent cinematography.

It was such a disappointment 
I was wondering why we were alone

What a terrible waste of money and talent. :(Let's be honest, Ava Duvernay was not the right choice for this type of movie, she was in over her head and it shows...i mean, it SHOWS! An absolutely fantastic story with so much potential, but rendered so poorly. Special effects were good though.Sad to say, but...don't watch it. Just don't.

A Wrinkle In Time is visually engaging, showcases a talented cast of young actors and greats and will undoubtedly be a favorite of its young target audience. The creative team takes some strange turns and there are definitely questions of taste, but overall, Ava Duvernay mostly succeeds in what she set out to do.
I wanted to like this so much, but from the opening minutes it was a confusing dumpster fire of a movie. How could Ava Duvernay and Oprah Winfrey screw up this badly?

reviews.review_title: Left the couch and went to sleep
reviews.content: Basically I got so bored of it that I couldn't stay asleep. My wife stayed "only to support the black people in it". Of course she said she didn't enjoy the movie or the actors playing.

reviews.review_title: For the ones "Spiritually Awakening" and the young ones yet to come!
reviews.content: If your not on a Spiritually Awakening path, your better off seeing Jackie Chan... And you can stop reading my review and switch to another review, so that I wouldn't be wasting ur time.But if you are on an Awakening path, this one is for you. This movie is like a manual / a tutorial about our universe n energy and everything in life for generations to come and that's why I like it. I am a Lightworker and so are many. I don't usually see Disney movies but this Wrinkle in Time caught my eye when I heard Oprah's talk about Manifestations on an interview session of this movie. The interviewer in that session herself mentioned that this movie has awakening messages all over. Plus Oprah herself is wide Awake. So I wanted to see it.This movie has all you need to know about healing your wounds by facing them to see the light beyond fear and darkness (that are mere illusions to keep u in the dark). It also hints on the concept of oneness which is true and beautifully scripted. I liked this movie, a lot! It resonated with my awakened being to a T. It's literally the tutorial for life for the young ones and generations to come. This is an Awakening movie. And just keep your eyes on the lookout: this movie is soon going to see its daylight in the coming years as this mass awakening on earth is already happening and at a rapid pace. People are seeing the world with their third eye and getting out of the Matrix fast. This is The Movie for our current young ones and our future generations.Thanks Oprah, Reese, Mandy and Chris for being a part of it. This movie explains the Awakening process to the young ones beautifully.

I have been waiting for this movie since elementary school. A Wrinkle In Time was my favorite book growing up. I loved the science and magic all mixed in to one adventure. The movie did not disappoint. While many have complained that it is different than the book - of course it is! But it doesn't matter. It was still incredible for so many reasons.First, the cinematography was stunning. Absolutely breathtaking. The costumes, the colors, the scenery...it was all perfect.Second, it was so incredible to take my son to a movie with such a diverse cast. I admired seeing such strong female characters of different backgrounds in one movie.Third, the messages in this movie struck such a personal tone. Watching, I felt like I was ripped apart and put back together by the wise words of Mrs. Who, Mrs .Which, and Mrs. Whatsit. We've all felt those dark times in our lives and this movie really made me think about who we are in the universe.Ava Duvernay did a wonderful job. I plan on watching this over and over again, especially on those days that are touched by IT.

Usually I enjoy the book over the movie but not in this case. I found the book did not hold my attention enough to get past chapter 3. The movie held my attention to the end. Of coarse, I love the imagination shown in the wardrobe and set design. The story was easy to follow on a young adult level. The messages/life revelations were all positive.
Parents need to look at the movie trailers more to realize that just because Disney was part of the movie's production companies, this is not a story for children, oh say under 8 or so. It will not hold their attention, of course this is strictly my opinion.

reviews.review_title: Not sure what was going on
reviews.content: Ever seen a movie where the plot seems all over the place? Well, this is it. The movie boasted of some good graphics but nothing more. It was a total waste of money to produce this

This is a great movie, along the same lines (and scariness factor) as a Harry Potter movie: kids save the world from evil. The special effects, locations and sets are gorgeous, the acting, while not seamless, is done very well by the kids in the film. But what sets it apart is why you should go and see it, like, NOW: it's based on a novel about girls' empowerment written over 50 years ago, it's directed by the first (yes! first!) African-American woman to direct a major-motion picture in Hollywood, there's a mixed-race family, a strong, scientist Mom, and a strong and smart girl hero. From what I can see, many of the reviews here (and on IMDB, etc.) seem to be thinly veiled and coded warnings to viewers about precisely those issues...many of the negative reviews are from the same people who gave all of the Harry Potter movies 10 stars, despite those movies' serious flaws. All the more reason to get your family down to the theater. Go see what real women do...and what real girls can do when they grow up. (Hint: they can save the world!)

reviews.review_title: It could have been better, technologically.
reviews.content:
It could have been better, technologically.
It also resembles a quite vulgar idea of these types of movies with each scene being easily anticipated.

My major complaint on the movie is just how many times they say the little brother's name. While it might have read alright in the book, they say it so much that I think it added an extra 5 minutes in run time to the movie. For film's sake, they could have at least shortened it to just "Charles", because hearing "Charles Wallace" close to or possibly over 100 times in this film honestly drove me insane.

I can't believe how negative these critics are on this app, these actors were fascinating and Disney used real people. I feel like a review should be a scale and should find balance. If you can't at least leave some constructive criticism. Negative thoughts and remarks are really not that creative at least say where you think they could have done better. I would hate to be the child of the person who got up and walked out. God bless everyone.

Firstly, to all you muppets that keep saying this film is the worst 2 hours of their lives, the film isn't even 2 hours long, so good one. Secondly, if you walk out a film before it's even finished, your opinion is invalid cos you didn't even see the whole thing. Is a bit over-complicated for a kids film, but if you actually pay attention, its not That bad. It's not amazing, but it's Disney, so what do you expect. Just goes to show, just cos it's a PG doesn't mean children will like it.

Mom here. Disregard the negative reviews. Most "books" aren't followed in movie conversions. Those that are don't translate well and are boring as heck. I can think of only one that I really enjoyed in the theater and that was due to the actors and writing. 
That said, this movie is more designed for ages 6+ and up. It is imagination inspiring. 
The cast of characters have excellent actors behind them. The cinematography is fabulous. The wardrobe is beautiful. The idea behind this is thought provoking. The end gets a little much for a child under the age of 6-7. That's why I say it best suited for that age and up. Will you be disappointed if you expect it go rigidly by the book? Absolutely. 
Be open-minded. 
I think the negative reviews are the alt-right who spammed this to try to hit Oprah and this movie because it is pushing hard. 
See past this. See this movie. It is quite fabulous!!!

reviews.review_title: Can be used as 'time out' for naughty kids.
reviews.content: I rarely write movie reviews, but this bad boy deserves one. I read the reviews, but decided to go anyway - the kids wanted to see it, who I should mentioned 'liked' this movie. First thing that bothered me was the odd filming angles and my nightmare... camera shake on flash backs, like we're watching Blair Witch project all over again. Nausea inducing. Second major issue was the acting, the worst had to be Oprah. I felt like I was watching a Christmas Pantomime in some nondescript English town at Christmas. Third, the story telling was terrible, considering this was Disney I am flabbergasted they let it go to production. Lastly, the end scenes where pretty dark, how did these make it in to this film?! At least I can say I've seen it, although I've already forgotten in. It really is a terrible movie. Sorry Mickey!

Having grown up a Black girl who was bullied and a science geek, this movie felt very special to me, and that's personal. But the visuals blew me away. Mindy Kaling looks breathtakingly good. I didn't read the book, so I had no idea what to expect except DuVernay always brings quality. That's reason enough to give the film 8 stars.

Z-z-z-z-z-z-z
It was worse than a snooze. I had shut off the DVD player before it short circuited on this mess. I really loved the book as a kid. Too bad this was done to it.

reviews.review_title: You all are too harsh on this movie!
reviews.content: I've never read the book, though I've known of its existence prior to viewing the film. The writing left a lot to be desired, I found myself confused most of the time and the dialogue was cringe worthy sometimes. Those things aside, it is a beautifully filmed movie. I loved the creative visual choices made. Camera angles and lighting were quite immersive.Oddly enough, being confused added to the otherworldly aspect I felt from the film. It gave me vibes that reminded me of the strangeness in Annihilation. It's a weird comparison, I know. Sometimes watching a strange movie that's hard to follow is a nice getaway from the normal.

I've quite honestly never read the original books, but i feel like if i did it would be a completley different experience! Other than a few well acted sad moments this film was very average. Its quite hard to follow, the characters are so vague and the story doesn't actually make much sense! Don't think i will be watching it a second time....

Bad movie,, even for kids!!
Should have done better with the story and speed of the movie and definitely the cast! The kid, meg looks so out of character and the weird costumed Oprah!

It may not be the exact book, just like I'm sure Harry Potter readers werent too happy with the movies. The CGI may not be perfect, and these are young actors who are just learning. But when you're learning about how the Universe actually works, how there are different dimensions in the worlds, this movie enhances your belief. Listen to every word. Light is the answer; Love is the answer. Watch it with an open mind.
I was so excited before watching the movie but what a disappointment. I literally had to force myself to finish the film, thinking it HAS to get better.......but it never does.

reviews.review_title: Disney goes deep, making such a good movie!!!
reviews.content:
Brilliant Film with such a deep meaning, relating to mental health, depression and topics which Disney has presented to children in a fun but right way. Many people have rated it badly because they don't understand it. However if you look hard enough there is such a good message to children in one of Disney's best films, that love conquers all, and even when you feel alone and afraid, a little bit of light in the world can help you through.
Even if you've crossed this film of your list because of the ratings, trust me when I say that you need to go and watch the whole film and open up your mind, then you will realise it's more than just a predictable kids film, like many say it is, but one of Disney's best works!

Finally saw this movie, and I do not understand all of the negativity spewed toward it. A little girl misses her father so much, and will do anything to bring him back. What a beautiful bond to portray! Wonderful, positive messages were sprinkled throughout the film. Charles Wallace was a delight! Leave the cynicism at the door, and just enjoy the moment this project created.

Im only about halfway through watching this on Netflix and was so bored to tears I had to look up the reviews. It looks like I am not alone. This movie is literal garbage. The acting is so awful you just want to cringe at every movement. Reese Witherspoon and Mindy are just terrible in this and so unbelievable. On top of all that, the movie itself is just so confusing. I am one that normally loves this sci-fi but this is just too weird. Nothing makes sense and there is next to know story line. Waste of time! Save yourself and do not watch it!
The movie has a lot of heart and some of the actors make this watchable but the plot and script are extremely weak. Some of the visuals are nice but they didn't add a lot to the overall story.

I was excited to watch this because I had read the books when I was younger, but overall I was disappointed. The story moves in such a weird way. The ending felt so rushed. A lot of it was really confusing. I probably won't ever watch it again.

It's clear that the director didn't know what he was doing or his vision of the CGI graphics and they're acting I mean Reese Witherspoon felt like she didn't even know how to connect with her character at all the kids were cute but not the rule for them I hope this doesn't ruin their careers

This film sort of wonders about a bit with weirdly connected scenes as if big chunk of the movie (the interesting scenes) are just... missing? Watched with our 7yo and she was bored stiff for most of the film. Shame, because there were some great ideas (I guess, from the source book) but as a film, this did not work.

My brother's gf chose to play this soul devouring movie on during dinner.
Why? -Dunno..
Dinner ruined? -Yup.
Would I recommend this for kids?
-Fudge no.

2 Adults a 12 year and a 9 year old rated this movie 9,1,7 and 8 respectively.
Very slow to start and an improbable storyline made this hard to concentrate on. Without giving too much away the premise of the movie was missed and was not reinforced enough. If someone asked me if I could recommend it I would have to say no.

My family and I tried to watch this movie but after 30 mins we had to stop. The reason is the storyline is very difficult to understand, the movie is confusing, and overall nothing really makes sense. I wouldn't recommend watching this movie but if you do then don't watch it with children as they will find it boring and confusing
My family and I were hoping for a movie that felt like the book. The tone and pacing of this Disney film is just off. My son was bored five minutes in, and my daughter almost fell asleep. 3/10 stars.

reviews.review_title: Don't pay attention to the bad reviews!
reviews.content: It's a kids movie, It was really good for a kids movie. So many people come on here and make reviews based on an adult Point of view. It was a beautiful story with beautiful images and a nice message about loving who you are. It's a good Film and you should go watch it because you want to watch it and not because somebody else told you not to.

The genre is adventure, i expected just like treasure planet or journey to center of the earth by disney.. but i found this is just... a, very very dramatic movie with good VFX of course..
I think they're filming in all of green screen.. 
i can see the VFX editings.. 
very slow plot.. and very boring..just travelling around planets? i thought in travelling around planets they will have some quests or adventure or a thing...
but I FOUND NOTHING.so don't waste ur time watching this, especially in the theaters :D

This movie was so bad. I didn't relate to any of the characters on any level. It took like an hour to set the scene, before even starting the adventure. There's no suspense or anything. The graphics are OK but the special effects are far and few between. I legitimately fell asleep. The only reason I stayed was so that I didn't have to pay for parking (weird condition of the cinema I go to)

Greats shots and moral of the story. Views take away a strong message.
The actors are amazing and suit their roles very well. 
However, the whole entire movie was just a disappointment. The storyline seems rushed, seems like events are randomly happening. 
I got very bored several times during the movie. Overall, I wasn't impressed.

reviews.review_title: I don't understand why such low ratings!!
reviews.content: The movie is beautifully made, loved the soundtrack! Yes the acting wasn't Oscar worthy, but the story as I remember reading is 15+ years ago was about having an imagination to make the book what you wanted it to be...overall I loved it. Has great morals especially for my 13 year old. This movie is not a 1 out of 10 rating!
I was looking forward to this. Disney, adventure, magic. What could go wrong? But it was wierd and boring that I fell asleep. Disappointing.
I just caught this movie on Netflix. Fortunately it was nothing more than a time waster not a money waster. Read the 1 star reviews here, they are MUCH more entertaining than the movie.

reviews.review_title: I just can't understand this movie
reviews.content: I have no clue what is going on. The storyline is so .... naive.... primitive? I just can't understand what's going on. I went to the cinema to see Oprah and Reese Witherspoon.... god the acting was bad. The actors, especially the young ones are just reading the lines. Had to leave after an hour.

The only thing that was interesting in this film was the casting being diverse, thus the 2 stars...but..the music was terrible, and the script deviated so far from the book that it lost almost everything, the entire camazotz act was broken, and they don't tesser to the planet with furry loving blind many armed beings, Mrs whatsit as a human was young and pretty which was lame, she should have really looked like a tramp, only Mrs Who was remotely believable, and why did mrs whatsit turn into a flying eel when she was supposed to be an androgynous pegasus? no flowers to help them breathe... mrs which was just big giant not the mysterious being she was in the books, and oprah is good actor but they gave her a drippy character and cheeze lines... the happy medium scene was totally broken, no mars, no vision of earth no understanding of mrs whatsit having been a star, then in camazotz no sense of the bureaucratic controlling nature of camazotz, no sense of it as a vision of totalitarianism, though the beach party aspect is perhaps more relevant as a vision of happy fascism which permeates our culture of spectacle. again the music swelled with its terrible manipulative emotion, too bad that even though had a good multiethnic and especially african american cast, they didn't get a decent african american score for the film, they should have asked Erykah Badu to write the music.

Forget about those bad reviews you've read and just enjoy the film. 
It's true that it stumbles a bit in certain aspects of screenwriting and filmmaking, but so do many films we call "great". This visual spectacle filled with rich morale passes a very important message to today's society and children: be true to yourself and be good. It also delivers a brilliant performance by none other than 9 year old Deric McCabe (and it isn't even worth mentioning how great Oprah Winfrey is in the movie).
I believe this wave of bad reviews is given to the fact that people read them before watching the movie, and therefore dislike it even before giving it a chance.
Let yourself be transported into the world of "A Wrinkle in Time", and judge the film through your own standards.

First of all, I LOVE the book A Wrinkle in Time so I was wary when this movie was announced. I think that Ava and her crew did a really, really, REALLY good job of adapting the novel. They did have to leave out a few things but of course, that happens. Storm Reid is great as Meg, Reese, Mindy and Orpah as great as the Misses too. The boy playing Charles Wallace is honestly fantastic and I think he's going to be a well known talent when he gets older. It's also a really stunning film to look at. It's colorful, bright and warm. I hope they let Ava adapt the second book too.

I didn't read any of the reviews on this site before seeing the movie nor did I read the book so I'm not one of those people that are butt hurt the movie doesn't resemble the book. In a sense I had a clean slate with the story line and even with that this movie was a bit boring. It's always a tell tell sign when the person you are with falls asleep during the movie. I myself started to when they were in the 'dark' area towards the end of the film. It's one of those films you are just waiting...and waiting..and waiting for the story line to take off and suddenly you realize you are 1/2 half way through the film and this is it...as good as it's going to get. For me the biggest disappoint was the special effects. Being a Disney film (budget) I expected "Avatar" like special effects and except for one flying scene the rest of the movie looked like it was filmed in someone's living room with cheesy backgrounds. I think this is why people think the acting is bad, it's not, it's cheesy at times because of the script and the movie is not very believable because it looks so cheaply put together. A lost opportunity.

Bad acting, poor writing, horible directing... just terrible.
Boring as hell...
Even special effects werent that great.

I honestly do not understand why this movie has such a poor rating from users. My wife and I enjoyed it very much, and it is 100% better than the previous attempt to translate my favorite novel to the big screen.I admit, the pacing of the film is a bit off. To me, however, this would be the only complaint that makes sense. It is visually stunning from start to finish, includes many well-represented moments from the novel, and is exactly what I had hoped it would be.At the moment, A Wrinkle in Time is on Netflix. I would highly recommend everyone give it a chance

reviews.review_title: It's not Hollywood, but lots to learn from and makes you think!
reviews.content: I am just startled by the plethora of negative reviews I've read about this one, here. I wonder, are these reviews from real people or most folks just don't like movies that make you think? It made me think, for sure.I know, it's not Hollywood. It's not a blockbuster, but the acting is OK. The script and the roles are good also. It is not a masterpiece, not an Oscar winning, but it is worth watching it, especially by those who are really interested in these subjects, in quantum physics and time travelling and all.I never read the said book that this movie was made from, which it entitles me to write this review with a fresh eye, I should say. But one thing I have to say regarding this is that a movie made from a book doesn't have to be totally loyal to that book, but should invite you to read the book. They are alike, but also different, but that point is that it helps the book come out even more.When it comes to this movie, each scene takes you really quick from one place to another, from one aspect of the subject matter to the other and the action is pretty fast, I should say. One needs to pay close attention to what is happening, otherwise would miss the whole point.Overall, I give it a ten because of the subject and the symbolically artistical way in which is portrayed in this movie. And I also want to balance the other bad ratings it has received so far, to make it a bit more worth watching.So, be careful! This movie is not for everyone, but for those who are really into searching about this matter.

reviews.review_title: Read all the reviews.... Their true
reviews.content: Nuf said....... Absolutely terrible! When I try to read the book when I was young I never got it. This movie is terrible. Terrible acting. Terrible directing. Terrible script.

reviews.review_title: Fell short in so many ways
reviews.content: I have read the entire Wrinkle in Time book series countless times. It is one of my favorite things to read and I have always loved the story, so I went in with high hopes. Unfortunately those hopes were dashed against the rocks of mediocrity at it's worst.It's very clear that the casting of this movie WAS the story. So many moments throughout the movie were clearly THIS IS OPRAH BEING OPRAH moments (or insert whoever else's name instead of Oprah). The entirety of Zach Galafianakis' role was the aforementioned strategy, with a little feeling thrown in so he can get better roles later. Basically, the character development was non-existent so we are left with a lot of actors being actors.The storyline itself was a strange combination of mind numbingly slow and lightening quick. It was a far cry from the book (I'm not a book purist by any means but if you're going to veer, do it well). The screenwriters even seemed to go so far as to write in completely foreign scenes that did nothing to further the story. They exerted a lot of effort to come up with random mediocre scenes. I gave the movie 3 stars, solely because I applaud their ability create a diverse cast and challenge my personal preconceived idea of who the characters were. I just wish they had been as diligent about making a good movie as they were about having diverse representation.

reviews.review_title: A great movie to watch with the kids or grandkids
reviews.content: I totally enjoyed this movie. It is lightweight and lighthearted. It easily transitions from one scene to another, keeping viewers' attention. It has positive energy and it is fun. The different "worlds" are fun without being creepy and provide a feeling for the fantasy. I enjoyed the characters and the story of personal growth. I think this could become a kids classic and I know I will be watching it over and over with my grandchildren.

I thought with Disney, Witherspoon, Kaling, and Oprah they would have demanded a great movie. Instead I felt like I was watching a late night lifetime, made for TV movie. Poor acting, bad script, and poor graphics made up the bulk of this show. I could have made most this with an iPhone and my 10 year old Mac. Seriously, was this a project for a freshman film major? I'm so mad. I think the most expensive thing in this movie was the adult actress' costumes. I really hate turning a movie off half way through, but kept believing it would get better. Thank you Zach Galifianakis for giving me 30 seconds of entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the book purists!!
reviews.content: Look, I get it. You love a book and you want to see it faithfully retold on film. But hating on this movie simply because it changed some details misses the bigger picture and fails to acknowledge the importance of the spirit of the book over strict adherence to the plot.First of all, the focus of the movie shifts from the relationship between Meg and Charles Wallace to Meg's journey of self discovery. I think this was a great shift, because I believe the book paints a very dated picture of what sibling relationships are like. I think the movie successfully communicates how deeply Charles Wallace and Meg care for each other while simultaneously showing Meg building self esteem and discovering who she is, and finding worth in that identity. Storm Reid was PHENOMENAL.Next, the ending. Oh god how grateful I am that they changed the ending. I was SO disappointed by that BS "power of love" and then it's over ending in the book! In the film, it felt more genuine and immediate-it felt like a fight for their lives. Yes, Meg does still save Charles Wallace with her love, but it's not that easy. It's intertwined with a discovery of love for herself as well as fighting for Charles Wallace.All I have to say about the Mrses is that they where phenomenal, and keep an ear out for a Hamilton reference at the end! Okay, and yes, they changed a lot. They took out the Aunt Beast scene. But was it that important of a scene? Personally I found Meg intolerable at this part of the book, and all they did on that planet was regroup and send Meg to get Charles Wallace. They folded the rescue of Charles Wallace into Meg refusing to tesser without him, and even set up the power of her will earlier in the movie. They also changed the nature of Camazot. Instead of a machine-like city with quotas and statistics and the highest rate of simultaneous actions, it was more a changing planet designed to trap them. At first I balked at this change, but the more I thought about it, the more I realized that the industrial setting from the book didn't really fit the atmosphere of this movie. Now, I'm not saying this movie was perfect. My biggest complaint was how they downplayed Charles Wallace's intelligence. He never even tried to fight the man with red eyes. He just immediately succumbed. I don't think they did a good job of communicating how special and gifted Charles Wallace is, and I get that they did that for Meg's character, but I wish they hadn't done it SO much.There's more I could say, but these are the main points I wanted to make. Please go into this movie with an open mind and heart. Please remember that this book was published in 1962 and it NEEDED updating for modern audiences. Please give it a fair chance!

I don't know if anyone could love the book by L'Engle more than me, or have read it more times. I don't understand why there are so many poor reviews for this movie. I thought it was lovely. The first half hour won me over and had me in tears. Like the Lord of the Rings, another favorite, the movie-makers decided to take out some things and add some new things. It's difficult to make a movie out of beautiful writing alone (such as any movie based on a Jane Austen novel - the more successful ones add more suspense and intrigue). And so, more action scenes were added (there are no real action scenes in the book). I'm no judge of acting. I just know what I like. I did miss Aunt Beast - I thought that section was important to the story because it made clear that Mr. Murray did not desert Charles Wallace, and it explained why it had to be Meg who needed to save him. I missed the earth-like feeling of Camizotz too, because it is a part that always gives me a strange surreal feeling when I read it - this is one of the places where they decided to add more special effects and action. I can't argue with that, and I thought "It" was done in a very interesting way. I loved the paper analogy to love folded over and hidden, and how it was carried through the story though it wasn't in the book - this is an interpretation, a useful device, that made it clear that love was the power that fought the darkness, and was the power that Meg had.
My favorite three minutes was when our projector broke. Slow, boring, underwhelming, and predictable.
The story could have been really good, but the movie was just lame and poorly done.

I as a youngster read the book A Wrinkle in Time, and I just saw the movie. Underwhelming is a good word to describe it. I went with two other people who had not read the book, and they had to keep asking me questions about what was going on. Keep in mind that we are all adults, and even I was confused at times despide re-reading the book before heading to see it. The visual effects were obviously the focus of the movie, not the storytelling.
Plot was bad, many things were left unexplained. The 3 stars with the top billings were given really bad roles and it was really hard to watch. Waste of $

I have never posted a review before but this movie was so bad that I felt I owed it to all fellow movie watchers.
Don't bother even if you have a spare 2 hours. Honestly you have something better to do!

I was kind of looking forward to the new version honestly. I was excited to see what was going to be done with new technologies compared to the original film. The plot however I feel gets muddled and I was let down by my expectations. I wish Netflix still had the original film so I could rewatch it because I think that one was better than this one.

reviews.review_title: Sets a new, very low, bar.....
reviews.content: I don't even know where to begin on this film, how I ever made it to production is beyond me. This film is so bad I wonder whether the actors even read the script before agreeing to be in it. This has set a new bar for me, whenever I watch a bad film now I ask myself, 'but was it as bad as A Wrinkle in Time?'.
I had high expectations for this movie, given the Disney label and reference to science fiction. It is neither science nor fiction, more of a drug addled fantasy.

I loved this movie. It has a clear message with a quirky delivery. The scenes are beautiful, the cast multiracial. I don't understand the disappointment and anger of some user reviewers. Not every movie has to be fast and loud. This one is contemplative, heart-felt, original. Go see it with a child, and the magic will get through to you.

reviews.review_title: Great actors doing a terrible job
reviews.content: The worst I have seen lately by far. Don't waste your time.

This movie was a waste of time for the viewers and a waste of money for Disney. I had read the book in my childhood and remember really liking it, but didn't really remember much about it so the movie had a fair chance without being compared to the book too much.But this movie really blew it.It was a bona fide disaster; nothing made any kind of sense. The human characters were just thrown into a standard hero's journey training and mentoring program which is just extended exposition in order to transport them to a world where the movie can make kids like it by giving flashy visuals and whimsical leaf people and try to make intellectuals like it by using the word "physics" to explain movie magic.You would think that a 250 million dollar budget could pay for some high-school student to check that their physics (which they prided Meg on being good at) was actually correct. You think that you can gracefully "generate lift" with your own body to fly without any sort of propulsion? Even if you could fly like this, air would slam into your face so hard you could barely breathe. And why would hiding in a log before getting thrown hundreds of metres away protect you? They should've died from that impact, not gotten off scot-free.The rest of the movie sucks too.

The scenery was beautiful and the actresses used to portray the characters are amazing but the story plot is awful. the movie is boring and the characters are one dimensional, except maybe meg. Too much overacting from the kids, i could not suspend my disbelief.

The story and it's connections into the next scenes makes no sense. With a budget of 100 mill, I can see where the money was spent on CGI and some top billed casting...but you can see even the actors didn't give it there all in their attempts to fill the characters.

By far one of the worst book adaptations ever. Disney took one of the most beloved children's classic books and just obliterated it. The book was magical and moving, with a wonderful message of Love and Light having the power to overcome darkness and evil. The movie, however, managed to replace key story elements with over-the-top special effects that added nothing. An all-star cast couldn't do justice to the book, leaving out major plot points and characters. What a gigantic disappointment.

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. Many people who are complaining about this movie are above the age of 40 (not necessarily the demographic they were trying to reach). This is a great film to watch with your family. It shows light/love is the only way to drive out darkness. It always shows the importance of persevering and having hope. This isn't my favorite movie, but it is pretty close.
The costumes were super good, and I loveeeeeed the various hairstyles. It was nice to see a family with curly hair (majority of black and biracial people have curly hair), because straight hair has been the norm until now. It was nice to see actors being able to show a bit of themselves in their characters.
It was also cool to see how far we have come with animations.

If I was high on LSD, this movie would still have sucked. Or was I high? No, no I wasn't high. Plot? There wasn't one. A-list actors? Useless! My God that's a big Oprah! I think a 4 year old did their make-up by the way. I want to sue Disney for the theft of the last 90 or so minutes of my life. Who needs to be shot for giving this the go ahead? Maybe they were high?

reviews.review_title: Very disappointed I spent $50 taking my kids to see this
reviews.content: This was hard to get in to and both me and my kids got bored and almost left. I can use my imagination, but it didn't help. I would save my money if I could do over again.

reviews.review_title: Starts out slow then gets interesting
reviews.content: I can agree that the movie was slow at some points. It's still a great movie. Stormi & Deric work really well together. The visuals also won me over. Great story about a girl trying to find her place in the world.
Perfect score for a target demographic. Colourful, not too scary. Believable with great costumes. She loved all of it from start to finish.
I like it, but I don't like Meg! She makes me annoying for the character.
Although it packs some great actors, it couldn't pull of as a whole movie. It's disastrous.

This was one of my favorite books growing up. Unfortunately, the filmmakers concentrated more on the songs and star power than the story. Key points in the book are trivialized, made nonsensical or even nonexistent. If you haven't read the book, you'll likely be confused; if you read the book, you're going to be very disappointed with the empty shell they've left us with. Only the lead actress in the movie, Storm seems to understand the book. Whoever adapted the book to the screen should tesser.

This movie is good film just for kids,
adults may be Don't like this movie,
but kids are going to love this movie 😁
Honestly if you tried to read the book you would know, this film went all out with amazing special effects and beautifully diverse casting. Loved it!
I don't why so many people hate the movie , but it was not very that bad. But it was so goood. Best movie ever. So amazing
Oh my, where to even begin. This Miss matched movie made no sense and I don't even know if it was reflective of the book I sure hope it wasn't.

I don't understand all the bad reviews.. it's a beautiful movie, a beautiful story, finally a different one with a deep meaning! Search and fight for the light/love.. really touching.Chris Pine was INCREDIBLE!!

reviews.review_title: A huge disappointment; read the book
reviews.content: I'd read the bad reviews when this film first came out and decided to avoid it but last night decided to give it a go. "A Wrinkle in Time" is one of my all-time favorite books. Having first read it as an adolescent it was a watershed experience for me as I fell in love with it--the characters, the ideas, the thrilling plot. It's considered a YA book, but I've read it numerous times over the years and still love it and its message. Those ideas and images certainly would be very difficult to capture in a film and this one, as many others have said, is a real misfire. Storm Reid seemed to be sleepwalking; the same with most of the other actors. While the book was published in 1962 and contained that time's sensibility, it is erudite and also charming. The updated, PC flavor/characters in this depiction was sometimes laughable and even embarrassing. And that black thing is just "IT," not "The IT."

reviews.review_title: Good Cinematography, OK VFX, and the WORST screenplay since 'The Room'
reviews.content: I'm going to be honest, I wasn't expecting much when I went into this film. I had heard from my friends that it was bad, and I thought it wasn't going to be worth my time (hence the 3/10 imdb rating). And oh man - I was right!The film starts out - - - wait - I can't even remember. I'm not joking - I literally cannot remember how this movie started!There were some things about this movie that I did actually enjoy. Being a cinematographer myself, I try to look out for films that go above and beyond, and are creative in this field. And this film didn't disappoint. I really enjoyed most of the shots. I thought they expressed a good visual metaphor, that looked good on screen.I also liked the costumes and makeup. I know there probably won't be any oscar buzz around these categories, but I thought they were very well done, and got the message across.Now, lets get into the---other things about this movie. Although in some scenes good, I thought the visual effects in this film were surpassingly mediocre. I mean - It's not 'Justice League' bad, but there were times were the amateur-ness distracted from the story.I also think the acting was also very amateur. Now - I love Opra. She's great. But there was something about this performance which really made me wonder - 'Wait - that's OPRA??!!? Wasn't she a good actor once?' Storm Reid was OK. I think she has a lot of potential - and this movie just wasn't her time to show it. I HATED Calvin. I thought he was a totally unrealistic portrayed teenager that does not and will never exist in the world of teenagers.Now, this review has already gone way to long. But there is one last subject in which I would like to touch on. That's the screenplay. WOW. I had no Idea I screenplay could be this bad. I mean - this is almost 'The Room' bad. I haven't read the book, but my friends who have, have told me that a 30 page-longer section (THE CLIMAX) was entirely left out of the movie. I thought the dialogue in most places was cheesy, awkward - and just flat out WEIRD. NOBODY Meg or Calvin's age would EVER say these lines. I almost feel bad for all these actors. ALL of them have great potential, but they were submerged to a terrible screenplay, and that's why I think 'A Wrinkle In Time' is such a bad movie.
Someone should be suied for titling this movie "A Wrinkle in Time". Not even close to the book. And not worth watching under a different title anyway.
This movie is the worst movie i have ever seen in 2018.This is the best movie for people

I'm guessing I didn't hate it since I never read the book, but if you take it as a stand alone film I think you'll really enjoy it, and again, I feel it is a much needed breath of fresh air and hope which is desperately needed today.

reviews.review_title: Worse movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: Terrible terrible movie..... do yourself a favor and watch something else

I think the other reviews do a great job of elaborating on the atrocity that is Wrinkle in Time, from the impressively awful acting, to the cheapest costume/make up production of all time, to the cacophony of CGI poorly juxtaposed with actual footage, to the over wrought symbolism and egregious bastardization of dialogue and quotes. Those factors alone were literally cingeworthy, jaw dropping and would merit walking out, but hey we payed 50$ and decided to tough it out a bit longer for our kids' sake. What a mistake. The worst was yet to come...Wrinkle soon descends into using every hallmark of the horror movie genre. How this was rated PG I will never kmow. A demonic clown possessing and abducting a child. Children being dragged down dark hallways, screaming and clawing for their lives against the forces/grip of pure evil, robotic stepford wives/children in painful sycronization, immersion in dark underworlds with unrelenting devil voices, agonizing sound effects and endless references to patricide, kidnapping etc, a young child possessed by an evil spirit, speaking hurtful, scathing words.....it not darker and darker. 1/2 way through we couldn't take anymore, but didn't want to leave because we didn't want our kids stuck with the trauma of such sickening, psychologically bent visuals in their head before bed. We decided to wait till the inevitable lightening of the plot, but it just kept descending into darker territory. My kids have seen movie rates well beyond their years (6 and 8 years old). This made the scariest movie look like Mr Roger's. They are resilient, tough cookies, but were screaming all eve in their sleep (never in 6 and 8 years has that happened before). None of us slept a wink. Needless to say, when it became so disturbing that my dad and I could literally take it no longer, we left. Nonrefundable was permitted. 50$ put, an eve wasted, heads full of terror. Wow. They should use this movie for torture tactics. It is beyond the beyond. WORST MOVIE EVER.

reviews.review_title: Could've been better, But Could've been worse: Pros & Cons.
reviews.content:
I've heard many things about this movie. Especially it having $3.1 Million at The Box Office. This film is pretty lucky that i'm giving it a 4/10. But, since you've already heard the bad about the movie. Lets get into the Pros. 
1. The visuals are super pretty or great
2. Some of the characters are kind of likable.
And, 3. Actors are not that bad, Just badly directed.And now the Cons.
1. (Excuse #3) The Acting isn't that good. Especially Charles Wallace. He was probably the worst actor in the film.
2. Too. Many. Plot-holes.
3. Some of the characters in the beginning are pretty awful, but useless in the next acts.
4. Dialogue just doesn't stick.
5. Some Unnecessary Filler either mildly emotional or useless.
And, 6. This movie can only usually appeal to a younger demographic. Instead of a wide variety of viewers.And there you have it. A sort-of brief review about A Wrinkle in Time (2018). Now, Should you watch it? If you liked the book, maybe. If you liked the first movie in 2004, also maybe. But i don't really recommend this film to mostly anyone. Not even children. But that's my review, 4/10. A bit Mediocre, but it could be better.

reviews.review_title: I read the book, loved the book. I watched the movie, loved the movie. They're different animals.
reviews.content:
I read the book a long time ago as a child, and then again as a teen, then again as an adult, and again as an older adult. It has always stuck with me and is a favorite of mine. It's a feel-good book, with classic elements of Light vs Dark, Good vs Evil, etc. It relates to kids who are feeling bullied or worn down by social problems, awkwardness in the teens, adults who make mistakes, and feels like a very empowering book to young adults who just want to have an adventure, and fight the good fight on their own.The movie also accomplishes that. It takes a group of kids and young adults and sends them across the galaxy on a mission to save Meg's father. It has all of the elements of a grand adventure, with gorgeous scenery, magical moments, and an ominous, dark presence to fight.I think what people are having trouble with, especial die-hard fans of AWIT, is that most of the book is centered around Meg and her internal dialogues. Her POV is very heavily personal-experience driven, and that's very hard to do visually. For instance, Meg doesn't like tesseracting in the books, because her body goes numb, and it feels like her entire body has been asleep. Coming out of the tesseract is the reverse of that process. So...how do you *show* that in a film? You can't. But the image in people's heads who have read book think they have ways to portray that sort of thing, but it's only relevant to themselves. And when they don't see it on the big screen, I think they get a little angsty and disappointed. I was not disappointed, and I understand a lot of the choices they had to make to bring such a book to the screen. Some wishes for the movie:
The Aunt Beast sequence I feel would have been very important. It was a game-changer that would have given the audience a moment to see Meg turn herself around. I think the trauma and recovery would have been a good sequence to have. I think Meg's sudden self-empowerment is a bit too sudden.The ending fight in the giant...brain?...of IT felt over too fast. The book does it masterfully with a lot of buildup to Meg's sudden realization of the weapon she has that IT does not. I think skipping that important point damaged the ending, and her screams of "I love you!" lost a bit of their edge. And I really loved the line in the book about "She could stand there, and she could love Charles Wallace." I wish they had incorporated that somehow, because it always brings me a smile at that turning point. I don't think they visually gave her that realization and turning point. They just focused on her faults and then love, and then suddenly Charles Wallace was free.Central Central intelligence was tossed in there, but was never really explained as to what it meant. I think either an entire removal of the concept, or an explanation would have been better than just a throwaway line for the fans.Man With the Red Eyes wasn't nearly as menacing enough. Too jolly, not enough bite.More emphasis on the mind-control that was happening with IT. The heart-beating rhythm wasn't emphasized enough.In the prison room, I feel Calvin was underutilized. He was essential to distracting Charles Wallace, so that Meg could use Mrs. Who's glasses to get inside the prison in the book. I wished they had had a better confrontation between Calvin and Charles Wallace, the kind of mental battle I thought would have spiced up that scene a bit more.I gave it 9 stars due to the wishes, but I thought it was a great movie.

I enjoyed this movie. If I'd read the other reviews before I watched it I probably wouldn't have bothered! I haven't read the book so maybe that makes a difference. Anyway, worth a look in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: I signed up for IMDb to leave this review
reviews.content: A Wrinkle in Time? More like a Wrinkle in my Attention Span. Movie? Boring. Child actors? Terrible. Sense? None.Disney, you've managed to out underdo yourself.

Yayyyyyyy! Another great dystopian novel with a half assed movie. Don't get me wrong the costumes are beautiful and the casting was pretty good, but it just didn't make any sense! I get what they were trying to go for with the whole « It » takes many forms, but doing it that way took out a very important part of the movie. First of all « IT » was supposed to have taken over the country camazotz. And what was with the weird storm when they got to camazotz. Their were so many little details missed that were like an afterthought, which is weird because Disney is usually very detailed. The craziest thing about this movie is that Disney forgot the actual point of the book/movie. At camazotz everyone had the same things and did the same things at the same time. The point of the book was to point out that our differences make us better and happier and more interesting people. Overal the movie felt rushed and all over the place as if they were trying to cram as much as they could in within the time frame. Disney could have done so much better « the original and the remake ». Third times the charm Disney!PS. Almost worth it to watch just for the costumes!
This is not the story I remember reading when I was a kid.

Dr Who classic meets Oprah. No spoilers here, there is nothing to spoil

One thing that should be noted when making a book into a movie is that it should offer something to fans of the book and also be friendly to someone who hasn't read the book. I have never read the book. Going into the movie, I expect it to tell me what exactly is happening, not assume I know what's up from the book. While watching, I just felt like I was missing huge chunks of information. I knew nothing of what was happening or of the world this story took place in. I assume we are supposed to know as much as the main character, Meg, who seemed to know nothing as well. That said, she was much more... "accepting" of what was happening than I was. I don't know what Meg is like in the book, but in this movies, she is just an awfully boring and passive character. She obviously doesn't want to be on the adventure, but she also doesn't resist it. she just lets it happen and shows little reaction to any of it. Even when she is showing emotion, if you can call it that, it's so forced. I don't know if they cast the wrong actress or the script was written poorly, I just know what I see and it sucks. It especially disappointing because they used a black girl. They could have written her so much better, gotten in some meaningful representation. I don't want to relate to Meg. She's a flat character and offers positive qualities to the table.Going back to not knowing anything about the story, I didn't even know what was happening half the time. Who are the weird ladies? Who is Whatsit's boyfriend?? Is this about time travel???? I just didn't know. Not to mention that they presented the strange ladies as important characters that just left the kids on their own??? And why are they named what they are named? Why did Charles Wallace know them? And now to move into the petty problems I have. Starting with names.Charles Wallace. I assume this is more an issue carried over from the book. In which case, I criticize the book as well! I get it, OK? people can have two first names. My mom and some of her siblings have two first names. But no one goes around using both of them. That's such a mouthful, and an earful. I don't want to hear them yelling that kids name over an over and over again, its long and annoying and frankly unnecessary. Just pick one! Or better yet, just give the kid a nickname! And Calvin? He added nothing to the story other than some heterosexual tension. And there shouldn't be ANY sexual tension cause these are kids and also there is no time for that, they are on a mission. Also, I just don't like his name. It's not a bad name. I just don't like it. It doesn't suit him.Secondly, oh, and this is truly my favorite. Ms Who? And her only speaking in quotes? Because she's too smart to think up her own words? First of all, that sounds pretentious. Secondly, it sounds stupid. It doesn't make her seems smart. It makes her seem... what's the word? I don't know but not coming up with an original thought and instead opting to use famous quotes is the most unintelligible thing I have ever heard. I'd have been fine if she did not have the ability to use her own words, sort of an echolalia situation, because that adds something meaningful to the character, maybe someone can relate to that. But that is not the case. She is capable of original thought and chooses not it. And some of the quotes she uses are so cryptic! Its more cryptic than cryptic can even be! But that just might be me being stupid. But if I recall, this is a kids movie. I would hope they could make the quotes easy for kids to follow along to.I think the message of the story is to love yourself and know that you deserve to be loved by others but... I only got that through what Meg said to her brother? The message was barely shown in the movie, at least not in any meaningful way. You had bits and pieces where Oprah told Meg that so many things had to happen for her to be born just the way she was, but it seemed like a passing moment. That it would not be a major thing. And it never was. I didn't feel Meg's struggle to love herself. She was always more caught up on her father and anything she said about not liking herself was just words. It wasn't until the end that I thought, "Oh, that's the moral of the story?"All in all, I felt the movie really missed the mark. It's flaws left me uninterested in the movie and it really was a waste of time.
To much talking and cgi. You dont get to connect with the characters. The writing was horrible.
